original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya aashta sa ha sri ka pradzny'a p'a ra mi t'a ma rma koo mi ta n'a ma /
analyzed: a'arya aashta sa ha sri ka pradzny'a p'a ra mi t'a ma rma koo mi ta n'a ma /
translated: Arya-Astasahasrika-prajnaparamita-marma-komayati-nama

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i 'grel pa gnad kyi zla ba'i 'od ces bya ba /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i 'grel pa gnad kyi zla ba'i 'od ces bya ba /
translated: The Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines called the Light of the Moon of Essential Points

original: bcom ldan 'das mi pham mgon po la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mi pham mgon po la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed, Invincible Protector.

original: gang zhig 'od zer snying gi mun las rgyal nas spros med lnga po phung por gyur pa ste //
analyzed: gang zhig 'od zer snying gi mun las rgyal nas spros med lnga po phung por gyur pa ste //
translated: He who, having conquered the darkness of the heart with light rays, became the aggregate of the five unelaborate ones,

original: gang la shar na sems kyi rtog pa'i rnyog pa bsal bar gyur nas sa la longs spyod pa //
analyzed: gang la shar na sems kyi rtog pa'i rnyog pa bsal bar gyur nas sa la longs spyod pa //
translated: When he arose, having cleared away the turbidity of mental concepts and enjoyed the earth,

original: de yis rdzogs pa'i byang chub bde ba 'gro la bskyed phyir bsam mi khyab pa'i sku sprul pa'i //
analyzed: de yis rdzogs pa'i byang chub bde ba 'gro la bskyed phyir bsam mi khyab pa'i sku sprul pa'i //
translated: He emanated an inconceivable body in order to generate the bliss of perfect enlightenment in beings.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa srid par 'khyams pa 'jig byed de la gus par phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa srid par 'khyams pa 'jig byed de la gus par phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: I respectfully pay homage to the Perfection of Wisdom, the destroyer of wandering in existence,

original: yid kyi dri ma bshig cing lta ba ngan pa 'joms byed la //
analyzed: yid kyi dri ma bshig cing lta ba ngan pa 'joms byed la //
translated: Destroying mental stains and conquering wrong views,

original: skye ba'i rnyog pa'i yal ga ma lus nges par drung 'byin la //
analyzed: skye ba'i rnyog pa'i yal ga ma lus nges par drung 'byin la //
translated: And uproot the branches of the mire of birth.

original: che mchog rtog med rdzogs sangs sa na gnyis med lam gnyen gyi //
analyzed: che mchog rtog med rdzogs sangs sa na gnyis med lam gnyen gyi //
translated: The supreme great one, the perfect Buddha, on the path of non-conceptuality,

original: 'od zer brtse bas brlan char ji lta bur na ston pa yi //
analyzed: 'od zer brtse bas brlan char ji lta bur na ston pa yi //
translated: With the rain of loving rays, how can he not teach?

original: gang yang 'phags pa mi pham bstan bcos de nyid bral ba'i gzhung gis kun tu tshim min pas //
analyzed: gang yang 'phags pa mi pham bstan bcos de nyid bral ba'i gzhung gis kun tu tshim min pas //
translated: Those who are not satisfied by the treatise of the noble Ajita, which is free from suchness,

original: @2a * // yum gyi gnad las phyir phyogs log pa'i lam gyis skye bo phal che yun rings 'khyams gyur pas //üîΩde phyir nang gi mun pas khyab pa'i rgyun gyis 'phrog byed bstan bcos snying po la reg pa'i //
analyzed: @2a * // yum gyi gnad las phyir phyogs log pa'i lam gyis skye bo phal che yun rings 'khyams gyur pas // de phyir nang gi mun pas khyab pa'i rgyun gyis 'phrog byed bstan bcos snying po la reg pa'i //
translated: The great beings who have turned away from the vital points of the mother, wander for a long time on the wrong path.üîΩTherefore, I, who have reached the essence of the treatise that removes the darkness of the inner continuum,

original: legs gsungs sbyangs pa'i bdud rtsi'i gter ldan bdag gis de gnad yang dag gsal byed zla 'od spro //
analyzed: legs gsungs sbyangs pa'i bdud rtsi'i gter ldan bdag gis de gnad yang dag gsal byed zla 'od spro //
translated: Will spread the moonlight that illuminates the vital points of the well-spoken nectar treasure of training.

original: 'dir nges par bcom ldan 'das kyis bskal pa rab 'byam mang po dpag tu med cing rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa phan tshun du spyod pa rnams dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa dag gis kun tu rtog pa'i dra ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyun drungs phyung nas mu med pa'i phyogs thams cad kyi khams gsum pa rnams kyi srog chags dpag tu med pa rnams kyi so so'i sems skad cig
analyzed: 'dir nges par bcom ldan 'das kyis bskal pa rab 'byam mang po dpag tu med cing rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa phan tshun du spyod pa rnams dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa dag gis kun tu rtog pa'i dra ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyun drungs phyung nas mu med pa'i phyogs thams cad kyi khams gsum pa rnams kyi srog chags dpag tu med pa rnams kyi so so'i sems skad cig
translated: saw the individual minds of countless sentient beings in all the limitless directions of the three realms.

original: la gzigs nas mchog tu brtse ba chen po'i gzhan gyi dbang gi ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyis rtogs par bzhed nas bstan pa ji lta ba de lta bur sdud pa pos bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: la gzigs nas mchog tu brtse ba chen po'i gzhan gyi dbang gi ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyis rtogs par bzhed nas bstan pa ji lta ba de lta bur sdud pa pos bsdus pa ni /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, wishing for sentient beings to realize that which is realized through the power of supreme great compassion, taught it. The compiler compiled it in that way.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / mngon par bstod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis te 'di nyid du zhes pa la sogs pa dang / de la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni sdud pa po'i rang bzo ma yin pas bcom ldan 'das kyi @2b bka' nyid du bshed de /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / mngon par bstod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis te 'di nyid du zhes pa la sogs pa dang / de la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni sdud pa po'i rang bzo ma yin pas bcom ldan 'das kyi @2b bka' nyid du bshed de /
translated: The passage beginning Thus have I heard and ending with I praise is not the invention of the compiler, but is the word of the Bhagavat himself, as is shown by the passage beginning right here and ending with the Bhagavat said.

original: chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /
analyzed: chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /
translated: The Dharmasamgiti-sutra says,

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes byas nas chos bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes byas nas chos bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Having said Thus have I heard, one should collect the Dharma.

original: de bzhin du 'bral ba dang go rims kyis bshad do zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bral ba dang go rims kyis bshad do zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
translated: Similarly, it is explained by the order of the words separation and so on.

original: 'di sdud pa po ni lcang lo can na bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos bcu'i dbang phyug phyag na rdo rje ste /
analyzed: 'di sdud pa po ni lcang lo can na bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos bcu'i dbang phyug phyag na rdo rje ste /
translated: The compiler is the great bodhisattva Vajrapani, lord of the tenth stage, who resides in the Alakavati paradise.

original: de yang bskal pa bzang po'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku dang chos kyi sku srung bar dbang bskur nas rting la rjes su gshegs zhes de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bstan pa'i mdo las bshad pa dang / phyag na rdo rje dbang bskur ba'i mdo las bstan pa so sor gtad pas so //
analyzed: de yang bskal pa bzang po'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku dang chos kyi sku srung bar dbang bskur nas rting la rjes su gshegs zhes de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bstan pa'i mdo las bshad pa dang / phyag na rdo rje dbang bskur ba'i mdo las bstan pa so sor gtad pas so //
translated: And it is explained in the VajrapƒÅ·πái Abhisa·πÉbodhi S≈´tra that the TathƒÅgatas entrust the teachings to the bodhisattvas.

original: gang yang 'phags pa kun dga' bo la yongs su gtad pa de ni nyan thos rnams kyis kyang 'jig rten pa la spyod par byed pa'i don du yin gyi //
analyzed: gang yang 'phags pa kun dga' bo la yongs su gtad pa de ni nyan thos rnams kyis kyang 'jig rten pa la spyod par byed pa'i don du yin gyi //
translated: As for the entrustment to ƒÄrya ƒÄnanda, that was for the purpose of the hearers engaging in worldly conduct.

original: chos sdud pa'i don du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos sdud pa'i don du ni ma yin no //
translated: It was not for the purpose of gathering the teachings.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa dang / 'phags pa phyag na rdo rjes 'jig rten thams cad rjes su gzung ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsdu bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa dang / 'phags pa phyag na rdo rjes 'jig rten thams cad rjes su gzung ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsdu bar 'dod nas /
translated: Here, the BhagavƒÅn taught final nirvƒÅ·πáa, and ƒÄrya VajrapƒÅ·πái, desiring to gather the perfection of wisdom in order to care for all worlds,

original: 'phags pa byams pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshogs rnams la 'di skad ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshogs rnams la 'di skad ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To the assembly of bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas such as the noble Maitreya, he said, Thus have I heard, and so on.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa po las thos pa cig kyang rjes su brjod cing de bzhin du yang las gzhan yang nyan par byed do zhes pa ni sdud pa por brjod do //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa po las thos pa cig kyang rjes su brjod cing de bzhin du yang las gzhan yang nyan par byed do zhes pa ni sdud pa por brjod do //
translated: Having heard it from the teacher just as it is, he also repeats it and listens to it in the same way. This is stated as the compiler.

original: bsdus pa'i rjes la dus der gnas pa nyid na /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rjes la dus der gnas pa nyid na /
translated: After the compilation, at that time, he abides in the essence of the Dharma.

original: mchog tu zab cing rjes su rtogs par dka' la rtogs par mi nus zhes pas thugs rjes de rtogs pa'i don du 'phags pa byams pas mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi tshig le 'ur byas pa'i bstan bcos kyis gsal bar mdzad kyi /
analyzed: mchog tu zab cing rjes su rtogs par dka' la rtogs par mi nus zhes pas thugs rjes de rtogs pa'i don du 'phags pa byams pas mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi tshig le 'ur byas pa'i bstan bcos kyis gsal bar mdzad kyi /
translated: Supremely profound, difficult to realize, and impossible to comprehend - with compassion, in order to realize that, the noble Maitreya clarified it with the treatise composed in verses of the Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: 'phags pa thogs med kyis byas nas dus phyis byas zhes pa ni seng ge bzang po la sogs pa rnams kyi 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med kyis byas nas dus phyis byas zhes pa ni seng ge bzang po la sogs pa rnams kyi 'khrul pa ste /
translated: It is a mistake for Haribhadra and others to say, Having been composed by the noble Asanga, it was composed later.

original: sngon du byas pa la ma bshad ces pa ni gzhan dag gi'o //
analyzed: sngon du byas pa la ma bshad ces pa ni gzhan dag gi'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot explained previously‚Äù refers to the other commentaries.

original: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par 'byed par 'dod nas /
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par 'byed par 'dod nas /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, wishing to analyze the perfection of wisdom,

original: mchog tu bla ma rnams kyi yang bla na med pa ni bla ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rab tu dang bas phyag 'tshal ba shin tu don che ba'i phyir dang / rnam par bshad par bya ba'i mdo sde rin po che brjod @3a * //
analyzed: mchog tu bla ma rnams kyi yang bla na med pa ni bla ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rab tu dang bas phyag 'tshal ba shin tu don che ba'i phyir dang / rnam par bshad par bya ba'i mdo sde rin po che brjod @3a * //
translated: first paid homage to the guru of the gurus, the unsurpassed guru, because he is the guru, and because the homage of one who has faith is of great significance, and because he is the one who should speak the precious s≈´tra that is to be explained.

original: par bya ba'i phyir na de nyid la dang po phyag 'tshal ba ni /
analyzed: par bya ba'i phyir na de nyid la dang po phyag 'tshal ba ni /
translated: The homage is as follows:üîΩThe one who guides those ≈õrƒÅvakas who seek peace through complete knowledge,

original: nyan thos zhi ba tshol rnams kun shes nyid kyis nyer zhir khrid mdzad gang yin dang // 'gro la phan par byed rnams lam shes nyid kyis 'jig rten don sgrub mdzad pa gang //
analyzed: nyan thos zhi ba tshol rnams kun shes nyid kyis nyer zhir khrid mdzad gang yin dang // 'gro la phan par byed rnams lam shes nyid kyis 'jig rten don sgrub mdzad pa gang //
translated: and the one who accomplishes the aims of the world through path knowledge for those who benefit beings,

original: gang dang yang dag ldan pas thub rnams sna tshogs rnam pa 'di dag kun gsung ba'i //
analyzed: gang dang yang dag ldan pas thub rnams sna tshogs rnam pa 'di dag kun gsung ba'i //
translated: the one endowed with which the sages speak all these various aspects,

original: nyan thos byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs bcas sangs rgyas kyi yum de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: nyan thos byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs bcas sangs rgyas kyi yum de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to that mother of the buddhas, together with the hosts of ≈õrƒÅvakas and bodhisattvas.

original: ci ste nye bar zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: ci ste nye bar zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: If one asks why, it is because nirvƒÅ·πáa is peace.

original: thar bar 'tshal ba'i nyan thos rnams dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang bsdu ste /
analyzed: thar bar 'tshal ba'i nyan thos rnams dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang bsdu ste /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas who seek liberation are included,

original: de dag gi theg pa las khyad par chung ba'i phyir na rim pa gcig tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi theg pa las khyad par chung ba'i phyir na rim pa gcig tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their vehicles are of little distinction, and they are taught in one sequence.

original: 'gro la phan par byed pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'gro la phan par byed pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
translated: The benefit of beings is the bodhisattvas‚Äô.

original: rnam pa 'di dag sna tshogs zhes pa ni thub pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi chos so //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag sna tshogs zhes pa ni thub pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi chos so //
translated: These various aspects are the dharmas of the Sage in all their aspects.

original: gang dang ldan pas rnam pa 'di dag kun gsung zhes pa 'dis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gsal bar byas la /
analyzed: gang dang ldan pas rnam pa 'di dag kun gsung zhes pa 'dis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gsal bar byas la /
translated: By this statement, ‚ÄúEndowed with which, he speaks of all these aspects,‚Äù the perfection of wisdom, which is the essence of omniscience, is clarified.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom itself is threefold:

original: gang phung po lnga rnams mi rtag par rnam par shes pa'i slob ma dang bse ru dag dang / gang yang slob ma dang bse ru de rnams kyi dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi rnam pa rnams shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang /
analyzed: gang phung po lnga rnams mi rtag par rnam par shes pa'i slob ma dang bse ru dag dang / gang yang slob ma dang bse ru de rnams kyi dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi rnam pa rnams shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang /
translated: The disciples and rhinoceroses who know that the five aggregates are impermanent, and also the disciples and rhinoceroses, and the bodhisattvas who know the aspects of the bodhisattva path,

original: gang yang de rnams kyis rtogs pa'i rnam pa de rnams mkhyen pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni sangs rgyas rnams te /
analyzed: gang yang de rnams kyis rtogs pa'i rnam pa de rnams mkhyen pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni sangs rgyas rnams te /
translated: and also the knowledge of the aspects that they realize, the knowledge of all aspects, is the buddhas.

original: de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'o //
analyzed: de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'o //
translated: It is in their perfection of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhes pa ni bskyed pa nyid la gcig pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhes pa ni bskyed pa nyid la gcig pa'i tshig go //
translated: The buddhas, who are the producers, are the single entity.

original: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dang bcas pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yum ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dang bcas pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yum ste /
translated: The buddhas together with the assemblies of disciples and bodhisattvas are the mothers,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i don chen po thob par byed pas so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i don chen po thob par byed pas so //
translated: because they cause the attainment of the great meaning that is explained.

original: de thob nas kyang zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can du bdag gis dngos po bskyed pa dang rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: de thob nas kyang zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can du bdag gis dngos po bskyed pa dang rgyas par byed do //
translated: Having attained that, I generate and expand the entities that have the nature of the five undefiled aggregates.

original: de bas na yul 'dzin pa por rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yul 'dzin pa por rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood as the apprehender of objects.

original: de ltar kun mkhyen pa gsum gyis mngon par rtogs pa gzhan lnga po rnams bsdus pa'i brgyad car gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar kun mkhyen pa gsum gyis mngon par rtogs pa gzhan lnga po rnams bsdus pa'i brgyad car gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, the five other realizations are included in the three omnisciences. The perfection of wisdom of all eight is called the five.

original: de nyid chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen @3b po'i rtogs pa pa'i dbye ba la dgongs nas /
analyzed: de nyid chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen @3b po'i rtogs pa pa'i dbye ba la dgongs nas /
translated: With the intention of dividing them into small, medium, and great realizations,

original: kun mkhyen pa gsum gyi sgo nas phyag 'tshal nas /
analyzed: kun mkhyen pa gsum gyi sgo nas phyag 'tshal nas /
translated: having paid homage through the three omnisciences,

original: gzhan gdul bya 'jug pa'i yan lag brjod par bya ba la sogs pa brjod par 'dod pas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gdul bya 'jug pa'i yan lag brjod par bya ba la sogs pa brjod par 'dod pas gsungs pa ni /
translated: the one who wishes to speak about the other limbs for engaging the disciples, such as the topic, and so on, says:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid lam //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid lam //
translated: The path of omniscience in all aspects

original: ston pas 'dir ni bshad pa gang //
analyzed: ston pas 'dir ni bshad pa gang //
translated: is taught here by the Teacher.

original: blo dang ldan pas mthong 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas mthong 'gyur gyi //
translated: The wise will see it,

original: gzhan gyis myong ba ma yin zhes //
analyzed: gzhan gyis myong ba ma yin zhes //
translated: but not by others.

original: chos spyod bcu yi bdag nyid can //
analyzed: chos spyod bcu yi bdag nyid can //
translated: The nature of the ten Dharma activities.

original: mdo don dran pa la bzhag nas //
analyzed: mdo don dran pa la bzhag nas //
translated: Having set the meaning of the sutra in memory,

original: bde blag tu ni rtogs 'gyur ba //
analyzed: bde blag tu ni rtogs 'gyur ba //
translated: it will be easily understood.

original: zhes bya rtsom pa'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya rtsom pa'i dgos pa'o //
translated: This is the purpose of composition.

original: zhes te / bgrod par bya bas lam zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes te / bgrod par bya bas lam zhes pa ste /
translated: The path is so called because it is to be traversed.

original: gtso bo ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'bras bu sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: gtso bo ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'bras bu sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The principal one is the omniscience of the buddhas, the fruition dharmakaya.

original: ji skad du mdo sde rgyan las /üîΩsgrib pa thams cad spangs pa yi //
analyzed: ji skad du mdo sde rgyan las / sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa yi //
translated: As the Ornament of the Sutras teaches:üîΩHaving abandoned all obscurations,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen thob pa'i //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen thob pa'i //
translated: attaining omniscience,

original: rin chen sgrom phye lta bu la //
analyzed: rin chen sgrom phye lta bu la //
translated: like opening a precious chest,

original: sangs rgyas nyid du yang dag brjod //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du yang dag brjod //
translated: it is rightly called buddhahood.

original: ces so // 'dis bgrod par byed ces pas na lam rnams sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu phal pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de khongs su ji ltar rigs par mngon par rtogs pa drug 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: ces so // 'dis bgrod par byed ces pas na lam rnams sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu phal pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de khongs su ji ltar rigs par mngon par rtogs pa drug 'dus pa'o //
translated: Since it is what causes one to traverse, the paths are the causes of buddhahood, the omniscience of all aspects. The six realizations are included in that.

original: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can gyi mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi ngo bo'i lam shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo sde rin po che rjod par byed pa'i brjod par bya ba de byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pa rnams kyis khong
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can gyi mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi ngo bo'i lam shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo sde rin po che rjod par byed pa'i brjod par bya ba de byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pa rnams kyis khong
translated: Thus, the subject matter that expresses the precious sutra of the perfection of wisdom, the path whose nature is the eight realizations that have the nature of cause and effect, is not comprehended by those who are not bodhisattvas.

original: du mi chud pas na blo dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: du mi chud pas na blo dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: Therefore, the wise are bodhisattvas.

original: mngon sum du byed par 'gyur zhes pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du byed par 'gyur zhes pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey will actualize‚Äù is the ultimate purpose.

original: de yang mdo'i don ji skad du bshad pa'i brjod par bya ba thos pa nyid bsam pas dran pa la bzhag cing /
analyzed: de yang mdo'i don ji skad du bshad pa'i brjod par bya ba thos pa nyid bsam pas dran pa la bzhag cing /
translated: Moreover, the subject matter explained in the sutra is heard and then placed in the memory through reflection.

original: chos ni sems bskyed pa dang gdams ngag la sogs pa rnam pa bcu'i khongs su gtogs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa brgyad rab tu phye ba de'i spyod pa spyad pa rnams kyis bde blag tu rjes su gnas par 'gyur zhes brjod par bya ba thob pa byed pa'i
analyzed: chos ni sems bskyed pa dang gdams ngag la sogs pa rnam pa bcu'i khongs su gtogs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa brgyad rab tu phye ba de'i spyod pa spyad pa rnams kyis bde blag tu rjes su gnas par 'gyur zhes brjod par bya ba thob pa byed pa'i
translated: The Dharma is the eight realizations that belong to the ten categories such as the generation of the mind and the instructions, and the practice of the conduct of those who have opened up that Dharma.üîΩThe method of abiding in the means of attaining the statement that is to be made is

original: thabs la rjes su gnas pa ni mdo brtsam pa'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: thabs la rjes su gnas pa ni mdo brtsam pa'i dgos pa'o //
translated: the purpose of composing the s≈´tra.

original: 'brel pa ni brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid de go sla ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid de go sla ba kho na'o //
translated: The connection is the definition of the thing to be expressed and the expresser, and the definition of the thing to be established and the means of establishment, which are easy to understand.

original: 'di skad ces bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du bsdu bar bya zhes pa ste /üîΩgleng @4a * //
analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du bsdu bar bya zhes pa ste / gleng @4a * //
translated: This is called just as it is to be summarized.

original: gzhi'i go skabs yin gyi nye bar bsdu ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhi'i go skabs yin gyi nye bar bsdu ba ni ma yin te /
translated: This is the context of the nidƒÅna, not the summary,

original: mdo sde'i lus nyid 'di skad du'o //
analyzed: mdo sde'i lus nyid 'di skad du'o //
translated: because the body of the s≈´tra is like this.

original: bdag gis ni mngon sum du thos pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gis ni mngon sum du thos pa ste /
translated: I have heard directly.

original: bla ma las phan tshun brgyud pas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma las phan tshun brgyud pas ma yin pa'o //
translated: not from the teacher, but from one another.

original: de ltar 'dir gleng bslang ba bstan pa'i rjes su gleng gzhi dang dus gang dang yul dang ston pa po dang 'khor gyis 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir gleng bslang ba bstan pa'i rjes su gleng gzhi dang dus gang dang yul dang ston pa po dang 'khor gyis 'dus pa ste /
translated: Thus, here, after the introduction, the setting is taught, namely, the time, the place, the teacher, and the assembly.

original: de la dus gcig na zhes pa nas brtsams te ji srid du kun dga' bo zhes pa'i bar ni go skabs la /
analyzed: de la dus gcig na zhes pa nas brtsams te ji srid du kun dga' bo zhes pa'i bar ni go skabs la /
translated: The phrase at one time is the occasion, from the beginning up to ƒÄnanda.

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas nye bar bsdu ba bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas zhes pa la sogs pa'i lhag ma ma lus pa ni mdo sde'i lus so //
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas nye bar bsdu ba bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas zhes pa la sogs pa'i lhag ma ma lus pa ni mdo sde'i lus so //
translated: The phrase again and so forth is the conclusion, the remainder of the text from the BhagavƒÅn having spoken thus and so forth is the body of the s≈´tra.

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di nyid gsungs zhes ma bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das la rnam par rtog pa med pas don dam par ni bstan pa mi srid ces pa la dgongs la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di nyid gsungs zhes ma bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das la rnam par rtog pa med pas don dam par ni bstan pa mi srid ces pa la dgongs la /
translated: The phrase why did the BhagavƒÅn teach this? is not taught because the BhagavƒÅn is free from conceptualization, and it is intended that ultimately teaching is impossible.

original: bstan pa'i snang ba ni gdul bya rnams kyi bsod nams dang bcom ldan 'das kyi sngon gyi smon lam gyi bdag po yis so //
analyzed: bstan pa'i snang ba ni gdul bya rnams kyi bsod nams dang bcom ldan 'das kyi sngon gyi smon lam gyi bdag po yis so //
translated: The light of the teaching is due to the merit of those to be trained and the power of the Lord's former vows.

original: gang du byas pa dang thos pa'i khyad par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gang du byas pa dang thos pa'i khyad par bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the difference between what was done and what was heard will be explained.

original: dus gcig ni dus gcig la ste 'dis ni gdul bya rnams chos 'di la gus pa bskyed pa'i don dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lan cig gsungs pa la bdag nyid thos pa 'dzin pa nyid du gsal bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: dus gcig ni dus gcig la ste 'dis ni gdul bya rnams chos 'di la gus pa bskyed pa'i don dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lan cig gsungs pa la bdag nyid thos pa 'dzin pa nyid du gsal bar byas pa'o //
translated: At one time means at one time. This is for the purpose of generating respect for this teaching in those to be trained, and to make it clear that the Lord spoke it only once, and that he himself is the holder of the teachings.

original: bdud bzhi bcom pa dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: bdud bzhi bcom pa dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: He is the Lord because he possesses the destruction of the four demons.

original: nges par brjod pa lan phyi ma'o //
analyzed: nges par brjod pa lan phyi ma'o //
translated: This is the second etymology.

original: yang na bdud bzhi po rnams shes rab kyis bcom pas na bcom pa ste /
analyzed: yang na bdud bzhi po rnams shes rab kyis bcom pas na bcom pa ste /
translated: Or else, he is the destroyer because he has destroyed the four demons by means of his wisdom.

original: byed pa'i nges pa'i tshig lan phyi ma'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i nges pa'i tshig lan phyi ma'o //
translated: This is the second etymology of the word bhagavat.

original: 'byed par byed ces pas bcom pa ste /
analyzed: 'byed par byed ces pas bcom pa ste /
translated: He is the destroyer because he splits them apart.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das sam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das sam /
translated: He is the Lord because he possesses that perfection of wisdom.

original: mngon par bstan zhes pas bcom ldan 'das sam /
analyzed: mngon par bstan zhes pas bcom ldan 'das sam /
translated: The word ‚Äúmanifests‚Äù indicates the Bhagavat.

original: bstan par byed pa la ni rgyu rnams kho na byed pa nyid rnam par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan par byed pa la ni rgyu rnams kho na byed pa nyid rnam par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The causes alone are considered to be the agent of manifestation.üîΩMoreover, the collection is sixfold: sovereignty, beauty, fame, glory,

original: de yang tshogs pa dbang phyug dang gzugs bzang dang grags pa dang dpal dang ye shes dang brtson 'grus dang drug go //
analyzed: de yang tshogs pa dbang phyug dang gzugs bzang dang grags pa dang dpal dang ye shes dang brtson 'grus dang drug go //
translated: knowledge, and effort.

original: de la dbang phyug ni gzhan dbang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la dbang phyug ni gzhan dbang ma yin pa ste /
translated: Sovereignty is the absence of dependence on others.

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i tshogs pas bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i tshogs pas bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Bhagavat is the collection of those because he has abandoned all obscurations together with their traces.

original: gzugs kyi tshogs pa ni bla na med pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad kyis lham me ba'i @4b ska'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi tshogs pa ni bla na med pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad kyis lham me ba'i @4b ska'i phyir ro //
translated: The collection of beauty is the splendor of the unsurpassed major and minor marks.

original: grags pa'i tshogs pa ni phyogs su sgra chen po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grags pa'i tshogs pa ni phyogs su sgra chen po'i phyir ro //
translated: The collection of fame is the great fame that extends in all directions.

original: gang yang phun sum tshogs pa mang po gang gi rten du gyur pa de ni dpal gyi tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang phun sum tshogs pa mang po gang gi rten du gyur pa de ni dpal gyi tshogs pa ste /
translated: The collection of glory is that on which many perfections depend.

original: 'jig rten pa thams cad la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i 'dod pa rnams kyi dpal du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa thams cad la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i 'dod pa rnams kyi dpal du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the glory of all mundane perfections, and of the supramundane perfections that are desired.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs pa ni thams cad nas rnam pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la dag cing ma chags shing ma thogs pa'i ye shes kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs pa ni thams cad nas rnam pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la dag cing ma chags shing ma thogs pa'i ye shes kyi phyir ro //
translated: The accumulation of knowledge is stated as ‚Äúin all ways, in all modes,‚Äù because of the knowledge that is pure, unattached, and unobstructed.

original: brtson 'grus kyi tshogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyi don la rtag par mi dga' ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi tshogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyi don la rtag par mi dga' ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The accumulation of effort is stated as ‚Äúin all ways, always,‚Äù because of the absence of discouragement in working for the welfare of others.

original: bzhugs so zhes pa ni 'dir so sor sdud par byed cing sems can 'dis 'dren par byed ces pas cho 'phrul la /
analyzed: bzhugs so zhes pa ni 'dir so sor sdud par byed cing sems can 'dis 'dren par byed ces pas cho 'phrul la /
translated: ‚ÄúAbides‚Äù means that he is the leader of beings, because he gathers them and guides them.

original: cho 'phrul de nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: cho 'phrul de nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: This miracle is threefold:

original: rdzu 'phrul dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'o //
translated: the miracle of psychic power, the miracle of reading others‚Äô minds, and the miracle of teaching the Dharma.

original: de la rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis 'jig rten las 'das shing rmad du byung ba'i chos ston pa'i phyir dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul gyis ni sems kyi bag la nyal yongs su mkhyen nas dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyas pa'i tshul gyis yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de la rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis 'jig rten las 'das shing rmad du byung ba'i chos ston pa'i phyir dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul gyis ni sems kyi bag la nyal yongs su mkhyen nas dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyas pa'i tshul gyis yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir dang /
translated: By means of the various miracles of supernormal knowledge, he teaches the Dharma that is supramundane and marvelous. By means of the miracle of telepathy, he knows the dormant tendencies of the mind and ripens beings by means of the method of increasing the roots of virtue.

original: rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis ni theg pa gsum gyi gdul bya'i sems can rnams khyad par du dran pa la sogs pa byas nas mngon par 'dod pa'i don byed pa'i spyod lam rnam pa bzhis gnas shing bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis ni theg pa gsum gyi gdul bya'i sems can rnams khyad par du dran pa la sogs pa byas nas mngon par 'dod pa'i don byed pa'i spyod lam rnam pa bzhis gnas shing bzhugs pa'o //
translated: By means of the miracle of instruction, he causes beings to be trained in the three vehicles to be especially mindful and so on, and he remains and abides in the four kinds of conduct that accomplish the desired goal.

original: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi thams cad du sku'i phrin las ni spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi thams cad du sku'i phrin las ni spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The activity of the body of the buddhas is everywhere, remaining in the conduct.

original: thams cad ni gsung gi phrin las ni chos ston pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni gsung gi phrin las ni chos ston pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The activity of speech is everywhere, remaining in the teaching of the Dharma.

original: gang rang bzhin gyis mnyam par bzhag pa dang / gang yang ting nge 'dzin mngon du byed pa'i de gnyis char thugs kyi phrin las te /
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gyis mnyam par bzhag pa dang / gang yang ting nge 'dzin mngon du byed pa'i de gnyis char thugs kyi phrin las te /
translated: The mental activity of one who is naturally in meditative equipoise and of one who manifests meditative stabilization are both mental activity.

original: de gnyis char snyoms par zhugs pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis char snyoms par zhugs pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He abides in both meditative equipoises.

original: gang sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis sems can rnams la kun tu gzugs pa nyid dang der nye bar 'gro ba'i sems can la dmigs pa'i thugs kyi phrin las de gnyis char nang du yang dag par 'jog pa la gnas par rnams par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis sems can rnams la kun tu gzugs pa nyid dang der nye bar 'gro ba'i sems can la dmigs pa'i thugs kyi phrin las de gnyis char nang du yang dag par 'jog pa la gnas par rnams par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The eye of the Buddha is the mental activity of one who looks upon sentient beings and of one who goes to them, and both of these are to be established as abiding in meditative equipoise.

original: 'jig rten la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are focused on the world.

original: rgyal po'i khab ces bya ba ni rgyal po chen po mang pos bkur ba'i rgyal po'i pho brang gi 'khor gyi grong khyer chen po ste /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab ces bya ba ni rgyal po chen po mang pos bkur ba'i rgyal po'i pho brang gi 'khor gyi grong khyer chen po ste /
translated: RƒÅjag·πõha is the great city that is the royal capital of MahƒÅsa·πÉmata.

original: de'i @5a * //
analyzed: de'i @5a * //
translated: On its

original: sa phyogs su bya rgod phung po ste /
analyzed: sa phyogs su bya rgod phung po ste /
translated: side is Vulture Peak.

original: rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin la /
analyzed: rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin la /
translated: It is made of various kinds of jewels.

original: ri ni lha la sogs pa rnams kyis dus tshigs ltad mo gsal bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ri ni lha la sogs pa rnams kyis dus tshigs ltad mo gsal bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mountain is so called because the gods and so on make the seasonal festivals clear.

original: mchod rten du gyur pas sems can rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs nye bar sogs pa'i don du gnas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mchod rten du gyur pas sems can rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs nye bar sogs pa'i don du gnas bstan pa'o //
translated: It is a stupa because it is the abode for the accumulation of the merit of sentient beings.

original: ci'i phyir rgyal po'i khab tu bstan ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rgyal po'i khab tu bstan ce na /
translated: Why is it called Rajagrha?

original: mang pos bkur ba chen po'i grong khyer chen po'i gnas nyid bzhin du /
analyzed: mang pos bkur ba chen po'i grong khyer chen po'i gnas nyid bzhin du /
translated: It is the abode of the great city of Mahasammata.

original: mdo sde 'di chos kyi rgyal po chen por sems can la gsal ba'i don du /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di chos kyi rgyal po chen por sems can la gsal ba'i don du /
translated: This sutra is the great king of Dharma, in order to make it clear to sentient beings.

original: 'dir yang mdo sde bstan pa gang bcom ldan 'das ma la rab tu bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang mdo sde bstan pa gang bcom ldan 'das ma la rab tu bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Here, the teaching of the sutra is well-established in the Blessed Lady.

original: ci'i phyir bya rgod phung po zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bya rgod phung po zhe na /
translated: Why is it called Vulture Peak?

original: nyan pa po rnams kyi bstan pa la ring nas mngon par 'phags pa nyid kyi gsal ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: nyan pa po rnams kyi bstan pa la ring nas mngon par 'phags pa nyid kyi gsal ba'i don du'o //
translated: It is in order to make clear to the listeners that the teaching is exalted from afar.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang grangs kyis che ba'i dag gis so //
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang grangs kyis che ba'i dag gis so //
translated: Great is because of the greatness of qualities and number.

original: nyon mongs pa bcom pa nyid kyis dge slong ni dgra bcom pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bcom pa nyid kyis dge slong ni dgra bcom pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúmonk‚Äù means one who has destroyed the afflictions.

original: de 'dir ma bzung bas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'phags pa kun dga' bo ma gzung bas na thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de 'dir ma bzung bas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'phags pa kun dga' bo ma gzung bas na thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: But if the noble ƒÄnanda, who is a stream-enterer, is not included, then the consequence is that the Buddha‚Äôs word would be interrupted.

original: cung zhig gang bsnyen par rdzogs pa de 'dir gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: cung zhig gang bsnyen par rdzogs pa de 'dir gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the one who is fully ordained should be understood as being included here.

original: dge slong rnams kyi dge 'dun gyi tshogs te /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyi dge 'dun gyi tshogs te /
translated: The community of monks is the community of the Buddha‚Äôs disciples.

original: de ci ltar dge 'dun zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar dge 'dun zhe na /
translated: How is it a community?

original: dkon mchog gsum la bdud la sogs pa rnams kyis mi phyed pa nyid kyi ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la bdud la sogs pa rnams kyis mi phyed pa nyid kyi ste /
translated: Because it cannot be divided by MƒÅra or anyone else with regard to the Three Jewels.

original: kun tu bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a community because it is completely victorious.

original: de la grangs kyi che ba nyid ni phyed ces te /
analyzed: de la grangs kyi che ba nyid ni phyed ces te /
translated: The greatness of its number is that it is half.

original: brgya phrag phyed ma tshang ba'i brgya phrag bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: brgya phrag phyed ma tshang ba'i brgya phrag bcu gsum mo //
translated: It is a community of more than 500 and less than 600.

original: 'dir thams cad ces pa la sogs pa'i tshig bco lngas ni yon tan gyi che ba nyid brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir thams cad ces pa la sogs pa'i tshig bco lngas ni yon tan gyi che ba nyid brjod do //
translated: Here, the greatness of its qualities is described by the fifteen words beginning with ‚Äúall.‚Äù

original: dgra ni nyon mongs pa ste de bcom pas dgra bcom pa'am /
analyzed: dgra ni nyon mongs pa ste de bcom pas dgra bcom pa'am /
translated: The word ‚Äúfoe‚Äù means affliction. One who has destroyed the foe is an arhat.

original: bsgrub pa'i mchod pa yang dag pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing mchod par byed pas mchod byed dam /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i mchod pa yang dag pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing mchod par byed pas mchod byed dam /
translated: They are worthy of offerings because they are worshipped and honored by the Tathagatas with the perfect worship of practice.

original: yang na lha dang mi rnams kyis mchod pa dang yon tan gyi 'os su gyur pas na mchod 'os so //
analyzed: yang na lha dang mi rnams kyis mchod pa dang yon tan gyi 'os su gyur pas na mchod 'os so //
translated: Or else, they are worthy of offerings because they are worthy of the offerings and praise of gods and humans.üîΩSimilarly, the qualities of arhatship are described as being common to all arhats.

original: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid kyi yon tan thabs cig pa nyid brjod pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo dang mnar med pa'i bar du kun tu zag pa byed cing skyed par byed pa'i ji srid du sems can rnams kyis dge ba g-yo ba'i zag pa gsum
analyzed: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid kyi yon tan thabs cig pa nyid brjod pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo dang mnar med pa'i bar du kun tu zag pa byed cing skyed par byed pa'i ji srid du sems can rnams kyis dge ba g-yo ba'i zag pa gsum
translated: The three contaminations of the realm of desire, the realm of form, and the formless realm are the contaminations of the three realms.

original: ste / de la ma rig pa ma rtogs pa 'dod pa na kun tu spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i @5b zag pa'o //
analyzed: ste / de la ma rig pa ma rtogs pa 'dod pa na kun tu spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i @5b zag pa'o //
translated: The contamination of the realm of desire is the afflictions that are active in the realm of desire, which are not understood due to ignorance.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med na kun tu spyod pa ni srid pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med na kun tu spyod pa ni srid pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: The contamination of existence is that which is active in the realms of form and the formless.

original: khams gsum pa can gyi lhan cig skyes pa dang kun tu brtags pa'i ma rig pa dang lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa can gyi lhan cig skyes pa dang kun tu brtags pa'i ma rig pa dang lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: The outflows of ignorance are the innate and imagined ignorance of the three realms and the sixty-two views.

original: 'di rnams zad pas na zag pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams zad pas na zag pa zad pa'o //
translated: The exhaustion of these is the exhaustion of the outflows.

original: zag pa zad pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa'i yon gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa'i yon gsungs pa ni /
translated: The qualities of purity due to the exhaustion of the outflows are stated:

original: nyon mongs pa med ces pa ste kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa dang / las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste go rims ji lta ba bzhin du gang gis nyon mongs par gyur pa dang / gang nyon mongs par byed cing sdug bsngal bar gyur pa dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med ces pa ste kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa dang / las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste go rims ji lta ba bzhin du gang gis nyon mongs par gyur pa dang / gang nyon mongs par byed cing sdug bsngal bar gyur pa dang /
translated: ‚Äúwithout afflictions,‚Äù i.e., without the afflictions of the afflictions, karma, and birth, respectively, by which one is afflicted, which afflict, and which are the afflictions.

original: gang du nyon mongs pa de rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du nyon mongs pa de rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are so called because those afflictions do not exist.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams nyon mongs pa med pa nyid la sdug bsngal med pas de'i yon tan gsungs pa ni dbang du gyur pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams nyon mongs pa med pa nyid la sdug bsngal med pas de'i yon tan gsungs pa ni dbang du gyur pa zhes pa ste /
translated: The absence of suffering due to the absence of the suffering of affliction is stated as a quality: ‚Äúhaving mastery,‚Äù

original: ji ltar rdzu 'phrul la dbang bas sems can dang snod dag la dbang sgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rdzu 'phrul la dbang bas sems can dang snod dag la dbang sgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have mastery over supernatural power, they control the world of sentient beings and the physical cosmos.

original: dbang po la dbang bas spyod lam nye bar zhi nas de rnams kyis 'jig rten la dbang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po la dbang bas spyod lam nye bar zhi nas de rnams kyis 'jig rten la dbang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have mastery over the faculties, they control the world of sentient beings and the physical cosmos.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang bas ni sems de rnams dbang du byed pa la 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang bas ni sems de rnams dbang du byed pa la 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have mastery over concentration, they control the mind.

original: shes rab la dbang bas ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang rnam par smin pa thams cad kun tu bcad nas 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba rnams par grol ba rnams bzhin du rang nyid la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab la dbang bas ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang rnam par smin pa thams cad kun tu bcad nas 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba rnams par grol ba rnams bzhin du rang nyid la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have mastery over wisdom, they control themselves, like those who are liberated, having completely severed all the afflictions, karma, and results of karma.

original: sems shin tu rnam par grol bas na sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par grol bas na sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: They have a well-liberated mind,

original: srid pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spong zhing thob par bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin rnams la snyoms par 'jug pa ni sems rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spong zhing thob par bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin rnams la snyoms par 'jug pa ni sems rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The mind is liberated through the attainment of the concentrations that abandon the afflictions and secondary afflictions of the side of existence.

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba ni shes rab rnam par grol bas ma rig pa'i phyogs kyi rnyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar gyur zhing dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi ye shes thob pa ni shes rab rnam par grol ba'o
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba ni shes rab rnam par grol bas ma rig pa'i phyogs kyi rnyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar gyur zhing dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi ye shes thob pa ni shes rab rnam par grol ba'o
translated: Wisdom is liberated through the attainment of the knowledge of the path of arhatship that abandons all afflictions and secondary afflictions of the side of ignorance.

original: // cang shes pa ni 'jigs pa rnams med pa ste /
analyzed: // cang shes pa ni 'jigs pa rnams med pa ste /
translated: The learned are fearless.

original: 'jigs pa'i dogs pa rnam pa bzhi med pas go rims ji lta ba bzhin du bde ba rnyed pa 'jigs pa med pa rnyed pa bag tsha ba med pa rnyed pa dbugs 'byin pa thob pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i dogs pa rnam pa bzhi med pas go rims ji lta ba bzhin du bde ba rnyed pa 'jigs pa med pa rnyed pa bag tsha ba med pa rnyed pa dbugs 'byin pa thob pa zhes brjod de /
translated: They are said to obtain happiness, obtain fearlessness, obtain freedom from anxiety, and obtain relief because they are free from the four types of anxiety.

original: de la mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba rnams med @6a * //
analyzed: de la mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba rnams med @6a * //
translated: There is no grief, lamentation, suffering, or mental anguish.

original: pa ni sdug bsngal gyi dogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni sdug bsngal gyi dogs pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no fear of suffering.

original: bdag nyid kyis gnod pa dang gzhan gyis skur pa 'debs pa dang ngan 'gro dang 'tsho ba chad pa dang mya ngan dang 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa rnams med pas 'jigs pa'i dogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis gnod pa dang gzhan gyis skur pa 'debs pa dang ngan 'gro dang 'tsho ba chad pa dang mya ngan dang 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa rnams med pas 'jigs pa'i dogs pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no fear of harm, of being blamed by others, of the miserable realms, of losing one's livelihood, of sorrow, or of death.

original: rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa dang grags pa dang ma grags pa dang bstod pa dang smad pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba rnams kyis rjes su ma gos pas na 'jig rten pa'i chos kyis dogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa dang grags pa dang ma grags pa dang bstod pa dang smad pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba rnams kyis rjes su ma gos pas na 'jig rten pa'i chos kyis dogs pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no fear of the worldly dharmas, because one is not defiled by gain and loss, fame and disgrace, praise and blame, pleasure and pain.

original: ye shes kyi yongs su sbyangs pa rnams la mi shes pa dang the tshom dang log pa'i shes pa rnams med pas na mi shes pa'i dogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi yongs su sbyangs pa rnams la mi shes pa dang the tshom dang log pa'i shes pa rnams med pas na mi shes pa'i dogs pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no fear of ignorance, because there is no ignorance, doubt, or wrong knowledge with regard to the purifications of wisdom.

original: de ltar dogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir na cang shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir na cang shes pa'o //
translated: He is a thoroughbred because he is free from such doubts.

original: glang po chen po ni gtso bo chen po ste /
analyzed: glang po chen po ni gtso bo chen po ste /
translated: He is a great elephant because he is a great leader.

original: rig pa gsum la sogs pa nyid kyis khyad par du gyur pa'i rtogs pa'i chos thos pas so //
analyzed: rig pa gsum la sogs pa nyid kyis khyad par du gyur pa'i rtogs pa'i chos thos pas so //
translated: He is one who has heard the Dharma of realization, which is distinguished by the three knowledges and so on.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa rnam pa gsum rig pa la ni gzhan dag tu de la rig pa gsum zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa rnam pa gsum rig pa la ni gzhan dag tu de la rig pa gsum zhes brjod do //
translated: He is one who has the three knowledges, because he has the three superknowledges of magical power, knowledge of others' minds, and knowledge of the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: bya ba byas pa ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab rnams yongs su rdzogs pas sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i bya ba nges par byas pas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas pa ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab rnams yongs su rdzogs pas sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i bya ba nges par byas pas so //
translated: He has done what was to be done, because he has accomplished the task of liberation from all suffering by perfecting morality, meditative absorption, and wisdom.

original: bya ba byed pa ni 'dod pa chung ba dang zhugs pa dang chog shes pa la 'jug pa dang sbyangs par grags pa la 'jug pa dang / kun tu mnyes par byed pa la 'jug pa zhes pa la sogs pa byed pa la rang gi mos pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa ni 'dod pa chung ba dang zhugs pa dang chog shes pa la 'jug pa dang sbyangs par grags pa la 'jug pa dang / kun tu mnyes par byed pa la 'jug pa zhes pa la sogs pa byed pa la rang gi mos pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The performance of action is the performance of action in the sense of engaging in few desires, in the sense of engaging in contentment, in the sense of engaging in austerity, in the sense of engaging in pleasing others, and so on, because one engages in them through ones own interest.

original: khur bor ba ni khur rnam pa bzhi ste de rnams bor ba ste /
analyzed: khur bor ba ni khur rnam pa bzhi ste de rnams bor ba ste /
translated: The laying down of the burden is the laying down of the four burdens.

original: de la phung po'i khur btang ste sdug bsngal yongs su shes pas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i bde ba thob pa la sbyor nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la phung po'i khur btang ste sdug bsngal yongs su shes pas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i bde ba thob pa la sbyor nus pa nyid do //
translated: The laying down of the burden of the aggregates is the ability to connect with the bliss of the absence of the remainder of the aggregates through fully understanding suffering.

original: nyon mongs pa'i khur spangs pas ni kun 'byung spangs pas rnam par grol ba'i bde ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i khur spangs pas ni kun 'byung spangs pas rnam par grol ba'i bde ba thob pa'o //
translated: The laying down of the burden of the afflictions is the attainment of the bliss of liberation through abandoning origination.

original: dam bcas pa'i khur bor bas ni 'gog pa mngon sum du byas pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub bde ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i khur bor bas ni 'gog pa mngon sum du byas pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub bde ba thob pa'o //
translated: The laying down of the burden of vows is the attainment of the bliss of complete enlightenment through manifesting cessation.

original: sbyor ba rtsom pa'i khur gyis yongs su rdzogs pa ni lam bsgoms pas nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba rtsom pa'i khur gyis yongs su rdzogs pa ni lam bsgoms pas nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba thob pa'o //
translated: The burden of undertaking the practice is completely fulfilled by attaining the bliss of pacification through cultivating the path.

original: khur bor ba nyid kyis khur bor nas bde ba thob pa'i yon tan gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: khur bor ba nyid kyis khur bor nas bde ba thob pa'i yon tan gsungs pa ni /
translated: The qualities of attaining bliss by casting off the burden are stated:

original: rang gi don rjes su thob pa zhes pa la /
analyzed: rang gi don rjes su thob pa zhes pa la /
translated: Having attained one's own goal...

original: rang gi don rjes su thob pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rang gi don rjes su thob pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Attaining one's own goal is twofold:

original: de la don min pa spong ba ni rang gi nyon mongs pa'i @6b ma rig pa spangs pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa dang don rtogs pas gang zhig gi rig pa bskyed nas mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la don min pa spong ba ni rang gi nyon mongs pa'i @6b ma rig pa spangs pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa dang don rtogs pas gang zhig gi rig pa bskyed nas mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: Abandoning what is not one's goal is abandoning all afflictive obstructions by abandoning one's own afflictive nescience, and realizing one's goal is generating the knowledge that realizes nirvana.

original: yongs su zad pa shes pa'i srid par kun tu sbyor ba ni dgu ste /
analyzed: yongs su zad pa shes pa'i srid par kun tu sbyor ba ni dgu ste /
translated: The knowledge of complete destruction of the nine bonds of existence

original: skyes bu srid par kun tu sbyor ba'i phyir ste /
analyzed: skyes bu srid par kun tu sbyor ba'i phyir ste /
translated: are the bonds of existence for a person.

original: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang the tshom dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / phrag dog dang ser sna de rnams gzhan du spangs pas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang the tshom dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / phrag dog dang ser sna de rnams gzhan du spangs pas so //
translated: Attachment, anger, pride, ignorance, doubt, the overesteeming of (1) morality and (2) certain types of spiritual practices, envy, and stinginess are abandoned by means of the other [paths of action].

original: de la zag pa med pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang the tshom rnams spong ngo //
analyzed: de la zag pa med pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang the tshom rnams spong ngo //
translated: Among them, uncontaminated right view abandons the overesteeming of (1) morality and (2) certain types of spiritual practices and doubt.

original: 'dir 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba ste lta ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'dir 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba ste lta ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Here, there are three types of views: the view of the transitory collection, the view grasping at extremes, and wrong views.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes pa'i mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes pa'i mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: There are two types of overesteeming: the overesteeming of (1) morality and (2) certain types of spiritual practices.

original: zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas phrag dog dang ser sna dang khong khro ba rnams dang 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags rnams spangs shing /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas phrag dog dang ser sna dang khong khro ba rnams dang 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags rnams spangs shing /
translated: By attaining uncontaminated concentration, envy, stinginess, anger, and attachment of the desire realm are abandoned.

original: nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang srid pa'i 'dod chags rnams dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi ye shes kyi zad pas so //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang srid pa'i 'dod chags rnams dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi ye shes kyi zad pas so //
translated: The pride, ignorance, and craving for existence are exhausted by the knowledge of the path of the arhat.

original: yang dag par zhes pa ni yang dag par kun tu shes shing yang dag par kun tu rtogs pas dkon mchog gsum dang yon tan rnams dang theg pa gsum po rnams ston cing /
analyzed: yang dag par zhes pa ni yang dag par kun tu shes shing yang dag par kun tu rtogs pas dkon mchog gsum dang yon tan rnams dang theg pa gsum po rnams ston cing /
translated: ‚ÄúCorrectly‚Äù means that by knowing and realizing correctly, one teaches the Three Jewels, the qualities, and the three vehicles.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la yang dag par mos pa de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bral bas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la yang dag par mos pa de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bral bas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Since one is free from the counteragents to the correct aspiration for the four noble truths and the factors of enlightenment, one‚Äôs mind is completely liberated.

original: sems kyi dbang thams cad ces pa ni sems gang gis ting nge 'dzin dbang du byas nas dbang sgyur bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems kyi dbang thams cad ces pa ni sems gang gis ting nge 'dzin dbang du byas nas dbang sgyur bar 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúAll mental powers‚Äù means that by means of the mind, one takes meditative concentration under one‚Äôs control and becomes a master.

original: de'i sems la dbang ba de thams cad la yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i sems la dbang ba de thams cad la yang ngo //
translated: One has power over that mind and all of those.

original: de rnams la dam pa'i pha rol ni pha rol ste /
analyzed: de rnams la dam pa'i pha rol ni pha rol ste /
translated: The highest of those is the other shore.

original: mthar thug pa 'dir 'gro ba dang 'dir phyin pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: mthar thug pa 'dir 'gro ba dang 'dir phyin pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúperfected‚Äù is that one goes to this and arrives at this.

original: pha rol ni mthar thug par 'gro ba la dam par pha rol tu son pa ni des thob pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol ni mthar thug par 'gro ba la dam par pha rol tu son pa ni des thob pa'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúother shore‚Äù is that one goes to the perfected, and ‚Äúhaving gone to the other shore‚Äù is the attainment of that.

original: dbang ni gang du ji ltar 'dod par lugs las 'byung ba dang lugs las bzlog pa nyid la dang po'i rim pa nas snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa dgu po rnams kun tu bsgrub pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / gnas pa dang lta ba rnams la so sor rtogs pa la dbang thob pa'i phyir ro //üîΩthams cad ces smos pa na de ci 'phags pa kun dga' @7a * //
analyzed: dbang ni gang du ji ltar 'dod par lugs las 'byung ba dang lugs las bzlog pa nyid la dang po'i rim pa nas snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa dgu po rnams kun tu bsgrub pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / gnas pa dang lta ba rnams la so sor rtogs pa la dbang thob pa'i phyir ro // thams cad ces smos pa na de ci 'phags pa kun dga' @7a * //
translated: ‚Äú Mastery‚Äù is the attainment of mastery over the nine meditative attainments in forward and reverse order, as one wishes, in the meditative equipoise on the accomplishment of the meditative states, and in the discernment of the states of abiding and seeing.

original: bo yang yon tan de rnams dang ldan no zhe na min par gsungs pa ni gcig ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bo yang yon tan de rnams dang ldan no zhe na min par gsungs pa ni gcig ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: When it is said that ‚Äúall‚Äù of these qualities are possessed by the bodhisattva, it is said that this is not so in the case of the noble Ananda.

original: gang zag gi tshig ni don mthun pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad po rnams las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag gi tshig ni don mthun pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad po rnams las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone who is not‚Äù refers to the eight noble individuals who are in agreement with the meaning.

original: ma rtogs pa ni yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa ni yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: Non-realization is completely abandoned.

original: 'di lta ste zhes pa ni gzhan la nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes pa ni gzhan la nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: Thus is a reference to the teaching to others.

original: tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa ni khyad par du mnyes par byed pa'i don te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa ni khyad par du mnyes par byed pa'i don te /
translated: The venerable one is for the sake of the special pleasing.

original: 'jig rten du cho 'dod pas des de bzhin du de mnyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten du cho 'dod pas des de bzhin du de mnyes pa'o //
translated: By the desire for the world, he thus pleases him.

original: 'dir nyan thos kyi dge 'dun bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir nyan thos kyi dge 'dun bshad pa ni /
translated: Here, the explanation of the ≈õrƒÅvaka sa·πÖgha

original: rjes la theg pa chen po la 'jug pa la dgongs pa dang / rab tu grags pa'i 'khor gyi phyir dang / nges pa'i 'khor gyi phyir te /
analyzed: rjes la theg pa chen po la 'jug pa la dgongs pa dang / rab tu grags pa'i 'khor gyi phyir dang / nges pa'i 'khor gyi phyir te /
translated: is for the sake of the subsequent entry into the MahƒÅyƒÅna, for the sake of the well-known retinue, and for the sake of the definite retinue.

original: de yang rab tu grags pa ni rab tu byung ba'i 'khor nyid la nges pa ni rang gi rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi drung du rtag par kun tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rab tu grags pa ni rab tu byung ba'i 'khor nyid la nges pa ni rang gi rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi drung du rtag par kun tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the well-known is just the retinue of the renunciant, and the definite is for the sake of always abiding in the presence of one's perfect Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas are not like that.

original: phal cher khyim pa yin pa'i phyir dang 'di nas kyang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su 'gro ba'i phyir dang / de rnams nas kyang 'di ru 'ong bas na de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun ni 'dir ma bshad de /
analyzed: phal cher khyim pa yin pa'i phyir dang 'di nas kyang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su 'gro ba'i phyir dang / de rnams nas kyang 'di ru 'ong bas na de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun ni 'dir ma bshad de /
translated: The assembly of bodhisattvas is not mentioned here because they are mostly householders, because they go to the world systems of the ten directions, and because they come from there.üîΩThe assembly of bodhisattvas is not mentioned here because they are mostly householders, because they go to the world systems of the ten directions, and because they come from there.üîΩThe assembly of bodhisattvas is not mentioned here because they are mostly householders, because they go to the world systems of the ten directions, and because they come from there.
