translated: The assembly of bodhisattvas is not mentioned here because they are mostly householders, because they go to the world systems of the ten directions, and because they come from there.üîΩThe assembly of bodhisattvas is not mentioned here because they are mostly householders, because they go to the world systems of the ten directions, and because they come from there.üîΩThe assembly of bodhisattvas is not mentioned here because they are mostly householders, because they go to the world systems of the ten directions, and because they come from there.üîΩThe assembly of bodhisattvas is not mentioned here because they are mostly householders, because they go to the world systems of the ten directions, and because they come from there.üîΩThe assembly of bodhisattvas is not mentioned here because they are mostly householders, because they go to the world systems of the ten directions, and because they come from there.üîΩThe assembly of bodhisattvas is not mentioned here because they are mostly householders, because they go to the world systems of the ten directions, and because they come from there.üîΩThe assembly of bodhisattvas is not mentioned here because they are mostly householders, because they go to the world systems of the ten directions, and because they come from there.üîΩThe assembly of bodhisattvas is not mentioned here because they are mostly householders, because they go to the world systems of the ten directions, and because they come from there.

original: gnyis pa ni mang du bshad pas lhag ma yang go bas rnam par spros nas go ba ste /üîΩ'di ni 'bring la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mang du bshad pas lhag ma yang go bas rnam par spros nas go ba ste / 'di ni 'bring la dga' ba'o //
translated: The assembly of bodhisattvas is not mentioned here because they are mostly householders, because they go to the world systems of the ten directions, and because they come from there.

original: gsum pa ni nyung du bshad pas mang du rtogs pa'i mgo smos pas go la /
analyzed: gsum pa ni nyung du bshad pas mang du rtogs pa'i mgo smos pas go la /
translated: The assembly of bodhisattvas is not mentioned here because they are mostly householders, because they go to the world systems of the ten directions, and because they come from there.üîΩThe assembly of bodhis

original: de ni bsdus pa la dga' ba ste /
analyzed: de ni bsdus pa la dga' ba ste /
translated: This is the delight in the concise.

original: de rnams la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma stong phrag brgyad pa dang / stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa dang / brgyad stong pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de rnams la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma stong phrag brgyad pa dang / stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa dang / brgyad stong pa gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed Lady was taught in three versions, the Eight Thousand, the Twenty-five Thousand, and the Eight Thousand, respectively for those who prefer the extensive, the middling, and the concise.

original: de la gzhung ni bsdus par 'dod pas na gzhung 'di'i gleng gzhi yang bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: de la gzhung ni bsdus par 'dod pas na gzhung 'di'i gleng gzhi yang bsdus pa ste /
translated: Here, the introduction to this text is concise because it is desired to be concise.

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang dri za la sogs pa'i 'khor yang 'dir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang dri za la sogs pa'i 'khor yang 'dir shes par bya'o //
translated: The retinue of monks and nuns, gods, humans, demigods, gandharvas, and so forth should be understood here.

original: de rnams bshad pas ni gang du bcom ldan 'das bya rgod phung po la ji skad bshad pa'i 'khor dang bzhugs par 'gyur ba der bdag gis @7b bcom ldan 'das las thos so zhes bya ste gling gzhi'o //
analyzed: de rnams bshad pas ni gang du bcom ldan 'das bya rgod phung po la ji skad bshad pa'i 'khor dang bzhugs par 'gyur ba der bdag gis @7b bcom ldan 'das las thos so zhes bya ste gling gzhi'o //
translated: By explaining those, it is said, ‚ÄúI heard this from the Blessed One, where he was dwelling with the retinue as explained at Vulture Peak,‚Äù which is the setting.

original: bstan pa go ba'i skabs gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa go ba'i skabs gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement of the occasion of the teaching is ‚ÄúThen,‚Äù and so forth.

original: yang zhes bya ba tshig gi rgyan la der bzhugs par gyur pas sam der gnas pa'i dge 'dun gyi nang na 'byor pas rab 'byor la /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba tshig gi rgyan la der bzhugs par gyur pas sam der gnas pa'i dge 'dun gyi nang na 'byor pas rab 'byor la /
translated: Since he was seated there, or since he was endowed with the assembly of those who were seated there, he is Subh≈´ti.

original: gnas brtan zhes smos pas ni mchod pa'i don te /
analyzed: gnas brtan zhes smos pas ni mchod pa'i don te /
translated: By saying ‚Äúelder,‚Äù he is venerating him.

original: dgra bcom par 'gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa rnams kyang mchog gi phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom par 'gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa rnams kyang mchog gi phyir ro //
translated: Because he is the best of those who are endowed with the absence of affliction that leads to arhatship.

original: bka' stsal pa ni rab tu 'byor ba zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa ni rab tu 'byor ba zhes pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe Blessed One said to Subh≈´ti‚Äù means

original: gsung gis byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: gsung gis byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: he blessed him with his speech.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa'i don du rnam pa gsum gyis byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa'i don du rnam pa gsum gyis byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: The Blessed One blesses with three kinds of speech in order to teach the Dharma.

original: kha cig tu phyag gis /
analyzed: kha cig tu phyag gis /
translated: In some cases, with his hand;

original: kha cig tu gsung gis /
analyzed: kha cig tu gsung gis /
translated: in some cases, with his speech;

original: kha cig tu thugs kyis so //
analyzed: kha cig tu thugs kyis so //
translated: in some cases, with his mind.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na de'i rigs can rnams kyi spro ba bskyed pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na de'i rigs can rnams kyi spro ba bskyed pa'i don du'o //
translated: Why is that? In order to generate enthusiasm in those of that kind.

original: spobs par gyis shig ces pa ni /
analyzed: spobs par gyis shig ces pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBe confident‚Äù means

original: khyod kyis rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi mngon sum du gyis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi mngon sum du gyis zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúmake it manifest in your own direct experience that you are a perfect buddha.‚Äù

original: gang du rab 'byor la bos nas bstan pa'i skad cig la gzhan gdul bar bya ba mang po rnams kyis so sor bcom ldan 'das ni zhal 'dzum pas bdag la gzigs nas chos ston to snyam du sems par gyur te /
analyzed: gang du rab 'byor la bos nas bstan pa'i skad cig la gzhan gdul bar bya ba mang po rnams kyis so sor bcom ldan 'das ni zhal 'dzum pas bdag la gzigs nas chos ston to snyam du sems par gyur te /
translated: In the instant that he addressed Subh≈´ti and taught, many other disciples thought, ‚ÄúThe BhagavƒÅn is looking at me with a smiling face and teaching the Dharma.‚Äù

original: de ltar na yang rab 'byor nas bka' stsal pas na de gnyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yang rab 'byor nas bka' stsal pas na de gnyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Thus, since Subh≈´ti was addressed, he was included in the two.

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa rnams ston pa la de rnams kyang lan cig ci'i phyir ma bos she na /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa rnams ston pa la de rnams kyang lan cig ci'i phyir ma bos she na /
translated: Well then, since the vehicles of the bodhisattvas are taught, why were they not addressed?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams bos nas bstan pa nas mdo 'di ni zab pas bdag cag rnams sbyor bar mi nus zhes kha cig lung la 'dzin par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams bos nas bstan pa nas mdo 'di ni zab pas bdag cag rnams sbyor bar mi nus zhes kha cig lung la 'dzin par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If the bodhisattvas were addressed, some would think, ‚ÄúThis s≈´tra is profound, and we are not able to engage it.‚Äù

original: rab 'byor la brtsams nas bstan na ni skye bo thams cad kyi thun mong ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor la brtsams nas bstan na ni skye bo thams cad kyi thun mong ba ste /
translated: If it were taught beginning with Subh≈´ti, it would be common to all beings.

original: shin tu zab pa ma yin no snyam du sems nas rab tu 'jug par 'gyur la /
analyzed: shin tu zab pa ma yin no snyam du sems nas rab tu 'jug par 'gyur la /
translated: Thinking, ‚ÄúIt is not very profound,‚Äù they would engage it.

original: thun mong par yang ste kun mkhyen pa gsum gyi skabs kyi phyir ni des bshad pas kyang dge slong rnams dang 'khor gzhan gyi chos mngon par rtogs pa thob pas so //
analyzed: thun mong par yang ste kun mkhyen pa gsum gyi skabs kyi phyir ni des bshad pas kyang dge slong rnams dang 'khor gzhan gyi chos mngon par rtogs pa thob pas so //
translated: Also, in common, because of the three knowledges, the monks and other retinues attained realization of the Abhidharma through his explanation.

original: gang yang bla mas gsol ba btab pa'i slob ma med kyang de lta na yang 'di gsol ba btab pa ni chos la gus pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gang yang bla mas gsol ba btab pa'i slob ma med kyang de lta na yang 'di gsol ba btab pa ni chos la gus pa nyid kyis so //
translated: And even though there are no disciples who request teachings from a guru, still, in this case, the request is by way of respect for the Dharma.

original: de lta na yang bshad pa /
analyzed: de lta na yang bshad pa /
translated: Still, the explanation is:

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chung ngu na lhag par mos zhes pas so //
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chung ngu na lhag par mos zhes pas so //
translated: The elder Subh≈´ti, even with just a little faith in the perfection of wisdom.üîΩWith respect to whom is it spoken?

original: gang gi dbang du byas shen gsungs pa ni /üîΩshes rab ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du byas shen gsungs pa ni / shes rab ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i @8a * //üîΩgtso bo chos kyi sku rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i @8a * // gtso bo chos kyi sku rtogs pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom

original: dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
translated: is the realization of the dharmakƒÅya, the principal.üîΩThat is the ultimate purpose.

original: don de la sbyor bas gzhung dang lam dag la yang de'i sgras so //
analyzed: don de la sbyor bas gzhung dang lam dag la yang de'i sgras so //
translated: Since it is applied to that meaning, the text and the path are also called that.

original: de las brtsams nas zhes pa ni skyes bu dam pas don du gnyer bar bya ba'i phyir dang / thabs las byung ba nyid kyi chad du'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las brtsams nas zhes pa ni skyes bu dam pas don du gnyer bar bya ba'i phyir dang / thabs las byung ba nyid kyi chad du'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase beginning from there means that it is for the sake of what is to be pursued by the holy person and is the source of the means.

original: ci nas zhes pa ni ji srid du thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: ci nas zhes pa ni ji srid du thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: As to in whatever way, it is by the distinctions of hearing, reflection, and cultivation.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes pa ni kun mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum la ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes pa ni kun mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum la ste /
translated: As to in the perfection of wisdom, it is in the three kinds of omniscience.

original: de lam la brten nas bgrod pas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste ma lus par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de lam la brten nas bgrod pas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste ma lus par 'gro ba'o //
translated: Since one proceeds by means of the path, one will go forth, that is, go completely.

original: ji ltar de yis bgrod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar de yis bgrod ce na /
translated: How does one proceed by means of it?

original: sbyor dang sbyor ba'i rab tu phyin pa dang / sbyor pa'i go rims dang / sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor dang sbyor ba'i rab tu phyin pa dang / sbyor pa'i go rims dang / sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa ste /
translated: By means of the application, the perfection of application, the sequence of application, and the culmination of application.

original: dgos pa'i tshul des ma lus par gyis zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dgos pa'i tshul des ma lus par gyis zhes pa'i don to //
translated: By means of this method of necessity, one should go completely, is the meaning.

original: de la ngag gnyis po 'dis ni 'phags pa rab 'byor la yang brjod par bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyis so sor ston pa ste /
analyzed: de la ngag gnyis po 'dis ni 'phags pa rab 'byor la yang brjod par bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyis so sor ston pa ste /
translated: The first two lines indicate the eight realizations to be expressed to the noble Subh≈´ti.

original: de ltar yang bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de ltar yang bstan bcos las /
translated: Thus the treatise declares:

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa ni //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa ni //
translated: The perfection of wisdom

original: dngos po brgyad kyis yang dag bshad //üîΩces pa ste stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo'i phyir na rab kyi shes rab la shes rab 'di'i pha rol pas na pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po brgyad kyis yang dag bshad // ces pa ste stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo'i phyir na rab kyi shes rab la shes rab 'di'i pha rol pas na pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: is explained in eight topics.üîΩBecause it focuses on emptiness and because it is the nature of the emptiness of the ultimate, it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dis kyi aa phyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis kyi aa phyis pa'o //
translated: It is a perfection because it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang gi pha rol zhe na rnam par rtog pa'i ste /
analyzed: gang gi pha rol zhe na rnam par rtog pa'i ste /
translated: What is the perfection of wisdom?

original: ci rigs par 'phags pa dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams pha rol tu phyin zhing so sor rtogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ci rigs par 'phags pa dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams pha rol tu phyin zhing so sor rtogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the perfection of the noble ones, bodhisattvas and pure tathƒÅgatas, who have gone to the other side of conceptualization.

original: sbyor ba'i lam la ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam la ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: How is it a perfection on the path of preparation?

original: de ni don gyi bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ni don gyi bya ba ste /
translated: That is the object of the action.

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the perfection of wisdom?

original: de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the result of that.

original: yang dag bshad ces pa ni mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyis bsdus nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag bshad ces pa ni mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyis bsdus nas bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is taught‚Äù means that it is taught by means of the eight realizations.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /üîΩrnam kun mkhyen nyid lam shes nyid //
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na / rnam kun mkhyen nyid lam shes nyid //
translated: What are the eight?üîΩ1. The realization of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de nas thams cad shes pa nyid //üîΩrnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa dang // rtse mor phyin dang mthar gyis pa //
analyzed: de nas thams cad shes pa nyid // rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa dang // rtse mor phyin dang mthar gyis pa //
translated: 2. The realization of the knowledge of the path,üîΩ3. The realization of the knowledge of all bases,üîΩ4. The realization of the complete perfection of all aspects,

original: skad cig gcig mngon rdzogs byang chub //
analyzed: skad cig gcig mngon rdzogs byang chub //
translated: 5. The realization of the peak,üîΩ6. The realization of the serial,üîΩ7. The realization of the instantaneous,

original: chos nyid sku dang de rnams brgyad /
analyzed: chos nyid sku dang de rnams brgyad /
translated: 8. The realization of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i rnam pa rnams thams cad kyis rtogs par bya ba la mngon du phyogs shing yang dag par @8b rtogs pa nyid kyis na mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i rnam pa rnams thams cad kyis rtogs par bya ba la mngon du phyogs shing yang dag par @8b rtogs pa nyid kyis na mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: The realization of the knowledge of all aspects is the realization of all aspects by means of all aspects. It is a realization that is directed toward and correctly realizes the complete perfection of all aspects.

original: don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it realizes the meaning.

original: rtse mo ni rab thob pa'o //
analyzed: rtse mo ni rab thob pa'o //
translated: The peak is the attainment of the highest.

original: mthar gyis pa ni rim gyis na mthar gyis pa ste mthar gyis pa der sbyor bar mngon par byang chub ces par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: mthar gyis pa ni rim gyis na mthar gyis pa ste mthar gyis pa der sbyor bar mngon par byang chub ces par 'jug pa ste /
translated: The serial one is the serial order, and the serial order is the clear realization of engagement.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa dang mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dag gis zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa dang mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dag gis zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the clear realization of the peak and the clear realization of the serial one are the clear realizations.

original: 'dir mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa dang rnam pa brgyad la mngon par nye bar thob par byed pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: 'dir mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa dang rnam pa brgyad la mngon par nye bar thob par byed pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni rnam pa bdun te /
translated: Here, the clear realization of the object to be realized and the clear realization of the one who attains it are seven.

original: bdun po de rnams kyis mngon par rtogs par byed cing thob par byed ces pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i chos kyi sku dang rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: bdun po de rnams kyis mngon par rtogs par byed cing thob par byed ces pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i chos kyi sku dang rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The clear realization that causes one to realize and attain those seven is the dharmakƒÅya, which is the eighth clear realization.

original: 'di rnams ni dngos po brgyad rnams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni dngos po brgyad rnams so //
translated: These are the eight things.

original: gang du 'dir rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi go rims ji lta bu bcom ldan 'das ma nyid las bstan te ji ltar na mngon par rtogs pa brgyad po rnams te /
analyzed: gang du 'dir rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi go rims ji lta bu bcom ldan 'das ma nyid las bstan te ji ltar na mngon par rtogs pa brgyad po rnams te /
translated: How are the eight realizations?

original: gang zag gi dbye bas ji lta bu'i rigs tha dad nas nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa rnam gsum ni de yang rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas rigs la gnas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang zag gi dbye bas ji lta bu'i rigs tha dad nas nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa rnam gsum ni de yang rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas rigs la gnas pa ma yin la /
translated: The three vehicles of sravakas and so on are not abodes of lineage from the perspective of following them,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gang zag gcig bu kho na'i dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das ma bstan na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gang zag gcig bu kho na'i dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das ma bstan na /
translated: but the Bhagavati is taught from the perspective of the single person of the bodhisattva.

original: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kho na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su bsgrub pas ji lta na gzhan rnams dgos /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kho na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su bsgrub pas ji lta na gzhan rnams dgos /
translated: Thus omniscience alone is established in terms of the states of cause and effect. How could the others be necessary?

original: gang yang nyan pa po'i 'dod pa'i ngor rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
analyzed: gang yang nyan pa po'i 'dod pa'i ngor rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
translated: Also, the two are taught from the perspective of the desires of the listeners.

original: gcig ni rgyu dang 'bras bur rtogs pa'i go rims kyis te /
analyzed: gcig ni rgyu dang 'bras bur rtogs pa'i go rims kyis te /
translated: One is in terms of the order of cause and effect.

original: dper na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the four establishments of mindfulness and the four right efforts.

original: gnyis pa ni 'bras bu dang rgyus bsgrubs pa'i go rims te dper na sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dag dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa dag bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bras bu dang rgyus bsgrubs pa'i go rims te dper na sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dag dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa dag bzhin no //
translated: The second is the order of cause and effect, for example, the truths of suffering and origination, and the truths of cessation and path.

original: mngon par rtogs pa 'di rnams kyi dang po ni 'bras bu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de nas lam shes pa dang / de nas thams cad shes pa dang / de nas rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par 'dod ces pa ni rigs pas mi 'thad de /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa 'di rnams kyi dang po ni 'bras bu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de nas lam shes pa dang / de nas thams cad shes pa dang / de nas rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par 'dod ces pa ni rigs pas mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not reasonable to assert that the first of these realizations is the omniscience of the result, then the knowledge of the path, then the knowledge of all aspects, and then the complete realization of all aspects.

original: dang po mngon par rtogs pa'i tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi mthar thug pa can gyi 'bras bu la yang gnyis pa med la /
analyzed: dang po mngon par rtogs pa'i tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi mthar thug pa can gyi 'bras bu la yang gnyis pa med la /
translated: Because the second does not exist in the result that is the final state of the first realization.

original: sems bskyed pa nas kyi sngon gyi gnas skabs su lam shes pa la sogs pa'i srid pa med pas gang @9a * //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa nas kyi sngon gyi gnas skabs su lam shes pa la sogs pa'i srid pa med pas gang @9a * //
translated: And because the knowledge of the path and so on do not exist in the prior state of generating bodhicitta.

original: brgyad po 'di rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rim pa bsgrub par 'gyur ba ni min pa nyid do //
analyzed: brgyad po 'di rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rim pa bsgrub par 'gyur ba ni min pa nyid do //
translated: These eight are not established in the order of cause and effect.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: brjod pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: brjod pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is said: The knowledge of all aspects is twofold.

original: gtso bo ni 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyi sangs rgyas kyi rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gtso bo ni 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyi sangs rgyas kyi rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: The primary one is only the realization of the Buddha in the state of fruition.

original: gtso bo ma yin pa ni rgyu'i gnas skabs su de nyid lam shes pas gang zag dang chos bdag med par so sor rtogs pa ste byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyis kyang sngon gyi gnas skabs su thams cad shes pa nyid kyi gang zag gi stong pa
analyzed: gtso bo ma yin pa ni rgyu'i gnas skabs su de nyid lam shes pas gang zag dang chos bdag med par so sor rtogs pa ste byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyis kyang sngon gyi gnas skabs su thams cad shes pa nyid kyi gang zag gi stong pa
translated: The non-primary one is the individual realization of the selflessness of persons and phenomena by that very [knowledge of all aspects] in the state of cause, through the knowledge of the path. Those bodhisattvas, in their previous state, fully understand the emptiness of the person of the knowledge of all aspects

original: nyid tsam du yongs su shes pa'i phyir thams cad shes pa dang lam shes pa gnyis pa med la /
analyzed: nyid tsam du yongs su shes pa'i phyir thams cad shes pa dang lam shes pa gnyis pa med la /
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of the path are not separate.

original: de ldog pa'i sgo nas ni nyan thos rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: de ldog pa'i sgo nas ni nyan thos rnams kyi ste /
translated: From the perspective of their cessation, they are the ≈õrƒÅvakas'.

original: de ltar gsum po rnams 'bras bu dang rgyu'i go rims bsgrub par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gsum po rnams 'bras bu dang rgyu'i go rims bsgrub par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, these three are to be established in the order of cause and effect.

original: 'di rnams kyi yang dang po'i mngon par rtogs pa gsum ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin la mtshon par shes zhes pas mtshan nyid dang / yul zhes pas yul can gyi mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyu tha ma'i sbyor ba dang bcas pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi yang dang po'i mngon par rtogs pa gsum ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin la mtshon par shes zhes pas mtshan nyid dang / yul zhes pas yul can gyi mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyu tha ma'i sbyor ba dang bcas pa bzhi ste /
translated: The first three realizations of these are characterized by the statement ‚Äúone should understand that they are illustrated by the nature of the perfection of wisdom,‚Äù and ‚Äúobject‚Äù refers to the subject realization and the final application.

original: de la dang po'i kun mkhyen pa gsum po rnams la thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis spros pa thams cad rnam par log pa des cig car du mngon par mi mtshon
analyzed: de la dang po'i kun mkhyen pa gsum po rnams la thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis spros pa thams cad rnam par log pa des cig car du mngon par mi mtshon
translated: The first three omniscient ones do not simultaneously illustrate the nature of the perfection of wisdom, which is the reversal of all elaborations by means of the consciousnesses that are the nature of hearing and contemplation.

original: la / so sor rang gi rnam pa rnams spros pa'i bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'dun pa'i sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyis sbyor ba brtsams te/ gang du 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes kun mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum gyi yul gyi rnam paüîΩso sor nges pa rnams sam /
analyzed: la / so sor rang gi rnam pa rnams spros pa'i bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'dun pa'i sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyis sbyor ba brtsams te/ gang du 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes kun mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum gyi yul gyi rnam pa so sor nges pa rnams sam /
translated: The individual aspects are the objects of the three kinds of omniscience.

original: ma lus pa'i rnam pa'i yul can ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma lus pa'i rnam pa'i yul can ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The object that has all aspects is the object of the omniscience that has all aspects.

original: mtshan nyid can gyi kun mkhyen rnam pa gsum du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid can gyi kun mkhyen rnam pa gsum du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of omniscience are posited as having those characteristics.

original: sbyor ba la ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs pa rtogs pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sbyor ba la ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs pa rtogs pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the context of the path of preparation, the object that has all aspects is called the realization that has all aspects.

original: de nyid kyis na sdud 'grel du rnam pa thams cad du kun mkhyen gsum thob pa la dbang du byed pa'i don kun mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum gyi rnam pa rnams ni khyad par gyi lam la bsgom pas rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par 'gro
analyzed: de nyid kyis na sdud 'grel du rnam pa thams cad du kun mkhyen gsum thob pa la dbang du byed pa'i don kun mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum gyi rnam pa rnams ni khyad par gyi lam la bsgom pas rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par 'gro
translated: Thus the explanation of Haribhadra in his commentary on the Abhisamayalamkara that the three omnisciences are attained in all aspects and that the aspects of the three omnisciences are cultivated on the distinctive path and that one thus comes to realize all aspects is not correct.

original: bar 'gyur zhes pa'i seng ge bzang pos bshad pa ni rig pa ma yin par 'thad pas bshad cing 'chad par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: bar 'gyur zhes pa'i seng ge bzang pos bshad pa ni rig pa ma yin par 'thad pas bshad cing 'chad par yang 'gyur /
translated: This is explained and will be explained.

original: de'i rab tu son @9b ba'i mthar gyis pa rnams mthar phyin pa'i tha ma la 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes pa 'di nyid ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mthar gyis pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rab tu son @9b ba'i mthar gyis pa rnams mthar phyin pa'i tha ma la 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes pa 'di nyid ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mthar gyis pa ste /
translated: The gradual arising of the result at the end of the perfection of the gradual arising of the cause and result is as follows.

original: de ltar yang bstan bcos kyi mthar /
analyzed: de ltar yang bstan bcos kyi mthar /
translated: Thus the treatise concludes:üîΩThe application of that definition,üîΩits perfection, its sequence,

original: mtshan nyid de yi sbyor ba dang // de rab de yi go rims dang // de mtha' de yi rnam smin ni //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de yi sbyor ba dang // de rab de yi go rims dang // de mtha' de yi rnam smin ni //
translated: its conclusion and its resultüîΩare elsewhere summarized in six topics.

original: gzhan du don bsdus rnam pa drug / yul gyi rgyu ni rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: gzhan du don bsdus rnam pa drug / yul gyi rgyu ni rnam pa gsum //
translated: The cause of the object is threefold.

original: sbyor ba bzhi yi bdag nyid dang // chos sku phrin las 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: sbyor ba bzhi yi bdag nyid dang // chos sku phrin las 'bras bu ni //
translated: The essence of the four practices, the Dharma body, the activity, and the result,

original: gzhan du don bsdus rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: gzhan du don bsdus rnam pa gsum //
translated: are elsewhere summarized in three topics.

original: zhes so // de'i mtshan nyid la rab tu sbyor bas de'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: zhes so // de'i mtshan nyid la rab tu sbyor bas de'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: The application to its characteristics is the application to it.

original: 'dir phal pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu la phal pa'i rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir phal pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu la phal pa'i rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Here, the cause of the knowledge of all aspects is the application to the complete realization of all aspects.

original: gtso bo ni 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can pas gtso bo ste /
analyzed: gtso bo ni 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can pas gtso bo ste /
translated: The principal one is the principal one because it has the nature of the result.

original: de la rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: How can it be called the application to the complete realization of all aspects?

original: sbyor ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir na nye bar btags pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir na nye bar btags pa ste /
translated: Because it is the result of the application, it is figuratively designated as such.

original: 'bras bu ni sngon du sbyor ba med na mi skye ba zhes pa so sor bsgrub par 'dod nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis rnams su yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa
analyzed: 'bras bu ni sngon du sbyor ba med na mi skye ba zhes pa so sor bsgrub par 'dod nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis rnams su yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa
translated: The result is that if the prior preparation does not arise, it is said that the result does not arise.

original: de rnams kyi tha ma'i dngos gzhi'i rjes gnyis kyi ngo bo ni 'bras bu la thabs ni ji srid du nyi shu po'i shes pa ni phal pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / phal pa'i rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi tha ma'i dngos gzhi'i rjes gnyis kyi ngo bo ni 'bras bu la thabs ni ji srid du nyi shu po'i shes pa ni phal pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / phal pa'i rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ste /
translated: The essence of the final two, the actual basis and its conclusion, is the result. The method is the knowledge of all aspects and the complete clear realization of all aspects of the twenty.

original: de la dang po lnga po ni thams cad shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la dang po lnga po ni thams cad shes pa nyid do //
translated: The first five are the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bco lnga pa dang bcu drug pa dang bcu bdun pa'i dbye ba'i dang po gnyis ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bco lnga pa dang bcu drug pa dang bcu bdun pa'i dbye ba'i dang po gnyis ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The first two of the division of the fifteenth, sixteenth, and seventeenth are the clear realization of the peak.

original: de'i dbye ba gnyis spangs pa'i bcu bdun pa dang bco brgyad pa dang bcu dgu pa ni mthar gyis pa'i gnas pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbye ba gnyis spangs pa'i bcu bdun pa dang bco brgyad pa dang bcu dgu pa ni mthar gyis pa'i gnas pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The second, the seventeenth, the eighteenth, and the nineteenth are the clear realization of the abiding of the serial.üîΩThe twentieth is the clear realization in one instant.

original: nyi shu pa ni skad cig ma gcig gi mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes rnam par bzhag nas 'di rnams kyi rigs pa bshad pa rgya chen po la dgos pa med do //
analyzed: nyi shu pa ni skad cig ma gcig gi mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes rnam par bzhag nas 'di rnams kyi rigs pa bshad pa rgya chen po la dgos pa med do //
translated: Having thus presented them, there is no need to explain their reasoning extensively here.

original: gang nges par 'byung zhes pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gang nges par 'byung zhes pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: With regard to what is said in the line ‚Äúthe one who is certain to leave,‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes pa ste /
translated: it is the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúone who has generated the mind of enlightenment‚Äù is as follows.

original: de ltar yang bstan bcos su /
analyzed: de ltar yang bstan bcos su /
translated: Thus the treatise states:üîΩThe generation of the mind, the instructions,üîΩthe four aspects of ascertainment,

original: sems bskyed pa dang gdams ngag dang // nges 'byed yan lag rnam bzhi dang // sgrub pa yi ni rten gyur pa //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang gdams ngag dang // nges 'byed yan lag rnam bzhi dang // sgrub pa yi ni rten gyur pa //
translated: and the support of practice

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang // dmigs @10a * //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang // dmigs @10a * //
translated: are the nature of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: pa dag dang ched dang ni //
analyzed: pa dag dang ched dang ni //
translated: The objects, the purpose,üîΩthe armor, the activity of engagement,

original: go cha 'jug pa'i bya ba dang // thub pa'i rnam kun mkhyen pa nyid //
analyzed: go cha 'jug pa'i bya ba dang // thub pa'i rnam kun mkhyen pa nyid //
translated: and the omniscience of the SageüîΩare the nature of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: ces pa ni thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa de nyid kyis de rnams mtha' dag mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: ces pa ni thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa de nyid kyis de rnams mtha' dag mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir la /
translated: This is because the Muni, the Tathagata, has directly perceived all of those.

original: de nyid le'u 'dis rjod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid le'u 'dis rjod par byed pa ste /
translated: And this chapter expresses just that.

original: de yang sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i chos spyod bcu ste sgrub pa'i spyod pa zhes pa'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: de yang sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i chos spyod bcu ste sgrub pa'i spyod pa zhes pa'i rnam grangs so //
translated: Moreover, it is the ten Dharma practices such as generating the mind of enlightenment, and it is a synonym for the practice of accomplishment.

original: 'dir chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid la rab tu gnas nas 'dun pa la sogs pa can bskyed nas /
analyzed: 'dir chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid la rab tu gnas nas 'dun pa la sogs pa can bskyed nas /
translated: Here, having well-abided in the emptiness of the dharmadhatu, one generates the mind of enlightenment and so forth.

original: dgu po 'byung ba'i phyir dmigs pa dang ched du bya ba dang go cha bgo ba'o //
analyzed: dgu po 'byung ba'i phyir dmigs pa dang ched du bya ba dang go cha bgo ba'o //
translated: Because the nine arise, there is the objective support, the purpose, and the armor.üîΩAfter that, having generated the mind of enlightenment that possesses the factors conducive to penetrative insight and so on, one well abides and thus penetrates and emerges.

original: de'i rjes la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa can bskyed nas rab tu gnas pas de yang dag par 'byed cing nges par 'byung zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'dir yang sems bskyed pa la sogs pa gsum ni rtogs pa'i go rims te
analyzed: de'i rjes la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa can bskyed nas rab tu gnas pas de yang dag par 'byed cing nges par 'byung zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'dir yang sems bskyed pa la sogs pa gsum ni rtogs pa'i go rims te
translated: Here, the three such as generating the mind of enlightenment are the order of realization.

original: / de'i rgyu chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa dang ched du bya ba yid la byed pa ni sems bskyed pa'i yul zhes pa ni 'bras bu dang rgyu'i sgrub pa'i go rims su bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: / de'i rgyu chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa dang ched du bya ba yid la byed pa ni sems bskyed pa'i yul zhes pa ni 'bras bu dang rgyu'i sgrub pa'i go rims su bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: The cause of that is the objective support of the dharmadhatu and the mental attention to the purpose. The object of generating the Thought is established in the order of the establishment of the result and the cause.

original: gnyis don gyi go rims so //
analyzed: gnyis don gyi go rims so //
translated: The order of the two aims.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa ni bcom ldan 'das ma'i brjod pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa ni bcom ldan 'das ma'i brjod pa'i rim pas so //
translated: The verse-arrangement is by the order of the recitation of the Bhagavati.

original: yang nyan pa po'i 'dod pa'i khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: yang nyan pa po'i 'dod pa'i khyad par gyis so //
translated: Also, it is by the special desire of the listener.

original: de bzhin du phyi ma la yang ji ltar rigs par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi ma la yang ji ltar rigs par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should establish the rest as is appropriate.

original: 'di rnams kyi rting la brjod pa'i mog mog por byed ces pa la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa bcu gcig ni ji ltar mngon par rtogs pa rnam par bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi rting la brjod pa'i mog mog por byed ces pa la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa bcu gcig ni ji ltar mngon par rtogs pa rnam par bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: After these, the eleven verse-paragraphs beginning with ‚ÄúThe obscurations of expression‚Äù are as will be explained in the Abhisamayalankara.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das ma'i dang po'i tshig gnyis pa'i tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni sems bskyed par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das ma'i dang po'i tshig gnyis pa'i tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni sems bskyed par bshad do //
translated: Here, the first two words of the Bhagavati explain the generation of the Thought.

original: byang chub ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rab kyi mthar son pa la de la sems pa ni mngon par sems shing 'dod pa rnams te byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba la sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid du byed pa 'dod pa la gang
analyzed: byang chub ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rab kyi mthar son pa la de la sems pa ni mngon par sems shing 'dod pa rnams te byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba la sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid du byed pa 'dod pa la gang
translated: Bodhisattvas are those who aspire to that.

original: mngon par sems pa de ni chen pos na des na 'di rnams chen po nyid do zhes pa ni sems dpa' chen po ste /
analyzed: mngon par sems pa de ni chen pos na des na 'di rnams chen po nyid do zhes pa ni sems dpa' chen po ste /
translated: The term mahƒÅsattva is derived from the word mahƒÅ, which means ‚Äúgreat,‚Äù and sattva, which means ‚Äúaspiration.‚Äù

original: de ltar yang bshad pa /üîΩsems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //
analyzed: de ltar yang bshad pa / sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //
translated: As it is said:üîΩBodhicitta is the aspiration

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //üîΩde dang de ni mdo bzhin du //üîΩbsdus dang rgyas pa'i sgo nas brjod //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod // de dang de ni mdo bzhin du // bsdus dang rgyas pa'i sgo nas brjod //
translated: for perfect complete enlightenment for the sake of others.üîΩThat is summarized and explained

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: in brief and in detail according to the s≈´tras.üîΩBodhicitta is the aspiration.

original: sems bskyed pa ni mtshon cha la lhag ma ni mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni mtshon cha la lhag ma ni mtshan nyid de /
translated: The rest of the words are its characteristics.

original: sems ni @10b 'dir yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: sems ni @10b 'dir yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Mind here refers to the mental consciousness.

original: des dkar po'i chos thams cad la dmigs pa 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: des dkar po'i chos thams cad la dmigs pa 'byung ba ste /
translated: It is the source of the focus on all virtuous qualities.

original: 'dir sems dang yid la 'dod pa dang 'dun pa dang mos pa dang don du gnyer ba zhes pa rnams ni rnam grangs so //üîΩde ltar yang 'gro bar 'dod nas brjod pa bdag gi sems 'gro bar 'dod /
analyzed: 'dir sems dang yid la 'dod pa dang 'dun pa dang mos pa dang don du gnyer ba zhes pa rnams ni rnam grangs so // de ltar yang 'gro bar 'dod nas brjod pa bdag gi sems 'gro bar 'dod /
translated: Here, mind, thought, desire, aspiration, and longing are synonyms.

original: bdag gi yid 'gro bar 'dod ces pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi yid 'gro bar 'dod ces pa ste /
translated: Thus, when one wishes to go, one says, ‚ÄúMy mind wishes to go,‚Äù ‚ÄúMy thought wishes to go.‚Äù

original: de bskyed pa ni sems bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: de bskyed pa ni sems bskyed pa ste /
translated: The generation of that is the generation of the mind.

original: gzhan sems can de dag thams cad kyi don dang phan pa nas ji srid du shin tu mthar thug pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bla na med pa'i byang chub ces pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: gzhan sems can de dag thams cad kyi don dang phan pa nas ji srid du shin tu mthar thug pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bla na med pa'i byang chub ces pa'i bar du ste /
translated: For the sake of all those sentient beings, for their welfare, up to the unsurpassed enlightenment of complete nirvana.

original: des de'i don du ched du gnyer ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod cing mos pa gang gis de ltar de'i ngo bo nyid de rnams 'dod ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: des de'i don du ched du gnyer ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod cing mos pa gang gis de ltar de'i ngo bo nyid de rnams 'dod ces pa'i don to //
translated: The longing for that is the desire for complete enlightenment, by which one longs for those natures in that way.

original: sems bskyed pa ni ma 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni ma 'khrul pa ste /
translated: The generation of the mind is non-erroneous.

original: bskyed ces smos pa ni ma skyes pa shes par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bskyed ces smos pa ni ma skyes pa shes par byed pa ste /
translated: The mention of ‚Äúgeneration‚Äù is to indicate that it is not unarisen.

original: sems kyis rtogs pa'i chos kyi so sor dang po'i mtshams su gyur pa shes pa'i don dang khyad par yongs su 'dzin pa'i don te /
analyzed: sems kyis rtogs pa'i chos kyi so sor dang po'i mtshams su gyur pa shes pa'i don dang khyad par yongs su 'dzin pa'i don te /
translated: The mind is the special cause of the Dharma that is realized by the mind, and it is the cause of the retention of the meaning and the retention of the distinctions.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi ched du bya ba dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dmigs pa'i sems bskyed pa'i sems kyi khyad par stong pa dang snying rje dbyer med pa byang chub kyi sems te 'dir 'di ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi ched du bya ba dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dmigs pa'i sems bskyed pa'i sems kyi khyad par stong pa dang snying rje dbyer med pa byang chub kyi sems te 'dir 'di ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: The special mind is the mind that is generated for the sake of others and that is focused on perfect enlightenment. It is the mind of enlightenment, which is the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion.

original: 'o na don du gnyer ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang lhan cig rgyu ba'i sems ni bcom ldan 'das la ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na don du gnyer ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang lhan cig rgyu ba'i sems ni bcom ldan 'das la ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, how can the mind that is accompanied by the conception of striving be the mind of the bodhisattva?

original: bden te don du gnyer bar bya ba dang / don du gnyer bar byed pa can nyid ni byed pa po'i chos gang sngon du so sor sems kyis ji ltar rig par don du gnyer ba nyid dang 'dod pa nyid kyi las dang chos ni mchog gi sras la 'dir bcom ldan 'das la ni don du gnyer
analyzed: bden te don du gnyer bar bya ba dang / don du gnyer bar byed pa can nyid ni byed pa po'i chos gang sngon du so sor sems kyis ji ltar rig par don du gnyer ba nyid dang 'dod pa nyid kyi las dang chos ni mchog gi sras la 'dir bcom ldan 'das la ni don du gnyer
translated: The activity and quality of the one who is to be benefited and the one who benefits are supreme for the Buddha‚Äôs sons.

original: ba'i sems kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: ba'i sems kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid de /
translated: Here, the Blessed One has no mental conception of the one who is to be benefited.

original: de yang ji ltar sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'i thugs rje chen po ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'i thugs rje chen po ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: Moreover, the great compassion that wishes to free from suffering is of the nature of nonconceptuality.

original: snga nas de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam par rtog pa med pas de ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod ces pa ni kha na ma thob med pa'o //
analyzed: snga nas de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam par rtog pa med pas de ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod ces pa ni kha na ma thob med pa'o //
translated: Since the TathƒÅgata is without conception from the beginning, it is without fault to say that he wishes for perfect complete enlightenment in that way.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang gzhan gyi don de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo 'di la yang sems bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig las ma gsungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang gzhan gyi don de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo 'di la yang sems bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig las ma gsungs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the perfection of wisdom sutra does not teach only the characteristics of the generation of the thought of perfect enlightenment and the benefit of others.

original: ji ltar na rang dang gzhan gyi don dag gis thabs kyang ngo //üîΩde la rang gi don ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gzhan @11a * //
analyzed: ji ltar na rang dang gzhan gyi don dag gis thabs kyang ngo // de la rang gi don ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gzhan @11a * //
translated: How is it also the means for one's own and others' goals?

original: gyi don ni sems can gyi don te /
analyzed: gyi don ni sems can gyi don te /
translated: Therein, one's own goal is perfect enlightenment, and the goal of others is the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de dag gi thabs ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor te /üîΩde med na de dag mi 'grub la de'i de nyid bsdus pa dang rgyas pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de ltar bshad la /
analyzed: de dag gi thabs ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor te / de med na de dag mi 'grub la de'i de nyid bsdus pa dang rgyas pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de ltar bshad la /
translated: The means for those is the yoga of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩWithout it, those are not accomplished.

original: gzhan gyi don ni bsdus pa dang rgyas pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ni bsdus pa dang rgyas pas so //
translated: The concise and extensive perfect enlightenment is explained as one's own goal, and the benefit of others is by the concise and extensive.

original: de la sems bskyed pa 'di'i ngo bo bcom ldan 'das ma las gsungs pa de srid kyi gnas skabs thob pas na rab tu dbye ba ni ma gsungs te /
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa 'di'i ngo bo bcom ldan 'das ma las gsungs pa de srid kyi gnas skabs thob pas na rab tu dbye ba ni ma gsungs te /
translated: prajnaparamita, but the divisions are not stated there, because the state ofüîΩbeing a bodhisattva is attained.

original: gnas skabs tha dad pa ni thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs tha dad pa ni thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The different states are to be attained.üîΩMoreover, they are stated in the twenty-five thousand and the eight thousand

original: de yang stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa dang stong phrag brgyad pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma yum chen mo las ni gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa dang stong phrag brgyad pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma yum chen mo las ni gsungs so //
translated: verses of the great mother of the Victor.

original: de yang bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de yang bstan bcos las /
translated: And that is stated in the treatise.

original: de yang sa gser zla ba me //
analyzed: de yang sa gser zla ba me //
translated: Earth, gold, moon, fire,

original: gter dang rin chen 'byung gnas mtsho //
analyzed: gter dang rin chen 'byung gnas mtsho //
translated: Treasure, jewel mine, ocean,üîΩVajra, mountain, medicine, friend,

original: rdo rje ri sman bshes gnyen dang // yid bzhin nor bu nyi ma glu //
analyzed: rdo rje ri sman bshes gnyen dang // yid bzhin nor bu nyi ma glu //
translated: Wish-granting gem, sun, song,

original: rgyal po mdzod dang lam po che //üîΩbzhon pa bkod ma'i chu dang ni //
analyzed: rgyal po mdzod dang lam po che // bzhon pa bkod ma'i chu dang ni //
translated: King, treasury, highway,üîΩVehicle, river,

original: sgra brnyan chu bo sprin rnams kyis //
analyzed: sgra brnyan chu bo sprin rnams kyis //
translated: Echo, river, and cloud

original: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: Are the twenty-two aspects.

original: zhes te chu bo zhes bya ba ni chu klung gi rgyun te /
analyzed: zhes te chu bo zhes bya ba ni chu klung gi rgyun te /
translated: ‚ÄúRiver‚Äù is a stream of water.

original: de la sems bskyed pa gsum pa'i mtha' la mnyam zhes pas nang du bsdu bar bya'o //üîΩdang po'i 'dun pa dang lhan cig pa'i ched du bya ba'i byang chub don du gnyer ba'i mtshan nyid ni sa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa gsum pa'i mtha' la mnyam zhes pas nang du bsdu bar bya'o // dang po'i 'dun pa dang lhan cig pa'i ched du bya ba'i byang chub don du gnyer ba'i mtshan nyid ni sa dang 'dra ste /
translated: The three kinds of spiritual gene are to be understood as being respectively similar to a mine of gold, to a tree, and to a receptacle.üîΩThe first, which is the spiritual gene that exists naturally, is similar to a mine of gold, because the qualities of a buddha exist in it naturally.üîΩThe second, which is the spiritual gene that is developed, is similar to a tree, because it is the support for the growth of the qualities of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi tshogs skyed pa'i rten du gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi tshogs skyed pa'i rten du gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The third, which is the spiritual gene that is the basis of the attainment of enlightenment, is similar to a receptacle, because it is the support for the attainment of the result of the path.

original: bsam pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni gser bzang po lta bu ste /üîΩde phyis gang du yang 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni gser bzang po lta bu ste / de phyis gang du yang 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first, which is the spiritual gene that exists naturally, is similar to a mine of gold, because the qualities of a buddha exist in it naturally.üîΩThe second, which is the spiritual gene that is developed, is similar to a tree, because it is the support for the growth of the qualities of a buddha.

original: bsam pa las khyad par rtogs pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa de dang lhan cig par gyur pa dang / sbyor ba dang lhan cig tu son pa ni dkar po'i phyogs kyi zla ba tshes pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: bsam pa las khyad par rtogs pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa de dang lhan cig par gyur pa dang / sbyor ba dang lhan cig tu son pa ni dkar po'i phyogs kyi zla ba tshes pa lta bu ste /
translated: The third, which is the spiritual gene that is the basis of the attainment of enlightenment, is similar to a receptacle, because it is the support for the attainment of the result of the path.üîΩThe first, which is the spiritual gene that exists naturally, is similar to a mine of gold, because the qualities of a buddha exist in it naturally.

original: des dge ba rnams bskyed cing 'phel ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des dge ba rnams bskyed cing 'phel ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second, which is the spiritual gene that is developed, is similar to a tree, because it is the support for the growth of the qualities of a buddha.üîΩThe third, which is the spiritual gene that is the basis of the attainment of enlightenment, is similar to a receptacle, because it is the support for the attainment of the result of the path.

original: sbyor ba dang lhan cig par gyur pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / lhan cig par gyur pa ni me dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang lhan cig par gyur pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / lhan cig par gyur pa ni me dang 'dra ste /
translated: The superior intention that accompanies the practice is like fire,

original: des de'i khyad par du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: des de'i khyad par du 'gro ba ste /
translated: because it is the cause of its special development.

original: bud shing gi khyad par las me bzhin no //
analyzed: bud shing gi khyad par las me bzhin no //
translated: Like the special development of fire from fuel.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni gter chen po lta bu ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni gter chen po lta bu ste /
translated: The superior intention that accompanies the perfection of generosity is like a great treasure,

original: chos dang zang zing gi longs spyod rnams kyis tshad med pa'i sems can rnams tshim pas mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang zang zing gi longs spyod rnams kyis tshad med pa'i sems can rnams tshim pas mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it satisfies limitless beings with material and spiritual gifts and is never exhausted.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / lhan cig tu gyur pa ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / lhan cig tu gyur pa ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas lta bu ste /
translated: The superior intention that accompanies the perfection of morality is like a mine of jewels,

original: yon tan rin po che rnams thams cad des 'phel @11b bar byed cing rin po che'i 'byung gnas su skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rin po che rnams thams cad des 'phel @11b bar byed cing rin po che'i 'byung gnas su skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it produces all the jewels of virtues and is born in a mine of jewels.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni rgya mtsho dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni rgya mtsho dang 'dra ste /
translated: The superior intention that accompanies the perfection of patience is like the ocean,üîΩbecause it is unperturbed by the occurrence of any calamity.

original: mi 'dod pa thams cad thog tu bab kyang mi 'khrug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa thams cad thog tu bab kyang mi 'khrug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when all undesirable things befall him, he is not upset.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni rdo rje lta bu ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni rdo rje lta bu ste /
translated: The perfection of effort is like a diamond,

original: bstan pa'i phyir dang 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir dang 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is unshakable and fearless.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni ri lta bu ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni ri lta bu ste /
translated: The perfection of meditation is like a mountain,

original: mi bskyod pa dang mi g-yeng pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa dang mi g-yeng pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is unshakable and unperturbed.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni sman gyi rgyal po lta bu ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni sman gyi rgyal po lta bu ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is like the king of medicines,

original: sgrib pa'i nad thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i nad thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it cures all the sicknesses of the addictions.

original: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang tshad med pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa ni bshes gnyen chen po lta bu ste /
analyzed: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang tshad med pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa ni bshes gnyen chen po lta bu ste /
translated: The perfection of means is like a great friend,

original: gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it never abandons the welfare of sentient beings in any situation.

original: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang lhan cig pa ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang lhan cig pa ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ste /
translated: The perfection of vows together with the superknowledges is like a wish-fulfilling gem,

original: mos pa ji lta ba de'i 'bras bu spel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mos pa ji lta ba de'i 'bras bu spel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it increases the results of aspirations in accordance with the wishes.

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa dang sbyin pa dang / ngag snyan pa dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdu ba'i dngos po dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni nyi ma dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa dang sbyin pa dang / ngag snyan pa dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdu ba'i dngos po dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni nyi ma dang 'dra ste /
translated: The perfection of power together with the means of gathering students consisting of generosity, pleasant speech, accomplishment of goals, and consistency between words and deeds is like the sun,

original: gdul bar bya ba'i lo tog smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul bar bya ba'i lo tog smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it ripens the crop of those to be trained.

original: de la sbyin pa ni nang phyi rol gyi yo byad sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa ni nang phyi rol gyi yo byad sbyin pa'o //
translated: Of these, generosity is the giving of external and internal things.

original: snyan par smra ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: Pleasant speech is the giving of mundane and transcendental teachings.

original: don spyod pa ni chos las yang dag par len du 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: don spyod pa ni chos las yang dag par len du 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: Consistency between words and deeds is the practice of what one preaches.

original: don mthun pa ni gang gzhan la yang dag par len du bcug pa de la bdag nyid rjes su 'jug par byed ces pa ni sems can gyi bsdu ba'i dngos po'i thabs rnams so //
analyzed: don mthun pa ni gang gzhan la yang dag par len du bcug pa de la bdag nyid rjes su 'jug par byed ces pa ni sems can gyi bsdu ba'i dngos po'i thabs rnams so //
translated: Consistency of purpose is when one practices what one preaches.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig pa ni dri za'i dbyangs 'jam zhing snyan pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig pa ni dri za'i dbyangs 'jam zhing snyan pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: The perfection of knowledge is like the sweet and pleasant voice of the gandharvas,

original: gdul bya 'dun pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: gdul bya 'dun pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because the Dharma is taught in order to attract those to be trained.

original: mngon par shes pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni rgyal po lta bu ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni rgyal po lta bu ste /
translated: The perfection of direct intuition is like a king,

original: bar ma chad par mthus gzhan gyi don la rjes su gnas pa la rnam par 'jug pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar ma chad par mthus gzhan gyi don la rjes su gnas pa la rnam par 'jug pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of engaging in the benefit of others through uninterrupted power.

original: rgyal po'i lcags kyus ni skye dgu lam log pa nas mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: rgyal po'i lcags kyus ni skye dgu lam log pa nas mi ltung ngo //
translated: The hook of a king does not allow people to fall into error.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i so sor rton pa'i lcags kyu'i @12a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i so sor rton pa'i lcags kyu'i @12a * //
translated: In the same way, the hook of the bodhisattva's reliance on the meaningüîΩdoes not allow the Dharma to fall into error.

original: ste / de la don la rton gyi yi ge la ma yin te /
analyzed: ste / de la don la rton gyi yi ge la ma yin te /
translated: Therein, one should rely on the meaning, not on the letter.

original: legs par sbyar ba la sogs pa can lam yin no //
analyzed: legs par sbyar ba la sogs pa can lam yin no //
translated: The letter is the correct expression, etc.

original: chos kyi rigs pa las sor rton gyi gang gis gang de ltar brjod pa'i chos thams cad stong pa ma yin zhes pa lam yin /üîΩbsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pas thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab lam yin pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton gyi /
analyzed: chos kyi rigs pa las sor rton gyi gang gis gang de ltar brjod pa'i chos thams cad stong pa ma yin zhes pa lam yin / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pas thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab lam yin pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton gyi /
translated: In terms of the type of Dharma, rely on the Dharma of what is to be practiced, not on the Dharma of what is to be specifically known.üîΩIn terms of the type of wisdom, rely on the wisdom of the gnosis that arises from meditation, not on the wisdom of listening and reflection that is consciousness.üîΩIn terms of the type of sutra, rely on sutras of the ultimate meaning, not on those of the expedient meaning.

original: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde lam yin zhes pa ni rton pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde lam yin zhes pa ni rton pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: From the principle of Dharma, rely on the teaching, not the teacher, means: rely on the wisdom of the knowledge that arises from meditation, not on the wisdom of hearing and reflection with consciousness.

original: nges pa'i don ni gang du bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gtan la phab pa'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid don gang de nyid de ltar ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i don ni gang du bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gtan la phab pa'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid don gang de nyid de ltar ro //
translated: And rely on the sutras of definitive meaning, not on the sutras of provisional meaning means: rely on the sutra of definitive meaning, which is the ultimate truth of the emptiness of all phenomena that the Bhagavans have ascertained.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang lhan cig pa ni bang mdzod lta bu ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang lhan cig pa ni bang mdzod lta bu ste /
translated: The accumulation of merit and wisdom is like a treasury,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mang po'i gnas kyi mdzod yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mang po'i gnas kyi mdzod yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the treasury that is the basis for the many accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / lhan cig pa ni rgyal po'i lam po che lta bu ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / lhan cig pa ni rgyal po'i lam po che lta bu ste /
translated: The thirty-seven aids to enlightenment are like a royal highway,

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all noble persons have gone and are going there.üîΩTranquility,

original: zhi gnas su gyur pa dang snying rje dang lhag mthong dang lhan cig pa ni bzhon pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas su gyur pa dang snying rje dang lhag mthong dang lhan cig pa ni bzhon pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: compassion, and insight are like a vehicle,

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gzhan du mi ltung bas bde bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gzhan du mi ltung bas bde bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one goes happily without falling into the extremes of either worldly life or mortification.

original: gzungs dang spobs pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni bkod ma lta bu ste /üîΩchu 'dzin pa dang mi zad pa dang 'byung ba dang chos mthun pa ste /
analyzed: gzungs dang spobs pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni bkod ma lta bu ste / chu 'dzin pa dang mi zad pa dang 'byung ba dang chos mthun pa ste /
translated: The powers of memory and eloquence are like a river,üîΩbecause they are similar to a river in being full, inexhaustible, and flowing.

original: thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos kyi don 'dzin pa dang mi zad pa bstan pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos kyi don 'dzin pa dang mi zad pa bstan pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are full because one has attained the power of memory of Dharma, and inexhaustible because one teaches the Dharma without ever running out.

original: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal ba dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das ba zhi ba zhes bya ba'i chos ched du byed pa de dang / lhan cig pa ni sgra snyan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal ba dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das ba zhi ba zhes bya ba'i chos ched du byed pa de dang / lhan cig pa ni sgra snyan pa lta bu ste /
translated: The Dharma is like a pleasant sound,

original: thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis snyan pa thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis snyan pa thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who desire liberation hear it as pleasant.üîΩThe Dharma is like a river,üîΩbecause it flows naturally.üîΩThe Dharma is like a highway,üîΩbecause it is the path traveled by all the noble ones.üîΩThe Dharma is like a conveyance,

original: chos la skye ba med pa can gyi bzod pa thob pa can gyi bde bas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'bras bu'i bya ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam de dang lhan cig gyur pa ni /
analyzed: chos la skye ba med pa can gyi bzod pa thob pa can gyi bde bas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'bras bu'i bya ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam de dang lhan cig gyur pa ni /
translated: because it carries all beings across the river of samsara.

original: chu klung gi rgyun lta bu ste /
analyzed: chu klung gi rgyun lta bu ste /
translated: The Dharma is like a mine of jewels,

original: ngang gis 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngang gis 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it fulfills all wishes.üîΩThe Dharma is like a wish-fulfilling tree,üîΩbecause it bears the fruit of all wishes.

original: dga' ldan gyi gnas la sogs pa ni gnas pa kun tu bstan pa'i thabs la mkhas pa de dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i chos kyi sku dang lhan cig @12b tu gyur pa ni sprin lta bu ste /
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi gnas la sogs pa ni gnas pa kun tu bstan pa'i thabs la mkhas pa de dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i chos kyi sku dang lhan cig @12b tu gyur pa ni sprin lta bu ste /
translated: The abode of Tushita, etc., is the cloud-like Dharma Body, which is associated with the skill in means of displaying abiding in the world.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don gyi bya ba rnams la des 'jug ste sprin bzhin du snod kyi 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don gyi bya ba rnams la des 'jug ste sprin bzhin du snod kyi 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: It engages in the activities for the benefit of all sentient beings, like a cloud, with the excellence of the world as its container.

original: sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis po 'di ni blo gros mi zad pa'i mdor te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis po 'di ni blo gros mi zad pa'i mdor te /
translated: These twenty-two arousals of mind are in the Aksayamatinirdesa.

original: tshad med pa dang dngos po dang yang dag par rig pa dang mi rton pa dang ched du brjod pa lnga la bzhi bzhi ste gnyis pa tshogs dang zhi gnas dang gzungs kyis zil gyis gnon pa gsum la gnyis gnyis dang mngon par shes pa lnga rnams dang
analyzed: tshad med pa dang dngos po dang yang dag par rig pa dang mi rton pa dang ched du brjod pa lnga la bzhi bzhi ste gnyis pa tshogs dang zhi gnas dang gzungs kyis zil gyis gnon pa gsum la gnyis gnyis dang mngon par shes pa lnga rnams dang
translated: The four immeasurables, the five things, the five perfect knowledges, the five non-reliances, and the five expressions of joy are four each, and the two of the second, the three of the mass, calm abiding, and the overpowerings by retention are two each, and the five superknowledges,

original: / byang chub kyi phyogs dang / dang po'i sems bskyed pa bcu dang bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i thabs la mkhas pa las byung ba zhes pa'i brgyad cu mi zad par bshad do //
analyzed: / byang chub kyi phyogs dang / dang po'i sems bskyed pa bcu dang bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i thabs la mkhas pa las byung ba zhes pa'i brgyad cu mi zad par bshad do //
translated: The eighty inexhaustible topics are explained as the thirty-seven harmonies with enlightenment, the ten first-produced thoughts, and the skill in means that accompanies the path of single progress.

original: 'dir sbyor ba dang lhan cig pa'i bsam pa dag bzlog nas bstan pa ni gnyi ga la gnyis char du srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba dang lhan cig pa'i bsam pa dag bzlog nas bstan pa ni gnyi ga la gnyis char du srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the intention that accompanies application is taught as being reversed, because both are possible for both.

original: de nyid kyis 'phags pa thogs med kyis smon pa phan tshun gyi brgyud pa la sbyor ba bshad pas sems bskyed pa bco lnga pa la 'bring gi bcom ldan 'das mar mngon par shes par bsgrub pa ni gang du yang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis 'phags pa thogs med kyis smon pa phan tshun gyi brgyud pa la sbyor ba bshad pas sems bskyed pa bco lnga pa la 'bring gi bcom ldan 'das mar mngon par shes par bsgrub pa ni gang du yang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction in the noble Asanga's explanation of the application to the mutual continuum of aspiration, and the accomplishment of the superknowledges on the fifteenth thought of enlightenment in the medium Bhagavatƒ´.

original: de la dang po'i sems bskyed pa gsum ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab dag mthar phyin pa'i gnas skabs kyi thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: de la dang po'i sems bskyed pa gsum ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab dag mthar phyin pa'i gnas skabs kyi thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: The first three thoughts of enlightenment are the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation, which are the states of culmination of the wisdoms of hearing and contemplation.

original: las dang po pa'i sa'i tshogs kyi lam gyi tshogs kyis te /
analyzed: las dang po pa'i sa'i tshogs kyi lam gyi tshogs kyis te /
translated: The path of accumulation of the stage of beginners is the path of accumulation.üîΩFrom the stream of dharma, one obtains instructions from the Buddha.

original: chos kyi rgyun las sangs rgyas las gdams ngag thob par 'gyur zhes pas go rims ji lta ba bzhin chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dang / chen po la chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i gang zag gi yul rnams te dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang yang dag par spang ba dang /üîΩrdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang lhan cig pa'i go cha'i bsgrub pa ni smon pa'i sems la de'i gong gi bcu dgu ni 'jug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyun las sangs rgyas las gdams ngag thob par 'gyur zhes pas go rims ji lta ba bzhin chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dang / chen po la chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i gang zag gi yul rnams te dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang yang dag par spang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang lhan cig pa'i go cha'i bsgrub pa ni smon pa'i sems la de'i gong gi bcu dgu ni 'jug pa'i sems so //
translated: Thus, in order, the objects of the small, medium and great persons and the great, medium and small persons are the applications of mindfulness, the correct abandonings,üîΩthe bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment and the branches of the path.üîΩThe fourth generation of the Thought is the stage of action in faith, the stage of the joyous.

original: sems bskyed pa bzhi pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa ste rab tu dga' ba'i sa la sbyor ba'i lam 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa'i rang bzhin zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang po dang
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bzhi pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa ste rab tu dga' ba'i sa la sbyor ba'i lam 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa'i rang bzhin zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang po dang
translated: The path of preparation is the mundane path of meditation, the contaminated path of meditation, the roots of virtue that are conducive to penetrations.

original: stobs dang lhan cig pa ni /
analyzed: stobs dang lhan cig pa ni /
translated: The one accompanied by power

original: 'jug pa'i bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i bsgrub pa'o //

original: mdo dkon mchog sprin du sa 'di rnams su byang chub sems dpa' so so'i skye bo yin yang byis pa'i phun sum tshogs pa dang bral ba thams cad las 'das shing /üîΩgrangs @13a * //

translated: In the Sutra of the Cloud of Jewels, it is said that on these stages, although the bodhisattvas are ordinary beings, they transcend all the perfections of childish beings and

analyzed: lnga pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems bskyed pa dang po ste /

original: drug pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi sems bskyed pa bco lnga pa'i dang po ste 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag dang lhan cig pa'o //

translated: The sixth is the first of the fifteen generations of the supramundane mind of the path of meditation, which is accompanied by the branches of the ƒÅrya path.

analyzed: 'di'i dang po'i dgu ni dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa dgu pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan drug ni chos kyi sprin gyi sa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi lam la'o //
