analyzed: 'di'i tha ma bar chad med lam sangs rgyas kyi sa la gcig go //
translated: The last of these is the uninterrupted path on the stage of the Buddha.

original: rgyu 'dis na sngas rgyas kyi sas bsdus zhes pa'i seng ge bzang po'i 'dod pas nye bar brtags pa dgos pa med pas mi rigs so //
analyzed: rgyu 'dis na sngas rgyas kyi sas bsdus zhes pa'i seng ge bzang po'i 'dod pas nye bar brtags pa dgos pa med pas mi rigs so //
translated: For this reason, the assertion of Haribhadra that the stage of the Buddha is included in the tenth stage is unreasonable, because it is pointless.

original: sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gcig pa dang rtsa gnyis pa ni dngos gzhi dang rjes kyis sangs rgyas kyis zhes pa ste de ni sems bskyed pa rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gcig pa dang rtsa gnyis pa ni dngos gzhi dang rjes kyis sangs rgyas kyis zhes pa ste de ni sems bskyed pa rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The twenty-first and twenty-second moments of the generation of the resolve are the stage of the Buddha in the actual and subsequent stages. This is the analysis of the generation of the resolve.

original: sh'a ri'i bu ni ma'i ming la sh'a ri ni rigs yin pas sha ra dva ti ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu ni ma'i ming la sh'a ri ni rigs yin pas sha ra dva ti ste /

original: shes rab dang spobs pa de dag gi stobs skyed pa po ni nus pa'i bag chags so //

translated: The ‚Äúpower‚Äù of wisdom and eloquence is the latent potential for ability.

original: de'i bskyed pa ni mngon du skyes pas so //
analyzed: de'i bskyed pa ni mngon du skyes pas so //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs pa na mthu dang nus pas so //

original: 'on te sangs rgyas kyi mthu zhes pa ni nyan thos rnams ni mnyam par ma bzhag na gzhan gyi sems shes pa la mi 'jug pas so //
analyzed: 'on te sangs rgyas kyi mthu zhes pa ni nyan thos rnams ni mnyam par ma bzhag na gzhan gyi sems shes pa la mi 'jug pas so //

original: sems pa dang sems ni rnam grangs te mngon par shes pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: sems pa dang sems ni rnam grangs te mngon par shes pa'i tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúMind‚Äù and ‚Äúthought‚Äù are synonyms, terms for superknowledge.

original: sems kyi yongs su rtog pa ni de nyid na gnas pas na mi gsal ba ste /
analyzed: sems kyi yongs su rtog pa ni de nyid na gnas pas na mi gsal ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMental conception‚Äù is unclear because it remains in just that state.

original: yongs su tshol ba po'i yid kyi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba po'i yid kyi brjod pa'o //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni 'khor la mdo ste la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni 'khor la mdo ste la sogs pa rnams so //

original: ston pa ni de nyid gzhan la'o //
analyzed: ston pa ni de nyid gzhan la'o //
translated: The teacher is the one who teaches it to others.

original: 'chad pa ni dri ba la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni dri ba la sogs pa la'o //

original: nye bar bstan pa ni phyogs nas nye bar song zhing gdul bya rnams la gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa ni phyogs nas nye bar song zhing gdul bya rnams la gsungs pa'o //

original: de bzhin @13b du gang bcom ldan 'das kyis de lta bu'i dngos po ston pa dang bshad pa dang 'khor la rab tu ston par byed pa de nyid gzhan rnams kyis yang dag par rab tu ston par byed pa ste /

translated: In the same way, the one who teaches, explains, and demonstrates to the assembly such things as the Buddha's teachings, explanations, and demonstrations, that very one is the one who perfectly demonstrates it to others.

original: khor yug tu son nas rang gis rab ston par byed pa'i gsungs pa la sogs pa de thams cad skyes bu'i byed pa ste /
analyzed: khor yug tu son nas rang gis rab ston par byed pa'i gsungs pa la sogs pa de thams cad skyes bu'i byed pa ste /

analyzed: de'i byin gyi rlabs kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir na nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi rang dbang gis ni ma yin no //

analyzed: 'dir rgyu des na zhes pa kun tu bshad par 'dod nas rang gis dris pa ni de ci'i phyir zhes pa ste /

original: gang gi phyir de'i rgyu gsungs pa ni chos gang zhes te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i rgyu gsungs pa ni chos gang zhes te /
translated: The cause of that is stated: ‚Äúwhatever Dharma‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang theg pa chen po la slob par byed pas thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa rnams kyis te de la ji ltar thos pa rnams mngon sum du byed pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa can rnams so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang theg pa chen po la slob par byed pas thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa rnams kyis te de la ji ltar thos pa rnams mngon sum du byed pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa can rnams so //
translated: Those who train in the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle and the Great Vehicle, through listening, reflection, and meditation.  There, those who actualize what they hear are the ≈örƒÅvakas.

original: 'dzin par byed pa ni theg pa chen po pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa ni theg pa chen po pa ste /

analyzed: chos des ji ltar thos pa'i thos pa dang bsam pa dag gis brtan par gyur pas dran pa'i sa bon 'jog pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar thos pa nyid kyi chos des rang gi ston pa des na'o //
translated: Thus, by that Dharma of listening, one‚Äôs own teacher is not contradicted.

analyzed: 'gal bar mi byed ces pa ni nyan thos rnams bdag nyid chen por gsungs so //

analyzed: 'di ltar sh'a ri'i bus rnam par rtog pa nyid ni rab 'byor gyis 'dir bstan pas ston pa ma yin zhes kha cig dag gi dogs pa de bzlog pa ste /

analyzed: gdams ngag bstan pa 'dod nas nye bar 'jug pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
translated: With the desire to teach the instruction, he engages with Then, the Blessed One said to Subhuti the Elder...

original: de la de ni phyogs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la de ni phyogs bstan pa'o //
translated: There, then indicates the time.

original: tshig bla dgas ni ming ste /
analyzed: tshig bla dgas ni ming ste /
translated: Designation is name.

original: chos kyi dngos po ni gang du ji ltar med la /
analyzed: chos kyi dngos po ni gang du ji ltar med la /
translated: The entity of dharma is where and how it does not exist.

original: bdag gi dngos po ni kun rdzob tu yang med ces bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po ni kun rdzob tu yang med ces bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The entity of self is also non-existent conventionally, he thinks.

original: chos ni phung po lnga la sogs pa can la /
analyzed: chos ni phung po lnga la sogs pa can la /
translated: Dharma has the five aggregates and so on.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' ma dmigs pa ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i shes pa la phung po la sogs pa mi dmigs pa ni chos @14a * //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro // byang chub sems dpa' ma dmigs pa ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i shes pa la phung po la sogs pa mi dmigs pa ni chos @14a * //
translated: Not seeing them as real is because ultimately they are essenceless.

original: la bdag med pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: la bdag med pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The non-apprehension of the bodhisattva is the knowledge of the selflessness of persons. The non-apprehension of the aggregates and so forth is the knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena.üîΩBoth of these are the perfection of wisdom.

original: de gnyi ga shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de yang don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhes pa ni mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de yang don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhes pa ni mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: That also is ultimately empty of essence.

original: 'di lta bu'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kha cig tu gcig pu zhig tu dben par song nas lung gi don la nges par rtogs pa las skye bar 'gyur ba de ni thos pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kha cig tu gcig pu zhig tu dben par song nas lung gi don la nges par rtogs pa las skye bar 'gyur ba de ni thos pa las byung ba'o //
translated: This kind of perfection of wisdom arises from hearing, from going to a solitary place and reflecting on the meaning of the scriptures.

original: de ltar yang the tshom gang du yang med pas rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa stobs kyis skye bar 'gyur ba'i rigs pa de ni bsams pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang the tshom gang du yang med pas rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa stobs kyis skye bar 'gyur ba'i rigs pa de ni bsams pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Since there is no doubt in that way, it arises by the power of inference and so forth. That is the perfection of wisdom arisen from contemplation.

original: de dag gis the tshom drungs phyung nas dang du len par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas sgom pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gis the tshom drungs phyung nas dang du len par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas sgom pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Having uprooted doubt, one attains meditative stabilization that readily accepts those, and then meditates.

original: de la dang po gnyis bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni bdag gi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang po gnyis bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni bdag gi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The first two of those are taught with the intention of teaching the desire for the selflessness of phenomena and the desire for the selflessness of persons.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ni nang gi bdag nyid can gyi phung po lnga la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ni nang gi bdag nyid can gyi phung po lnga la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phenomena of the bodhisattva are the five aggregates and so forth that are of the nature of the internal self.

original: ma 'tshal ba ni thob pa med pa ste tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'tshal ba ni thob pa med pa ste tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not known is not obtained, because it is undermined by valid knowledge.

original: de nyid la gnod pa bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni ma dmigs zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid la gnod pa bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni ma dmigs zhes pa ste /
translated: The desire to teach the undermining of that is stated with ‚Äúnot observed,‚Äù

original: lung las skyes pa'i mi dmigs pas gnod par byed pa yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: lung las skyes pa'i mi dmigs pas gnod par byed pa yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba'o //
translated: because it is undermined by the non-observation that arises from scripture.

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pas gnod par byed pa 'dis rjes su ma dmigs zhes pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pas gnod par byed pa 'dis rjes su ma dmigs zhes pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot observed by inference‚Äù and so forth teaches the wisdom arisen from hearing, because it is undermined by inference and so forth.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhes pa'i rigs pa ni bsam pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhes pa'i rigs pa ni bsam pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The reasoning of ‚Äúnot seeing as real‚Äù is of the nature of reflection.

original: rigs pa brjod de gang zhig ni ci yang med pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa brjod de gang zhig ni ci yang med pa'o //
translated: The reasoning is stated: ‚ÄúWhat is there is nothing at all.‚Äù

original: gang 'dir zhes pa ni don dam par gang du yang med pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'dir zhes pa ni don dam par gang du yang med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù means in the ultimate, there is nothing at all.

original: kun rdzob tu ni rtog par byed pa la 'doms pas gdams ngag la rjes su 'jug par bstan pa ni rjes su bstan pa'o zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni rtog par byed pa la 'doms pas gdams ngag la rjes su 'jug par bstan pa ni rjes su bstan pa'o zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the instruction is the teaching of the instruction for the one who is instructed in the conventional, intending that the one who is instructed is the one who engages in the instruction.

original: rdzogs pa'i zhi gnas la rab tu 'jug par byed pa gang de dang lhan cig tu dpyod pa can gyi shes rab de ni lta ba dang rig pa dang blo dang snang ba dang lhag mthong la /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i zhi gnas la rab tu 'jug par byed pa gang de dang lhan cig tu dpyod pa can gyi shes rab de ni lta ba dang rig pa dang blo dang snang ba dang lhag mthong la /
translated: The wisdom that is the analyzer that engages in perfect ≈õamatha is the view, knowledge, mind, appearance, and vipa≈õyanƒÅ.

original: de gnyi ga zung du 'brel ba can ni bsgom pa'i rang bzhin can gyi shes rab ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga zung du 'brel ba can ni bsgom pa'i rang bzhin can gyi shes rab ste /
translated: The wisdom that is the nature of meditation is the union of those two.

original: de bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni 'on kyang zhes pa dang gal te zhes pa ni don dam par 'jug pa na gal te'o //
analyzed: de bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni 'on kyang zhes pa dang gal te zhes pa ni don dam par 'jug pa na gal te'o //
translated: With the desire to teach that, it is said, ‚ÄúHowever‚Äù and ‚ÄúIf‚Äù are used in the context of engaging in the ultimate.

original: 'di ltar zhes pa dang / de bdag gis zhes pa la sogs pas te smra bar byed pa la zhes pa la sogs pa ni da lta ba la nye ba'i phyir ni gsung bar byed pa don gsungs zhes pa la sogs par @14b shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes pa dang / de bdag gis zhes pa la sogs pas te smra bar byed pa la zhes pa la sogs pa ni da lta ba la nye ba'i phyir ni gsung bar byed pa don gsungs zhes pa la sogs par @14b shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus and I and so on. One who speaks and so on is understood as one who speaks, one who teaches, and so on, because it is proximate to the present.

original: 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa ni bstan par byed pa ni thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa ni bstan par byed pa ni thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: The detailed explanation of this is: One who teaches is by the nature of the wisdom of hearing.

original: nye bar bstan par byed ces pa ni bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi mtshan nyid kyis mngon sum du dpyod par 'gyur ro zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: nye bar bstan par byed ces pa ni bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi mtshan nyid kyis mngon sum du dpyod par 'gyur ro zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: One who demonstrates is by the nature of the wisdom of reflection. One who analyzes is by the nature of the wisdom of meditation. One who makes known is by the nature of the wisdom of realization. One who makes manifest is by the nature of the wisdom of teaching.

original: 'dir thar pa 'dod pa rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan rnams la mngon par yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid la dad pa de las 'dod pa skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir thar pa 'dod pa rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan rnams la mngon par yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid la dad pa de las 'dod pa skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Here, for those who desire liberation, desire arises from faith, which has the characteristic of clear conviction in the qualities of samadhi.

original: de'i stobs las brtson 'grus de'i stobs las lus dang sems sbyangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i stobs las brtson 'grus de'i stobs las lus dang sems sbyangs pa nyid do //
translated: From that, effort arises. From the power of that, there is the purification of body and mind.

original: des le lo rnam par mi 'jug nas dran pas yang dag par dmigs pa la nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des le lo rnam par mi 'jug nas dran pas yang dag par dmigs pa la nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he is established in vigilance, he is established in the correct observation of enthusiasm.üîΩSince he is established in enthusiasm, he is established in the correct observation of faith.üîΩSince he is established in faith, he is established in the correct observation of the mental attention of the Buddha and so on.üîΩSince he is established in the mental attention of the Buddha and so on, he is established in the correct observation of the mental attention of the Dharma.üîΩSince he is established in the mental attention of the Dharma, he is established in the correct observation of the mental attention of the Sa·πÖgha.üîΩSince he is established in the mental attention of the Sa·πÖgha, he is established in the correct observation of the mental attention of the precepts.

original: des shes bzhin la des dga' ba'i dngos po sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yon tan yid la byas nas des de nyid ji ltar thos pa dang bsam pa'i don de nyid la ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa'i sems la brnyas pa med nas zhugs par mi 'gyur te
analyzed: des shes bzhin la des dga' ba'i dngos po sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yon tan yid la byas nas des de nyid ji ltar thos pa dang bsam pa'i don de nyid la ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa'i sems la brnyas pa med nas zhugs par mi 'gyur te
translated: Since he is established in the mental attention of the precepts, he is established in the correct observation of the mental attention of the deities.üîΩSince he is established in the mental attention of the deities, he is established in the correct observation of the mental attention of the aggregates.

original: / de nyid kyis nges par bcings pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkun tu mi zhum pa mi 'gyur ba ni rgyun tu 'jug pas kyang zhum par 'ong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: / de nyid kyis nges par bcings pa'i phyir ro // kun tu mi zhum pa mi 'gyur ba ni rgyun tu 'jug pas kyang zhum par 'ong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since he is established in the mental attention of the aggregates, he is established in the correct observation of the mental attention of the elements.üîΩSince he is established in the mental attention of the elements, he is established in the correct observation of the mental attention of the sense bases.üîΩSince he is established in the mental attention of the sense bases, he is established in the correct observation of the mental attention of dependent origination.üîΩSince he is established in the mental attention of dependent origination, he is established in the correct observation of the mental attention of the truths.üîΩSince he is established in the mental attention of the truths, he is established in the correct observation of the mental attention of the perfections.üîΩSince he is established in the mental attention of the perfections, he is established in the correct observation of the mental attention of the emptinesses.üîΩSince he is established in the mental attention of the emptinesses, he is established in the correct observation of the mental attention of the doors of liberation.

original: gzhan du 'gro ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrang bzhin gyis g-yo ba'i phyir rgod nas gzhan du 'gro ba yang myur du shes par byas la yang bsdus na yang mi rgod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gro ba bkag pa'i phyir ro // rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba'i phyir rgod nas gzhan du 'gro ba yang myur du shes par byas la yang bsdus na yang mi rgod pa'o //
translated: Since he is established in the mental attention of the doors of liberation, he is established in the correct observation of the mental attention of the immeasurables.

original: kun tu mi zhum pa ni bstan par 'gyur ba'i sems kyi rang bzhin rigs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: kun tu mi zhum pa ni bstan par 'gyur ba'i sems kyi rang bzhin rigs pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since he is established in the mental attention of the immeasurables, he is established in the correct observation of the mental attention of

original: gzhan du rnam par 'phro ba'i gong nas gong du zhib mor byed pa la dub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du rnam par 'phro ba'i gong nas gong du zhib mor byed pa la dub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not wearied by the increasingly subtle analysis of the other aspects.

original: phyir phyogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyir phyogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: He does not turn away from it,

original: ting nge 'dzin byad pa la yang btang snyoms su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin byad pa la yang btang snyoms su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he remains indifferent to the faults of concentration.

original: ji ltar na de nyid la sems dga' bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de nyid la sems dga' bar byed ce na /
translated: How does he delight his mind in it?

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi yon tan mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi yon tan mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he sees the virtues of the meditative concentrations.

original: bcom zhing phyir phyogs par mi 'gyur ba ni de la dga' ba dang bde bas rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa can du mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: bcom zhing phyir phyogs par mi 'gyur ba ni de la dga' ba dang bde bas rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa can du mi byed pa ste /
translated: He does not destroy it or turn away from it, because he does not allow himself to be distracted by delight and pleasure in it.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because he sees the faults of distraction.

original: skyon ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams so //
analyzed: skyon ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams so //
translated: The faults are the sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: mi dngang ba ni brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba la sogs pa ldang bas mi skrag ste /
analyzed: mi dngang ba ni brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba la sogs pa ldang bas mi skrag ste /
translated: He is not frightened by the arising of covetousness, mental dissatisfaction, etc.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩde nyid bcom ste /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / de nyid bcom ste /
translated: How is that?

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has destroyed them and sees the faults of distraction.

original: kun tu mi skrag ste /
analyzed: kun tu mi skrag ste /
translated: He is not terrified by them.

original: sems rang bzhin gyis skyon med par rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i don du 'du byed la 'bad pa des skrag @15a * //üîΩpar mi byed ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: sems rang bzhin gyis skyon med par rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i don du 'du byed la 'bad pa des skrag @15a * // par mi byed ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should not be afraid of the effort of application in order to enter into the natural purity of mind.

original: kun tu skrag par mi 'gyur ba ni lhun gyis grub par ngang gis 'jug pa nyid kyis sems la skrag pa kun tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun tu skrag par mi 'gyur ba ni lhun gyis grub par ngang gis 'jug pa nyid kyis sems la skrag pa kun tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The absence of fear is the non-occurrence of fear in the mind, due to the very spontaneous and natural engagement.

original: lhun gyis grub pa de nyid ngang gis 'jug pa 'dzin par 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa de nyid ngang gis 'jug pa 'dzin par 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should hold to that very spontaneity as the natural engagement.

original: gzhan yang lhun gyis ma grub pa ni sems rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang lhun gyis ma grub pa ni sems rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the absence of spontaneity is due to the distraction of mind.

original: de ltar yang mdo sde rgyan las /
analyzed: de ltar yang mdo sde rgyan las /
translated: Thus, in the Ornament of the MahƒÅyƒÅna S≈´tras, it says:

original: dmigs pas sems ni nges bcings la //
analyzed: dmigs pas sems ni nges bcings la //
translated: The mind is bound by the object.

original: de rgyun rnam par g-yeng mi bya //
analyzed: de rgyun rnam par g-yeng mi bya //
translated: Do not be distracted from its continuity.

original: rnam g-yengs myur du rtogs byas la //
analyzed: rnam g-yengs myur du rtogs byas la //
translated: Quickly recognize distraction,

original: de yis so sor yang bsdu bya //
analyzed: de yis so sor yang bsdu bya //
translated: and with that, gather the mind.

original: so sor dag la kun bsdus sems //
analyzed: so sor dag la kun bsdus sems //
translated: When the mind is gathered in each,

original: gong nas gong du blo ldan gyis //
analyzed: gong nas gong du blo ldan gyis //
translated: the wise ones,

original: ting 'dzin yon tan mthong gyur pa //
analyzed: ting 'dzin yon tan mthong gyur pa //
translated: seeing the qualities of samƒÅdhi,

original: de yis sems ni dga' byas la //
analyzed: de yis sems ni dga' byas la //
translated: The mind is gladdened by that,

original: rnam g-yengs skyon ni mthong 'gyur ba //
analyzed: rnam g-yengs skyon ni mthong 'gyur ba //
translated: and the faults of distraction are seen.

original: de yis dga' yin zhi bar bya /
analyzed: de yis dga' yin zhi bar bya /
translated: It is gladdened by that, and is pacified.

original: brnab sems yid mi bde la sogs //
analyzed: brnab sems yid mi bde la sogs //
translated: Covetousness, mental unhappiness, and so on

original: langs pa de bzhin zhi bar bya //üîΩde yis mngon par 'du byas pa'i //
analyzed: langs pa de bzhin zhi bar bya // de yis mngon par 'du byas pa'i //
translated: arise, and are pacified in the same way.üîΩBy that, the mind is brought into being

original: sems kyi ngang du gyur pa nyid //
analyzed: sems kyi ngang du gyur pa nyid //
translated: in a state of composure.

original: de la goms pa'i rnal 'byor pas //
analyzed: de la goms pa'i rnal 'byor pas //
translated: The yogi/nƒ´ who is accustomed to that

original: des ni mngon 'dus ma byas thob //
analyzed: des ni mngon 'dus ma byas thob //
translated: attains the non-composing.

original: ces te / de bzhin du zhi gnas rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ces te / de bzhin du zhi gnas rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Thus, ≈õamatha is perfected.

original: 'di nyid zhes pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin mthar thug pa'i kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam par dbye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid zhes pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin mthar thug pa'i kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam par dbye ba shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis itself‚Äù is the knowledge of the division of the ultimate and the conventional of the culmination of samƒÅdhi as it has been explained.

original: 'di nyid ces pa ni de'i ting nge 'dzin dang yang dag par rab tu ldan pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces pa ni de'i ting nge 'dzin dang yang dag par rab tu ldan pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: ‚ÄúThis itself‚Äù is the wisdom that is perfectly endowed with that samƒÅdhi.

original: 'di nyid gdams pa ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid gdams pa ste /
translated: This is the instruction,

original: gang dag zhi gnas dang shes rab dag phan tshun yang dag par sbyor ba'i yon tan gyis so //
analyzed: gang dag zhi gnas dang shes rab dag phan tshun yang dag par sbyor ba'i yon tan gyis so //
translated: by the quality of the mutual correct application of ≈õamatha and wisdom.

original: sems ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i de kho na nyid la de las phyir phyogs pa thams cad ni rnam par g-yengs pa'i zhes brjod la /
analyzed: sems ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i de kho na nyid la de las phyir phyogs pa thams cad ni rnam par g-yengs pa'i zhes brjod la /
translated: The mind is the reality of the unreality of all things. All that turns away from that is called ‚Äúdistraction.‚Äù

original: de kho na nyid gcig tu mthar thug pa ni kun rdzob tu skad cig gis 'jig pa can yin yang mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid gcig tu mthar thug pa ni kun rdzob tu skad cig gis 'jig pa can yin yang mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The one ultimate reality is meditative equipoise, even though it is conventionally momentary and perishable.

original: de nyid kyis na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag ni 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag ni 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, serenity and insight are not mutually exclusive.

original: de kho na nyid ma yin pa la dmigs pa las ldog pa'i bdag nyid can gyis sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang yang dag pa'i shes pa dag phan tshun rjes su sbyar nas bskyed pas rab kyi mthar thug pa na ro gcig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma yin pa la dmigs pa las ldog pa'i bdag nyid can gyis sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang yang dag pa'i shes pa dag phan tshun rjes su sbyar nas bskyed pas rab kyi mthar thug pa na ro gcig par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the one-pointedness of mind and right knowledge, which have the nature of turning away from the observation of what is not reality, are generated by being mutually applied, they become of one taste at the ultimate limit of perfection.

original: de ltar 'dir zhi gnas dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi kun rdzob dang don dam pa ro gcig @15b pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa ni 'dir mnyam par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir zhi gnas dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi kun rdzob dang don dam pa ro gcig @15b pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa ni 'dir mnyam par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, here, the meditative stabilization of the unity of the conventional and the ultimate, which has the nature of serenity and insight, is not a union.

original: 'di nyid 'di'i gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'di'i gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the instruction and the teaching for that.

original: gdams pa'i rgyun ni rjes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gdams pa'i rgyun ni rjes bstan pa'o //
translated: The continuity of instruction is the teaching.

original: de ltar dang po'i byang chub sems dang des bsdus pa'i chos kyi ngo bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las mi 'da' zhing dmigs pa med pa'i spyod pas so sor sgrub pa'i gdams ngag ni sgrub pa
analyzed: de ltar dang po'i byang chub sems dang des bsdus pa'i chos kyi ngo bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las mi 'da' zhing dmigs pa med pa'i spyod pas so sor sgrub pa'i gdams ngag ni sgrub pa
translated: Thus, the instruction for the practice is the instruction for the first generation of the Thought and for the perfection of wisdom which is the essence of the Dharma included in that, by means of the practice of the two truths, the conventional and the ultimate, and by means of the practice which is without objective.

original: la gdams pa ste /
analyzed: la gdams pa ste /
translated: The instruction for the practice is

original: 'dir ni bsdus pa'i don no //
analyzed: 'dir ni bsdus pa'i don no //

original: sgrub pa la snying por byed pa la ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnyed par mi dka' la /
analyzed: sgrub pa la snying por byed pa la ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnyed par mi dka' la /
translated: For one who makes the practice essential, it is not difficult to find the unsurpassed, right, perfect enlightenment.

original: sgrub pa de yang mdor bsdu na byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs la rjes su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa de yang mdor bsdu na byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs la rjes su gnas pa'o //
translated: And that practice, in brief, is the cultivation of the Thought of Enlightenment and the abiding in the method of generosity and so on.

original: de la byang chub kyi sems ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Therein, the Thought of Enlightenment is the nature of voidness and compassion.

original: de la phung po lnga po rnams la ji srid du dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa de thams cad ni phyin ci log gi spros pa la /
analyzed: de la phung po lnga po rnams la ji srid du dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa de thams cad ni phyin ci log gi spros pa la /
translated: In this regard, all conceptualizations of the five aggregates as entities or non-entities are erroneous conceptual elaborations.

original: spros pa med pa ni chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: spros pa med pa ni chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of conceptual elaboration is the emptiness of the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: stong pa nyid du brjod pa ni sgro btags pa thams cad las ldog pa rab tu bsgrubs pas gdul bya'i rgyud la de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo mngon par gsal bar byed par 'gyur zhes pas na 'dir brjod par bya ba la nye bar btags nas stong
analyzed: stong pa nyid du brjod pa ni sgro btags pa thams cad las ldog pa rab tu bsgrubs pas gdul bya'i rgyud la de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo mngon par gsal bar byed par 'gyur zhes pas na 'dir brjod par bya ba la nye bar btags nas stong
translated: Since emptiness is expressed in order to completely establish the cessation of all superimpositions, it causes the reality of thatness to become manifest in the mindstreams of those to be trained.

original: pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgra brjod de ;
analyzed: pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgra brjod de ;
translated: Therefore, the term emptiness and so on is applied to the object of expression here.

original: sgro btags pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i ngo bo de kho na nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro btags pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i ngo bo de kho na nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the object of observation of thatness, the nature free from all superimpositions.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das ma bdun brgya pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das ma bdun brgya pa las gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the SaptasatikƒÅ Praj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ:

original: bcom ldan 'das gang du yang rab tu mi gnas pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang du yang rab tu mi gnas pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ste /

original: chos gang la yang gnas pa nye bar dmigs pa dang mi gnas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos gang la yang gnas pa nye bar dmigs pa dang mi gnas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: No phenomenon is observed to abide or not to abide.

original: chos gang la yang mi sems zhing mi shes gang kho nar sems pa med pa de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa ma skyes pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos kyi dbyings kun tu spyod pa med pa'i dbyings zhes pa dang gnyis su byar med
analyzed: chos gang la yang mi sems zhing mi shes gang kho nar sems pa med pa de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa ma skyes pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos kyi dbyings kun tu spyod pa med pa'i dbyings zhes pa dang gnyis su byar med
translated: Not thinking about any phenomenon, not knowing any phenomenon, that very absence of thought is nirvana.

translated: The Sutra of the Non-apprehension of All Phenomena states:üîΩHaving realized this, one does not make any phenomenon into oneness or multiplicity. It is without conceptualization and is the realization of the authentic state, O Transcendent Conqueror.

translated: Because it is generated by the objective non-support of great compassion and the objective non-support of the unreality of all things, the emptiness of the objective non-support is cultivated by the bodhisattva through the identity of compassion and emptiness.

original: sems par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sems par mi bya ste /
translated: Having turned away from all mental attentions to the five aggregates, such as their reality and unreality, the bodhisattva should gather his mind to all of them and not think about them at all.

translated: taken all transmigrators as objects in this way, one generates great compassion,üîΩwhich has the nature of nonapprehension. Having generated that, one sees thatüîΩwisdom and compassion are of the nature of nonduality, and are mixed into

analyzed: po skye bar gyur nas des shes rab dang snying rje dag dbyer med pa'i ngo bo gnyis su med cing gcig tu 'dres par gyur par mthong ngo //

original: de'i gnas dang shes rab dag gis bdag nyid @16b kyis chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang snying rje chen po dbyer med pa'i phyir kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis gcig
analyzed: de'i gnas dang shes rab dag gis bdag nyid @16b kyis chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang snying rje chen po dbyer med pa'i phyir kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis gcig
translated: By means of its basis and wisdom, the essence of the generation of the thought of enlightenment of the path of union is the yoga of nonconceptual supreme nondiscrimination, which is the nature of all merit and wisdom, because of the inseparability of the perfection of wisdom and great compassion, which are characterized by the realization of the realitylessness of all things by oneself.

original: pa nyid kyis zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i ngo bo mchog tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnal 'byor bsod nams dang ye shes thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi mngon par rtogs pa brgyad po rnams kyis ji ltar rigs par mi mthun
analyzed: pa nyid kyis zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i ngo bo mchog tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnal 'byor bsod nams dang ye shes thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi mngon par rtogs pa brgyad po rnams kyis ji ltar rigs par mi mthun
translated: The eight realizations, which are the antidotes to the discordant classes, are the single identity of the two, the conventional and the ultimate, because of the identity of the two, the conventional and the ultimate.

original: pa'i phyogs ldog pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rnam pa kun ji ltar rigs par mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs su ro gcig pa nyid ni sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi skabs su mgon pos rnam par gzhag par byas so //
analyzed: pa'i phyogs ldog pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rnam pa kun ji ltar rigs par mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs su ro gcig pa nyid ni sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi skabs su mgon pos rnam par gzhag par byas so //
translated: The identity of the single taste in the state of equipoise, in all aspects as they occur, is posited by the Lord in the context of the twenty-two generations of the thought of enlightenment.

original: de las langs nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs su sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs bsten pa'i dus su yang mos pa de nyid bsgom par bya zhes pa nyid ni zung du 'brel pas bgrod pa'i lam la 'di nyid sgrub pa la gdams pas te /

translated: This is advice for practicing this path of union.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'dir tshogs shing bsdus nas gsungs la 'di las gzhan pa'i gdams ngag rnams ni zhad tsam du gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'dir tshogs shing bsdus nas gsungs la 'di las gzhan pa'i gdams ngag rnams ni zhad tsam du gsungs pa yin la /
translated: This is taught in this Bhagavatƒ´, and other advice is taught in a small way.

original: yum chen mo la ni bcu char yang rgyas par gsungs te /
analyzed: yum chen mo la ni bcu char yang rgyas par gsungs te /
translated: In the great mother, all ten are taught extensively.

original: 'dir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos las /
translated: Here, the treatise says:

original: sgrub dang bden pa rnams dang ni //
analyzed: sgrub dang bden pa rnams dang ni //
translated: The ten topics are the practice, the truths,

original: sangs rgyas la sogs dkon mchog gsum //üîΩma zhen yongs su mi ngal dang // lam ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang // spyan lnga dang ni mngon shes kyi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs dkon mchog gsum // ma zhen yongs su mi ngal dang // lam ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang // spyan lnga dang ni mngon shes kyi //
translated: the three jewels of the Buddha and so on,üîΩnonattachment, nonwearying,üîΩgrasping the path, the five eyes, the six qualities of clairvoyance,üîΩthe path of seeing,

original: yon tan drug dang mthong lam dang // sgom zhes bya la gdams ngag ni //
analyzed: yon tan drug dang mthong lam dang // sgom zhes bya la gdams ngag ni //
translated: and the path of meditation.

original: bcu yi bdag nyid shes par bya //
analyzed: bcu yi bdag nyid shes par bya //
translated: One should know that there are ten topics of advice.

original: zhes so // de la gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang de stong pa nyid ni gang du cung zad ldan pa'am mi ldan par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: zhes so // de la gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang de stong pa nyid ni gang du cung zad ldan pa'am mi ldan par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: In that regard, one does not see that form, etc. and its emptiness are in any way connected or not connected.

original: de rnams kyang de'i ngo bo nyid kyis na tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag tu mi sbyor bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bar rig par bya zhes pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la gdams pa'o//
analyzed: de rnams kyang de'i ngo bo nyid kyis na tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag tu mi sbyor bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bar rig par bya zhes pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la gdams pa'o//
translated: Since they are not connected as different or not different in their very essence, one should know that one is connected with the perfection of wisdom. This is the instruction on the truth of suffering.üîΩOne does not see that which has form, etc. as having the attributes of arising and ceasing, defilement and purification. Form, etc. up to consciousness is emptiness, and emptiness is consciousness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa can la skye ba dang 'gag pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong la gzugs nas ji srid du rnam par shes pa'i bar nyid stong pa la stong pa nyid kyangüîΩrnam par shes pa'o zhes dbyer med pa'i sgro 'dogs dang skur ba'i mtha' @17a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa can la skye ba dang 'gag pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong la gzugs nas ji srid du rnam par shes pa'i bar nyid stong pa la stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa'o zhes dbyer med pa'i sgro 'dogs dang skur ba'i mtha' @17a * //
translated: The emptiness of form, etc. is not form, etc. The emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.üîΩThe emptiness of form, etc. is not other than form, etc. The emptiness of consciousness is not other than consciousness.üîΩForm, etc. is not emptiness. Emptiness is not form, etc. Consciousness is not emptiness. Emptiness is not consciousness.

original: yongs su spangs pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su spangs pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: Thus, one should know that one is connected with the perfection of wisdom. This is the instruction on the truth of origination.

original: stong pa nyid ni skye bar mi 'gyur 'gag par mi 'gyur zhes pa nas ji srid du 'phel bar mi 'gyur la de la gzugs la sogs pa med cing kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam med pa nas ji srid du sangs rgyas med byang chub med
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni skye bar mi 'gyur 'gag par mi 'gyur zhes pa nas ji srid du 'phel bar mi 'gyur la de la gzugs la sogs pa med cing kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam med pa nas ji srid du sangs rgyas med byang chub med
translated: Emptiness does not arise and does not cease, and so on up to it does not increase. It does not have form and so on, and it does not have origination, cessation, path, and so on up to it does not have a Buddha and does not have enlightenment.

original: ces pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la'o //
translated: This is the truth of cessation.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa dang bdag nyid ldan pa'am mi ldan par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'das pa la sogs pa
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa dang bdag nyid ldan pa'am mi ldan par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'das pa la sogs pa
translated: When he practices the perfection of wisdom, he does not see the six perfections and so on as being connected with himself or not connected with himself, and so on up to he does not connect the knowledge of all aspects with the past and so on.

original: rnams su sbyor bar mi byed de /
analyzed: rnams su sbyor bar mi byed de /
translated: He does not make them into something connected or something not connected.

original: dus gsum stong pa nyid nye bar gzung ba'i phyir zhes pa ni lam gyi bden pa'i'o //
analyzed: dus gsum stong pa nyid nye bar gzung ba'i phyir zhes pa ni lam gyi bden pa'i'o //
translated: Because he takes up the emptiness of the three times. This is the truth of the path.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po lam du bshad pa rnams la sangs rgyas nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po lam du bshad pa rnams la sangs rgyas nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: Buddhahood is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la phung po dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sbyor bar byed pa gang de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes pa nas ji srid du sangs rgyas dang sbyor bar byed pa gang de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /üîΩde la des gang du de mthong ba med la de bzhin du byang chub med cing des de'i byang chub par bya ba med do //
analyzed: de la phung po dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sbyor bar byed pa gang de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes pa nas ji srid du sangs rgyas dang sbyor bar byed pa gang de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste / de la des gang du de mthong ba med la de bzhin du byang chub med cing des de'i byang chub par bya ba med do //
translated: In that, he does not see any connection between the aggregates and the knowledge of all aspects, and so on up to he does not see any connection between the Buddha and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ltar na 'dis sangs rgyas nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la /üîΩde nyid sangs rgyas dang byang chub nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis sangs rgyas nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la / de nyid sangs rgyas dang byang chub nyid de /
translated: In that, he does not see any connection between the aggregates and the knowledge of all aspects, and so on up to he does not see any connection between the Buddha and the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩIn that, he does not see any connection between the aggregates and the knowledge of all aspects, and so on up to he does not see any connection between the Buddha and the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩIn that, he does not see any connection between the aggregates and the knowledge of all aspects, and so on up to he does not see any connection between the Buddha and the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩIn that, he does not see any connection between the aggregates and the knowledge of all aspects, and so on up to he does not see any connection between the Buddha and the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩIn that, he does not see any connection between the aggregates and the knowledge of all aspects, and so on up to he does not see any connection between the Buddha and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de nyid byang chub nyid ces pas dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs pa po mnyam pa nyid du shes pa ni sangs rgyas so zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la gdams pa'o //üîΩchos kyi ni lam gyi 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de nyid byang chub nyid ces pas dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs pa po mnyam pa nyid du shes pa ni sangs rgyas so zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la gdams pa'o // chos kyi ni lam gyi 'bras bu ste /
translated: In that, he does not see any connection between the aggregates and the knowledge of all aspects, and so on up to he does not see any connection between the Buddha and the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩIn that, he does not see any connection between the aggregates and the knowledge of all aspects, and so on up to he does not see any connection between the Buddha and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: byang chub dang sangs rgyas dkon mchog ces bshad la /
analyzed: byang chub dang sangs rgyas dkon mchog ces bshad la /
translated: In that, he does not see any connection between the aggregates and the knowledge of all aspects, and so on up to he does not see any connection between the Buddha and the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩIn that, he does not see any connection between the aggregates and the knowledge of all aspects, and

original: 'dir chos ni lam gyi bden pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid chos dkon mchog ste /
analyzed: 'dir chos ni lam gyi bden pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid chos dkon mchog ste /
translated: Here, the Dharma is the perfection of wisdom of the yoga of the emptiness of the truth of the path itself, which is the jewel of Dharma.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir de la cung zad kyang ji ltar yang spyod pa med pa la gang du yang cung zad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yang med ces pas rgyas par ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir de la cung zad kyang ji ltar yang spyod pa med pa la gang du yang cung zad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yang med ces pas rgyas par ste /
translated: Since all phenomena are devoid of essence, there is no engagement with them whatsoever, in any way. There is no engagement whatsoever with the perfection of wisdom anywhere.

original: de lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnal 'byor dam pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnal 'byor dam pa ste /
translated: This is the sublime yoga of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor zhes gzhan min par thams cad sbyor zhing zil gyis mnan nas kun tu gnas so zhes pa ni chos dkon mchog la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor zhes gzhan min par thams cad sbyor zhing zil gyis mnan nas kun tu gnas so zhes pa ni chos dkon mchog la gdams pa'o //
translated: It is the yoga of emptiness, nothing else. It is applied everywhere and it prevails. It is present everywhere. This is the instruction on the jewel of Dharma.

original: de la dge 'dun dkon mchog @17b ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs so zhes 'phags pa rnam par grol sdes bshad la de ni gang zag nyi shu ste /
analyzed: de la dge 'dun dkon mchog @17b ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs so zhes 'phags pa rnam par grol sdes bshad la de ni gang zag nyi shu ste /
translated: The jewel of the Sa·πÖgha is the assembly of irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: de dag rnams nyan thos kyi gang zag rnams dang mi 'dra ba ni dge 'dun nyid du yid chas pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de dag rnams nyan thos kyi gang zag rnams dang mi 'dra ba ni dge 'dun nyid du yid chas pa'i don du'o //
translated: This is explained by ƒÄrya Vimuktisena. The meaning of the Sa·πÖgha is that they are not like the individual ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i dbye ba ni de rnams las byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi khyad par brjod pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i dbye ba ni de rnams las byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi khyad par brjod pa'i don te /
translated: The classification of going and coming is for the purpose of expressing the distinction of the bodhisattvas from among them.

original: de ni bar ma ji lta bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni bar ma ji lta bzhin no //
translated: That is like the middle.

original: 'dir bstan bcos kyis rgyun tu zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa ni go sla ba nyid las ma bsdus so //
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos kyis rgyun tu zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa ni go sla ba nyid las ma bsdus so //
translated: Here, the treatise does not include the results of stream enterer, once returner, and nonreturner because they are easy to understand.üîΩThose of dull and sharp faculties,

original: dbang po rtul dang rnon po dag / dad dang mthong thob rigs nas rigs //
analyzed: dbang po rtul dang rnon po dag / dad dang mthong thob rigs nas rigs //
translated: attained through faith and seeing, from family to family.

original: bar chad gcig par skyes nas dang // byed dang byed min 'og min 'gro /'phar gsum srid rtse mthar thug 'gro / gzugs kyi 'dod chags bcom pa dang // mthong chos zhi lus mngon sum byed //
analyzed: bar chad gcig par skyes nas dang // byed dang byed min 'og min 'gro /'phar gsum srid rtse mthar thug 'gro / gzugs kyi 'dod chags bcom pa dang // mthong chos zhi lus mngon sum byed //
translated: One who has destroyed attachment to the form realm, one who pacifies in this life, and one who manifests the body.

original: bse ru dang ni nyi shu'o //
analyzed: bse ru dang ni nyi shu'o //
translated: The rhinoceros and the twenty.

original: zhes te 'chad par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bco lnga la rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa po brgyad pa la rnam pa gnyis la dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ni dbang po rtul po nyid de dad pas de'i lam gyiüîΩrjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes te 'chad par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bco lnga la rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa po brgyad pa la rnam pa gnyis la dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ni dbang po rtul po nyid de dad pas de'i lam gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: As will be explained, one who enters the result of stream entry in the fifteen moments of the path of seeing is of two types: one who follows faith is of duller faculties, because they follow that path through faith.

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni chos mthong ba'i shes rab des de lam gyi rjes su 'brang bas dbang po rnon po de nyid de phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni chos mthong ba'i shes rab des de lam gyi rjes su 'brang bas dbang po rnon po de nyid de phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who follows dharma is of sharper faculties, because they follow that path through the wisdom that sees dharmas and because they do not turn back.

original: de ltar yang yum bar mar /
analyzed: de ltar yang yum bar mar /
translated: Thus it says in the Medium Length Collection:

original: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ni gang zhig mi dag las shi 'phos nas mi rnams su skyes nas de phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpar gnas par 'gyur ba nyid ni dbang po som nyi can du 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ni gang zhig mi dag las shi 'phos nas mi rnams su skyes nas de phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpar gnas par 'gyur ba nyid ni dbang po som nyi can du 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: One who is a follower by faith is one who, after death as a human, is reborn as a human and then becomes a bodhisattva who abides in irreversibility.

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni dga' ldan gyi lha rnams nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes nas de'i dbang po rnams kyang rnon por 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni dga' ldan gyi lha rnams nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes nas de'i dbang po rnams kyang rnon por 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: One who is a follower by faith is one who, after death as a god of Tushita, is reborn here and whose faculties become sharp.

original: skad cig ma bcu drug pa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma bcu drug pa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: The sixteenth moment is a stream enterer.

original: de nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bye brag rnam pa bzhi po spangs shing rtogs pa'i bye brag rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i sbyang dka' ba'i sa la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bye brag rnam pa bzhi po spangs shing rtogs pa'i bye brag rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i sbyang dka' ba'i sa la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The path of meditation of that stream enterer abandons the four specific afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that exist in the desire realm and possesses the four specific realizations.

original: mi'i rigs nas rigs dang lha'i rigs nas rigs so //
analyzed: mi'i rigs nas rigs dang lha'i rigs nas rigs so //
translated: The level of difficult to conquer has two types: from human to human and from god to god.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bye brag rnam pa lnga pa spangs nas rnam pa lngas mngon du gyur pa'i sa pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bye brag rnam pa lnga pa spangs nas rnam pa lngas mngon du gyur pa'i sa pa ste /
translated: Having abandoned the fifth type of the specific afflictions that are active in the desire realm, he is on the level of the five types that are manifest.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la @18a * //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la @18a * //
translated: He is on the path of the once-returner,

original: zhugs pa can gyi dbang po rtul po dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa nyid ni gcig go //
analyzed: zhugs pa can gyi dbang po rtul po dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa nyid ni gcig go //
translated: the dull faculty who attains through faith and through seeing.

original: 'dod pa na kun du spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug spangs shing rnam pa drug gis ring du song ba la lan cig phyir 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na kun du spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug spangs shing rnam pa drug gis ring du song ba la lan cig phyir 'ong ba ste /
translated: Having abandoned six types of the afflictions that are active in the desire realm, he has gone far with the six types that are manifest.

original: 'jig rten 'dir lan cig phyir 'ongs nas gzhan du mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dir lan cig phyir 'ongs nas gzhan du mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is a once-returner because he returns to this world once and then attains nirvana elsewhere.

original: de nyid la skye ba gcig gis lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir 'dir skye ba gcig gis bar chod ces pas na bar chad gcig pa can te /
analyzed: de nyid la skye ba gcig gis lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir 'dir skye ba gcig gis bar chod ces pas na bar chad gcig pa can te /
translated: Since he has one birth remaining in that very realm, he is called ‚Äúone with one interval,‚Äù because one birth remains as an interval.

original: bar chod pa'i mthar sangs rgyas nyid du'o //
analyzed: bar chod pa'i mthar sangs rgyas nyid du'o //
translated: He attains buddhahood at the end of that interval.

original: 'dod pa na kun tu spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bdun pa nas bye brag bdun gyi la /
analyzed: 'dod pa na kun tu spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bdun pa nas bye brag bdun gyi la /
translated: The sevenfold classification of the afflictions of the desire realm is from the sevenfold classification of the afflictions of the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bye brag med pa spangs pa ni mi g-yo ba dang legs pa'i blo gros su ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa can te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bye brag med pa spangs pa ni mi g-yo ba dang legs pa'i blo gros su ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa can te /
translated: One who has abandoned the afflictions of the desire realm without any distinction is a nonreturner who has entered the result in the immovable and excellent intelligence stages.

original: snga ma bzhin du dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa'o //
translated: As before, they are attained by faith and by insight.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bye brag dgu pa spangs pas de chos kyi sprin la phyir mi 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bye brag dgu pa spangs pas de chos kyi sprin la phyir mi 'ong ba ste /
translated: One who has abandoned the ninth stage of the afflictions of the desire realm is a nonreturner in the cloud of dharma stage.

original: de ltar yang theg pa chen po'i chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las bshad pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang theg pa chen po'i chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las bshad pa /
translated: Thus the Compendium of Abhidharma of the MahƒÅyƒÅna explains:üîΩ‚ÄúOn the path of meditation, by abandoning the ninth stage of the afflictions of the desire realm, one becomes a nonreturner.‚Äù

original: bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa na kun tu spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa rnam par spangs pas phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa dang / 'phags pa rnam par grol sdes kyang /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la 'dod pa na kun tu spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa rnam par spangs pas phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa dang / 'phags pa rnam par grol sdes kyang /
translated: ƒÄrya Vimuktisena also says:

original: sems can gyi don gyi nges par 'byung ba'i 'grel par sa bcu pa la ni rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i gnyen por lam chen po'i chen pos rnam par bral ba tsam du bshad ces pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don gyi nges par 'byung ba'i 'grel par sa bcu pa la ni rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i gnyen por lam chen po'i chen pos rnam par bral ba tsam du bshad ces pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the Vrtti on the Bodhisattvabhumi, it is said that on the tenth stage, the antidote to the small of the small discrimination is merely the separation by the great of the great path.

original: ji ltar phyir mi 'ong ba zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar phyir mi 'ong ba zhe na /
translated: How is one a non-returner?

original: ji ltar gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der skyes pa gnyis par mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der skyes pa gnyis par mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is like the fact that wherever one is born, one does not enter a second birth there.

original: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Moreover, it is fivefold:

original: bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba ni tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'dir mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba ni tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'dir mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa ston par byed pa'o //
translated: One who attains nirvana in the intermediate state is one who attains manifest complete buddhahood in the Abode of Brahma up to Akanistha and demonstrates manifest complete buddhahood here and so on.

original: skyes nas mya ngan las 'da' ba na 'og min nas dga' ldan dang de nas 'dzam bu'i gling du 'ongs nas khyim na gnas pa las nges par byung nas de ma thag du byang chub kyi shing drung du skyil mo krung bcas nas gang dang po'i sems bskyed
analyzed: skyes nas mya ngan las 'da' ba na 'og min nas dga' ldan dang de nas 'dzam bu'i gling du 'ongs nas khyim na gnas pa las nges par byung nas de ma thag du byang chub kyi shing drung du skyil mo krung bcas nas gang dang po'i sems bskyed
translated: One who attains nirvana after birth is one who goes to Akani·π£·π≠ha, then to Tu·π£ita, then to Jambudvƒ´pa, and after leaving the household life, attains nirvana immediately, sitting cross-legged at the foot of the Bodhi tree.

original: pa des bskyed pa nyid kyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: pa des bskyed pa nyid kyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: By the first generation of the mind, one attains nirvana with remainder, which has the characteristics that will be explained.

original: mngon par 'dus byas nas mya ngan las 'da' ba @18b ni 'dir sems can gyi don rnams bcom pa nyid du mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus byas nas mya ngan las 'da' ba @18b ni 'dir sems can gyi don rnams bcom pa nyid du mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: One who attains nirvana through application is one who applies oneself to the destruction of the aims of sentient beings.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par mya ngan las 'da' ba ni 'di ni rigs kyi khyad par gyis myur bar 'gyur te 'bad pa chung ngu nyid kyis mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par mya ngan las 'da' ba ni 'di ni rigs kyi khyad par gyis myur bar 'gyur te 'bad pa chung ngu nyid kyis mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: One who attains nirvana without application is one who attains enlightenment with little effort due to the superiority of one's lineage.

original: lnga pa gang du 'pho ba ni de nas 'og min dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: lnga pa gang du 'pho ba ni de nas 'og min dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa ste /
translated: The fifth is the destination of transference, which is the ultimate of Akani·π£·π≠ha and the summit of existence.

original: dang po ni tshangs ris nas 'phar ba dang phyed du 'phar ba dang gnas thams cad las 'pho bas 'og min du 'jug pa ste rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: dang po ni tshangs ris nas 'phar ba dang phyed du 'phar ba dang gnas thams cad las 'pho bas 'og min du 'jug pa ste rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The first is entering Akani·π£·π≠ha, which is threefold: rising from BrahmakƒÅyika, rising halfway, and rising from all abodes.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The ultimate of the summit of existence is twofold:

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mthong ba'i chos la zhi ba mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mthong ba'i chos la zhi ba mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
translated: free from attachment to the form realm and attaining nirvƒÅ·πáa in this life.

original: skye ba rnam pa thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad par mthong ba la sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i chos kyis 'di nyid du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: skye ba rnam pa thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad par mthong ba la sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i chos kyis 'di nyid du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The first is attaining complete enlightenment in this life as unsurpassed perfect buddhahood through the Dharma of generosity, ethics, and so on, without completely interrupting the continuity of seeing.

original: lus kyis mngon sum byed pa ni mya ngan las 'da' ba dang 'dra ba'i chos la lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir na ji ltar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas lus kyis mngon sum du byed na sems de med de lus la brten nas de skye
analyzed: lus kyis mngon sum byed pa ni mya ngan las 'da' ba dang 'dra ba'i chos la lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir na ji ltar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas lus kyis mngon sum du byed na sems de med de lus la brten nas de skye
translated: Just as the body directly perceives the meditative attainment of cessation, so too the mind is generated in dependence on the body, since the mind does not exist in the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: ba ste / gang yang yum bar ma las /
analyzed: ba ste / gang yang yum bar ma las /
translated: The intermediate mother s≈´tra states:üîΩTherefore, one enters meditative attainment in the first absorption and having arisen from that, one enters meditative attainment in cessation.

analyzed: de bas bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs shing de las langs nas 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Having arisen from that, one enters meditative attainment in the second absorption and so on, up to one enters meditative attainment in the base of infinite space.üîΩHaving arisen from that, one enters meditative attainment in the base of infinite consciousness and so on, up to one enters meditative attainment in the base of neither discrimination nor nondiscrimination.üîΩHaving original: de las langs nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug la zhes pa nas ji srid du thabs mkhas pa'i thod rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs pa rnams su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngonüîΩpar rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de las langs nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug la zhes pa nas ji srid du thabs mkhas pa'i thod rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs pa rnams su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngonüîΩpar rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Having arisen from that, one enters meditative attainment in the base of infinite space and so on, up to one enters meditative attainment in the base of nothingness.üîΩHaving arisen from

original: gang zhig phyir mi 'ong ba lnga po rnams kyis khyad par gyi lam du nyon mongs pa'i bye brag bdun cu rtsa gnyis po rnams spangs nas gnyen po'i bye brag bdun cu rtsa gcig po rtogs pa rnams ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa can te
analyzed: gang zhig phyir mi 'ong ba lnga po rnams kyis khyad par gyi lam du nyon mongs pa'i bye brag bdun cu rtsa gnyis po rnams spangs nas gnyen po'i bye brag bdun cu rtsa gcig po rtogs pa rnams ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa can te
translated: Those who are nonreturners who abandon the specific afflictions to be abandoned on the special path and realize the specific antidotes to those afflictions are approachers to the result of an arhat.

original: / dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa sbal pa mchong ba'i tshul gyis dad pa dang mthong ba thob pa'i sgra'i rjes su 'jug pa'i zhugs pa po gsum ni tshig le'ur byas pas so sor bsgrub la /
analyzed: / dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa sbal pa mchong ba'i tshul gyis dad pa dang mthong ba thob pa'i sgra'i rjes su 'jug pa'i zhugs pa po gsum ni tshig le'ur byas pas so sor bsgrub la /
translated: The three approachers who obtain faith and view by the method of a tortoise leaping and who obtain faith and view are established separately in the verse summary.

original: de nyid kho na 'phags pa rnam par grol sde'i snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngag rnams kyis gsungs so //üîΩgang de ni da ltar 'dod @19a * //
analyzed: de nyid kho na 'phags pa rnam par grol sde'i snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngag rnams kyis gsungs so // gang de ni da ltar 'dod @19a * //
translated: This is stated by the former and latter statements of arya Vimuktisena.

original: pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bye brag dgu pa spangs pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bye brag dgu pa spangs pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Those who are nonreturners who abandon the ninth specific affliction of the desire realm are the five types of nonreturners.

original: de nas 'dir srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa'i bye brag brgyad pa spangs pas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de nas 'dir srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa'i bye brag brgyad pa spangs pas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa'o zhes pa ste /
translated: Then, here, one who has abandoned the eighth of the specific afflictions of the summit of existence enters the result of an arhat.

original: dgra bcom pa ni mi slob pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pas na dge 'dun gyi nang du mi 'du'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni mi slob pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pas na dge 'dun gyi nang du mi 'du'o //
translated: An arhat is a perfect buddha who is not a learner, so he is not included in the Sa·πÖgha.

original: so so'i skye bo ni slob pa dang mi slob kyang rung ste /üîΩslob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni slob pa dang mi slob kyang rung ste / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin te /
translated: An ordinary being is neither a learner nor a nonlearner.

original: smon lam btab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam btab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is neither a learner nor a nonlearner because he makes aspirations.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang nyi shu ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang nyi shu ste /
translated: There are twenty pratyekabuddhas.

original: gang du gsungs pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten rnams su song zhing nyan thos rnams sam rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas par gyur nas de'i thabs la mkhas pas /
analyzed: gang du gsungs pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten rnams su song zhing nyan thos rnams sam rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas par gyur nas de'i thabs la mkhas pas /
translated: It is said, ‚Äú≈öƒÅriputra, a bodhisattva who goes to worlds where there are no buddhas and manifests complete buddhahood in the enlightenment of ≈õrƒÅvakas or pratyekabuddhas, through his skill in means,

original: srog chags brgya stong mang po dang srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po yongs su smin par byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba yang yod ces pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags brgya stong mang po dang srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po yongs su smin par byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba yang yod ces pa'o //
translated: There are also those who, having brought to maturity many hundreds of thousands of living beings, many hundred of thousands of niyutas of kotis of living beings, will become perfect buddhas, completely enlightened in supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis kyis rang sangs rgyas dang chos mthun te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis kyis rang sangs rgyas dang chos mthun te /
translated: That is similar to a pratyekabuddha in two ways:

original: gcig pa'i rang nyid kyis dang gzhan rnams la thos pa med par sangs rgyas kyi chos kun du gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dang gzhan du rang sangs rgyas kyi cha byad kyis kyang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa'i rang nyid kyis dang gzhan rnams la thos pa med par sangs rgyas kyi chos kun du gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dang gzhan du rang sangs rgyas kyi cha byad kyis kyang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: by oneself alone, and by manifesting the Dharma of the Buddha without hearing it from others. And also by the form of a pratyekabuddha.

original: gang zag nyi shu po 'di rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba'i phyir bsgrub pa la gdams pa las zhad tsam du bshad de /
analyzed: gang zag nyi shu po 'di rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba'i phyir bsgrub pa la gdams pa las zhad tsam du bshad de /
translated: These twenty persons are explained in the Instruction on Practice as just a fraction of those who arise from the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun nyi shu po la slob pa rnams kyis skye ba med par rab tu 'jug ces pa ni dkon mchog gsum la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun nyi shu po la slob pa rnams kyis skye ba med par rab tu 'jug ces pa ni dkon mchog gsum la gdams pa'o //
translated: Thus, the twenty irreversible bodhisattva sa·πÖghas who engage in non-arising are the instruction on the Three Jewels.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lus dang ngag dang sems rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams la spyod pa na de nye bar dmigs par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lus dang ngag dang sems rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams la spyod pa na de nye bar dmigs par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: When the bodhisattvas practice the six perfections of body, speech, and mind, they do not apprehend them.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa yang med la lus la sogs pas bde ba myong ba yang med de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa yang med la lus la sogs pas bde ba myong ba yang med de /
translated: There are no perfections, and there is no experience of happiness with body, etc.

original: lus la sogs pa rnams ni don dam par na ngo bo nyid kyis med ces pa ni ma zhan pa la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa rnams ni don dam par na ngo bo nyid kyis med ces pa ni ma zhan pa la gdams pa'o //
translated: The body, etc., ultimately do not exist by their own nature. This is the instruction on the non-weak.

original: dus yun ring por sbyangs pas kyang mnyam par bzhag pa'i don ma grub na yongs su ngal ba med de gzugs la sogs pa @19b nas ji srid du bla na med pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la rlom pa med ces pa ni mi
analyzed: dus yun ring por sbyangs pas kyang mnyam par bzhag pa'i don ma grub na yongs su ngal ba med de gzugs la sogs pa @19b nas ji srid du bla na med pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la rlom pa med ces pa ni mi
translated: Even if you have trained for a long time, if you have not accomplished the meaning of meditative equipoise, you will not be completely exhausted. From form up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, there is no conceit.üîΩ

original: ngal ba la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: ngal ba la gdams pa'o //
translated: Even if one has trained for a long time, if one has not accomplished the meaning of meditative equipoise, one should not be completely exhausted. From form and so on up to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment, one should be without conceit. This is the instruction on not being exhausted.

original: des phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba dang de rnams kyis chos bstan pa rnams nyan pa dang dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa la blta ba dang
analyzed: des phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba dang de rnams kyis chos bstan pa rnams nyan pa dang dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa la blta ba dang
translated: By that, one should see the tathagatas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges in each direction, listen to the Dharma they teach, serve the sangha, and see the pure buddha realms.

original: / des bdag nyid dang gzhan thams cad kyis mi shes pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa dang zhes pa nas ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
analyzed: / des bdag nyid dang gzhan thams cad kyis mi shes pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa dang zhes pa nas ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
translated: By that, oneself and all others should practice the perfections without knowing, up to perfecting all the qualities of a buddha.

original: de yang thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir rlom pa med pa'i spyod pa rnams kyis kun nas yang dag par yongs su zin pas so zhes pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: de yang thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir rlom pa med pa'i spyod pa rnams kyis kun nas yang dag par yongs su zin pas so zhes pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa la gdams pa'o //
translated: Moreover, because everything is devoid of essence, they are completely embraced by the practice of non-imagination. This is the instruction on complete embrace.

original: des spyan lnga dang mngon par shes pa drug so sor thob kyang de dang de thams cad kyang kun tu shes pa med cing nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des spyan lnga dang mngon par shes pa drug so sor thob kyang de dang de thams cad kyang kun tu shes pa med cing nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Although they attain the five eyes and six superknowledges individually, they do not cognize them and do not apprehend them.

original: de la sha'i spyan gang gis ni dpag tshad brgya nas ji srid du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzugs mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la sha'i spyan gang gis ni dpag tshad brgya nas ji srid du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzugs mthong ngo //
translated: With the flesh eye, they see forms up to a hundred leagues, up to the trichiliocosm.
