original: des stong pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam skyes nas gnyis su med pa'i rnam par shes pa mngon sum du byed ces bshad de de la rnam pa med pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa de
analyzed: des stong pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam skyes nas gnyis su med pa'i rnam par shes pa mngon sum du byed ces bshad de de la rnam pa med pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa de
translated: In this system, the foundation consciousness is without aspects and consciousnesses of blue and so on have aspects.

original: nyid dpyad de rnam par shes pa gcig la ni rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa zhes pa ni phan tshun 'gal ba de ji ltar 'jug pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid la rnam pa med pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang de'i ngo bos rjes su 'jug pa yang dpyad
analyzed: nyid dpyad de rnam par shes pa gcig la ni rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa zhes pa ni phan tshun 'gal ba de ji ltar 'jug pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid la rnam pa med pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang de'i ngo bos rjes su 'jug pa yang dpyad
translated: In the same way, it should be analyzed whether the consciousness that has aspects and the consciousness that lacks aspects are mutually exclusive.

original: par bya ste /
analyzed: par bya ste /
translated: The consciousness that has aspects and the consciousness that lacks aspects should be analyzed in terms of whether they are the same or different.

original: gcig la gnyis kyi bdag nyid ces pa 'di ni skyes bu nga rgyal can gyi 'khrugs pa'i bshad pa ste /
analyzed: gcig la gnyis kyi bdag nyid ces pa 'di ni skyes bu nga rgyal can gyi 'khrugs pa'i bshad pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúone that has two natures‚Äù is the confused explanation of a conceited person.

original: de brtag pa la dgos pa med do //
analyzed: de brtag pa la dgos pa med do //
translated: There is no need to analyze that.

original: gang 'di'i 'dod pas dben pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i shes pa nam mkha' bzhin du bsgom par byas na bsgom pa'i stobs rdzogs pa na /
analyzed: gang 'di'i 'dod pas dben pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i shes pa nam mkha' bzhin du bsgom par byas na bsgom pa'i stobs rdzogs pa na /
translated: If one meditates on the consciousness that has the aspect of blue and so on, which is devoid of the object, like space, and if the power of meditation is perfected,

original: de ltar rnam pa med de gang yang gzhan du de nyid nam mkha' bzhin du kun son pa nyid kyis khyab pa zhes 'dod pa ni de gnyi ga yang shin tu 'khrul te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa med de gang yang gzhan du de nyid nam mkha' bzhin du kun son pa nyid kyis khyab pa zhes 'dod pa ni de gnyi ga yang shin tu 'khrul te /
translated: Both of these assertions are utterly mistaken.

original: sngon po'i rnam pa shes pa mi 'grub la /
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa shes pa mi 'grub la /
translated: The aspect of blue is not established as consciousness.

original: grub na de'i 'dod pas de nyid don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid la de'i rnam pa bzlog nas bsgoms pas yang dag pa ma yin par 'gyur bas des bskyed pa'i shes pa yang kho na nyid min te /üîΩzad par sa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas kyi skye @26a * //
analyzed: grub na de'i 'dod pas de nyid don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid la de'i rnam pa bzlog nas bsgoms pas yang dag pa ma yin par 'gyur bas des bskyed pa'i shes pa yang kho na nyid min te / zad par sa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas kyi skye @26a * //
translated: If it were established, then by the assertion that it is the ultimate nature, the aspect of that would be averted and meditated on as not real. Therefore the consciousness generated by that is not reality.

original: mched la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mched la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the bases of infinite space and infinite consciousness.

original: gang du so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs rnams la tshad mas 'thad pa'i rnam pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa sgra don gyi rnam pa nye bar bsdus nas bsgoms pas gsal bar 'gyur ba na rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gang du so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs rnams la tshad mas 'thad pa'i rnam pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa sgra don gyi rnam pa nye bar bsdus nas bsgoms pas gsal bar 'gyur ba na rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
translated: When the consciousness of ordinary beings is clarified by meditation that subsumes the aspects of words and meanings, it is nonconceptual.

original: thog ma med pa'i 'khrul pa log pas rnam pa'i 'khor lo mi snang pa'i 'khor lo mi snang nas rnam pa med pa'i shes pa 'ba' zhig gsal ba bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs kyi sku de'i nang na rjes kyis snang ba'o zhes 'dod pa de yang bcom nas
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i 'khrul pa log pas rnam pa'i 'khor lo mi snang pa'i 'khor lo mi snang nas rnam pa med pa'i shes pa 'ba' zhig gsal ba bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs kyi sku de'i nang na rjes kyis snang ba'o zhes 'dod pa de yang bcom nas
translated: The Lord has also refuted the assertion that the appearance of the form body of the Buddha is the appearance of the subsequent consciousness.

original: snang ba med pa la myong ba ni gang du yang ma grub la /
analyzed: snang ba med pa la myong ba ni gang du yang ma grub la /
translated: There is no experience whatsoever of the nonappearance of the form body of the Buddha.

original: de'i rjes kyi sems dag pa 'jig rten pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can ni bdag nyid med pas myong ba po med ces pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes kyi sems dag pa 'jig rten pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can ni bdag nyid med pas myong ba po med ces pa ste /
translated: The subsequent consciousness, which is of the nature of mundane conceptual thought, is devoid of self, and so there is no experiencer.

original: sngar brtsad zin to //
analyzed: sngar brtsad zin to //
translated: This has already been argued above.

original: 'on te yang dag pa'i bden pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen nas 'jig rten pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i sgra don sngon po la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa de yang rnam par dpyad zin to //
analyzed: 'on te yang dag pa'i bden pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen nas 'jig rten pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i sgra don sngon po la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa de yang rnam par dpyad zin to //
translated: Moreover, the object of observation has already been analyzed, since it is the object of the term, such as blue, that is conceptualized in the world in dependence upon the manifest apprehension of the true reality of apprehendeds and apprehenders.

original: de nas rgyud lam na gzugs kyi sku bcom ldan 'das la so sor snang na /
analyzed: de nas rgyud lam na gzugs kyi sku bcom ldan 'das la so sor snang na /
translated: Then, if the form body of the Bhagavat appears individually in the channels,

original: so so'i rnam pa nyid kyi sgra don gyi gzugs kyi sku gnyis su sgra don gyi brtags pa'i ngo bo'i skyed pa so sor rtsa ba'i shes pa'i yongs su sgrub pa'i ngo bo yang 'khrul par 'gyur la /
analyzed: so so'i rnam pa nyid kyi sgra don gyi gzugs kyi sku gnyis su sgra don gyi brtags pa'i ngo bo'i skyed pa so sor rtsa ba'i shes pa'i yongs su sgrub pa'i ngo bo yang 'khrul par 'gyur la /
translated: the individual aspects themselves, the form body of the meaning of the sound, the essence of the imputation of the meaning of the sound, the individual generation, the essence of the complete knowledge of the fundamental consciousness, would also be deluded.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa yang 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa yang 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: And by that, the Tathagata would also be deluded.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la de mi snang na ni bcom ldan 'das kyi smon lam dang gdul bya'i bsod nams kyis gdul bya rnams la longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i so sor snang bas rnam pa med pa'i rtogs pa ji ltar grub ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la de mi snang na ni bcom ldan 'das kyi smon lam dang gdul bya'i bsod nams kyis gdul bya rnams la longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i so sor snang bas rnam pa med pa'i rtogs pa ji ltar grub ste /
translated: Then, if the Bhagavat does not appear to them, how is the realization of the absence of aspects established for the disciples by the appearance of the enjoyment body and emanation body of the Bhagavat to the disciples through the aspirations of the Bhagavat and the merit of the disciples?

original: gang gi ni smon pa gang ni bcom ldan 'das gang ni gdul bya gang gi gang ni sras rung ba'i bsod nams la ji ltar gzugs kyi sku dag so sor snang bas de ltar thams cad du yang gzugs kyi sku gnyis su snang ba'i mtshan nyid can la
analyzed: gang gi ni smon pa gang ni bcom ldan 'das gang ni gdul bya gang gi gang ni sras rung ba'i bsod nams la ji ltar gzugs kyi sku dag so sor snang bas de ltar thams cad du yang gzugs kyi sku gnyis su snang ba'i mtshan nyid can la
translated: What is the aspiration? What is the BhagavƒÅn? What is the disciple? What is the suitable son? How is it that the two form bodies appear everywhere in the form of the two form bodies?üîΩIt would be difficult to avoid contradicting the scriptures that state this.

original: sogs pa gsungs pa'i don med par 'gyur zhes pa'i lung gis 'gal ba yang spang pa dka' la gang yang snang ba med pa'i gsal bar smra ba'i sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyi 'dod pa dang phyis kyi rnams kyi 'khrul pa brjod par byas /
analyzed: sogs pa gsungs pa'i don med par 'gyur zhes pa'i lung gis 'gal ba yang spang pa dka' la gang yang snang ba med pa'i gsal bar smra ba'i sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyi 'dod pa dang phyis kyi rnams kyi 'khrul pa brjod par byas /
translated: The assertion of the earlier masters that appearances are clarity without appearance should be expressed as the error of the later ones.

original: de ni rab tu 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rab tu 'jug par bya ste /
translated: That should be engaged.

original: de nyid ni don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not ultimately existent.

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum @26b sngon po la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa dag tha dad kyang min la med pa yang yin zhes pa'i 'dod pa ni gnyis kyi bdag nyid can yang med pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum @26b sngon po la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa dag tha dad kyang min la med pa yang yin zhes pa'i 'dod pa ni gnyis kyi bdag nyid can yang med pa nyid de /
translated: The assertion that the apprehensions of blue and so on are not different in reflexive awareness but are nonexistent is also the nonexistence of the nature of duality.

original: de nyid mi rtsod pa dang / sun byung ba yang ni grangs can gyi grub mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid mi rtsod pa dang / sun byung ba yang ni grangs can gyi grub mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would not be a dispute, and the one who is refuted would be a SƒÅ·πÉkhya philosopher.

original: gcer bu pas kyang rnam par shes pa de rnam par byung ba dang / rnam par med par 'gyur ba'o zhes phyi rol dang rnam par shes pa dag gang du yang tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa med pas dngos po rnams mtha' gcig pa nyid kyi phyi rol dang nang nyid med par 'dod do //
analyzed: gcer bu pas kyang rnam par shes pa de rnam par byung ba dang / rnam par med par 'gyur ba'o zhes phyi rol dang rnam par shes pa dag gang du yang tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa med pas dngos po rnams mtha' gcig pa nyid kyi phyi rol dang nang nyid med par 'dod do //
translated: The Jaina say that consciousness arises and disappears, and that external objects and consciousness are neither different nor non-different. Therefore, they assert that things are one-sidedly external and internal.

original: tha dad pa'i gsal ba dag las tha mi dad pa'i spyi zhes ni bya ba ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i gsal ba dag las tha mi dad pa'i spyi zhes ni bya ba ste /
translated: They say that a universal is not different from the individual things.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i dngos po kho nas 'gro ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i dngos po kho nas 'gro ba zhes brjod do //
translated: They say that the world is neither different nor non-different.

original: de la gal te dkar po dang nag po dag gis gnyis kyi bdag nyid can nyid na /
analyzed: de la gal te dkar po dang nag po dag gis gnyis kyi bdag nyid can nyid na /
translated: If white and black are the nature of both,

original: de la khra bo dang skya bo dag mthong bar byed pa dag la yang ba lang nyid du nges pa yod pa mngon sum gyis grub pa de yang zhog / ji ltar yang gong bu tsam du nges kyi tha dad pa min te /
analyzed: de la khra bo dang skya bo dag mthong bar byed pa dag la yang ba lang nyid du nges pa yod pa mngon sum gyis grub pa de yang zhog / ji ltar yang gong bu tsam du nges kyi tha dad pa min te /
translated: In response to this, set aside the direct perception that ascertains the cow as a cow in regard to the perception of a cow that is multicolored or gray.üîΩJust as it is ascertained as a mere mass, it is not different.

original: gsal ba nyid dang / sngon po tsam dang / bde ba tsam du gsal ba ni tha dad pa min pas de dag gcig tu gsal ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba nyid dang / sngon po tsam dang / bde ba tsam du gsal ba ni tha dad pa min pas de dag gcig tu gsal ba'o //
translated: Since the clarity itself, the mere blue, and the mere pleasure are not different, they are clearly one.

original: gal te rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis dkar po dang nag po dag tha mi dad par rtogs kyang ma rig pa'i dbang gis tha dad par dmigs pa des na gnyis su med par yid mi ches na /
analyzed: gal te rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis dkar po dang nag po dag tha mi dad par rtogs kyang ma rig pa'i dbang gis tha dad par dmigs pa des na gnyis su med par yid mi ches na /
translated: If one does not believe in nonduality because of the power of ignorance, even though one realizes that white and black are not different through the direct perception of reflexive awareness,

original: de ltar na ni khra bo dang / mang po dag gi ba lang nyid la yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ni khra bo dang / mang po dag gi ba lang nyid la yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be the same in regard to the cow that is multicolored or a herd of cows.

original: ci ma rig pa'i dbang gis gnyis su med par des ma myong ste /
analyzed: ci ma rig pa'i dbang gis gnyis su med par des ma myong ste /
translated: If it is not experienced as nondual due to the power of ignorance,

original: 'dir med pa nyid kyis zhes pa ni gnyi ga la yang the tshom du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir med pa nyid kyis zhes pa ni gnyi ga la yang the tshom du 'gyur la /
translated: then in this context, ‚Äúdue to the nonexistence of that‚Äù would be a doubt in both cases.

original: gal te sngon po dang bde ba mthong ba kho na gnyis su med par des mthong ba na /
analyzed: gal te sngon po dang bde ba mthong ba kho na gnyis su med par des mthong ba na /
translated: If the mere seeing of blue and the mere seeing of pleasure are the nondual seeing,

original: de lta na ni gong bur gang zhig mthong ba nyid spyi la sogs par mthong ba'o zhes nus pa'o //üîΩgal te yang gsal ba de nyid bde ba'i ngo bo dang / sngon po'i ngo bo ni de'i sngon po 'di nyid bde bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de lta na ni gong bur gang zhig mthong ba nyid spyi la sogs par mthong ba'o zhes nus pa'o // gal te yang gsal ba de nyid bde ba'i ngo bo dang / sngon po'i ngo bo ni de'i sngon po 'di nyid bde bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: then it is possible to say that whatever sees a collection sees a universal and so on.üîΩIf the very manifestation of pleasure and the manifestation of blue were the same,

original: bde ba sngon po nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: bde ba sngon po nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: then blue would be pleasure or pleasure would be blue.

original: de ltar yang min te /
analyzed: de ltar yang min te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: bde ba dang sngon po dag ni rnam par chad pa'i yul nyid pas sbyor ba med par nyams su myong bas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang sngon po dag ni rnam par chad pa'i yul nyid pas sbyor ba med par nyams su myong bas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because pleasure and blue are experienced as separate objects, their connection is not established.

original: 'on te sngon po dang bde ba dag kyang tha mi dad pa yang ma yin pas rang rig pa'o zhes te /
analyzed: 'on te sngon po dang bde ba dag kyang tha mi dad pa yang ma yin pas rang rig pa'o zhes te /
translated: But if blue and pleasure are not the same, then they are self-aware.

original: gang sngon po de nyid bde ba zhes @27a * //
analyzed: gang sngon po de nyid bde ba zhes @27a * //
translated: If blue is pleasure and pleasure is blue,

original: pa dang / bde ba yang gzhan la sngon po yang gzhan zhes pa ni phan tshun 'gal te /
analyzed: pa dang / bde ba yang gzhan la sngon po yang gzhan zhes pa ni phan tshun 'gal te /
translated: then it is contradictory to say that pleasure is one thing and blue is another.

original: des gang las tha dad pa'i go skabs nyid kyi mtshams su rtogs par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des gang las tha dad pa'i go skabs nyid kyi mtshams su rtogs par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cognition that occurs at the boundary of the space that is different from that.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi thul gang zhig ni gsal ba gcig pu'i ngo bo yod de /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi thul gang zhig ni gsal ba gcig pu'i ngo bo yod de /
translated: The one who is skilled in mere cognition has the nature of a single clarity.

original: mi gsal ba med pa'i phyir 'di nyid tha mi dad par gnas la /
analyzed: mi gsal ba med pa'i phyir 'di nyid tha mi dad par gnas la /
translated: Because there is no lack of clarity, he abides without difference.

original: phyi rol dag pa ni de kho na nyid du mi gsal ba nyid kyis de ni mi dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i med pa ni med pas /
analyzed: phyi rol dag pa ni de kho na nyid du mi gsal ba nyid kyis de ni mi dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i med pa ni med pas /
translated: External clarity is not clarity in reality. Since there is no nonexistence other than nonapprehension,

original: de'i phyir gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa'i zhad tsam yang rtogs pa med pa nyid la gang las tha dad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa'i zhad tsam yang rtogs pa med pa nyid la gang las tha dad de /
translated: therefore, there is no difference from the mere desire for something else.üîΩThere is no cognition of the past, etc., because it does not exist.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa la ni rig pa med de med pa'i phyir dang / de ltar snga ma dang phyi ma nyid la gsal ba med la /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa la ni rig pa med de med pa'i phyir dang / de ltar snga ma dang phyi ma nyid la gsal ba med la /
translated: Thus, there is no clarity in the past and future.

original: gsal bar bya ba yang snga ma dang phyi ma nyid du mi sbyor ba'i phyir re de brjod pa ni 'khrul dang ma 'khrul brtags dang ma brtags pa //
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba yang snga ma dang phyi ma nyid du mi sbyor ba'i phyir re de brjod pa ni 'khrul dang ma 'khrul brtags dang ma brtags pa //
translated: Since the object of clarity is not connected to the past and future, therefore, the statement ‚Äúthe past and future are imagined to be confused and unconfused‚Äù is not tenable.

original: dkar po nag po la sogs dpang skyes ma lus rnams //
analyzed: dkar po nag po la sogs dpang skyes ma lus rnams //
translated: All the witnesses, white, black, and so on,

original: shes las gzhan du tha mi dad par lhan cig dmigs //
analyzed: shes las gzhan du tha mi dad par lhan cig dmigs //
translated: are not different from consciousness, and are perceived together with it.

original: sngon dang phyi ma nyid la rig pa med pa nyid ces bya //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma nyid la rig pa med pa nyid ces bya //
translated: This is called ‚Äúthe nonexistence of the prior and subsequent parts.‚Äù

original: zhe na / ci grub pa'i mtha' g-yang sa ni ltung bar byed pa rtsom pa 'dis ni gzhan gyi rgyud med par byed par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: zhe na / ci grub pa'i mtha' g-yang sa ni ltung bar byed pa rtsom pa 'dis ni gzhan gyi rgyud med par byed par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: But this is a thesis that leads to an abyss, for it leads to the nonexistence of other continua.

original: rgyud gzhan srid pa na ni nges par rang gi sems de las tha dad pa ca la tha mi dad pa ni rang gi rgyud las gzhan gyi rgyud du 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan srid pa na ni nges par rang gi sems de las tha dad pa ca la tha mi dad pa ni rang gi rgyud las gzhan gyi rgyud du 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If other continua are possible, then the mind of one person is certainly different from the mind of another. It is not the case that one‚Äôs own continuum is the other continuum.

original: de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
translated: This is not the case, because we do not accept this.

original: gang du brjod pa /
analyzed: gang du brjod pa /
translated: As it was said :üîΩ‚ÄúDirect perception and inference are mere consciousness.

original: mngon sum rnag rig pa tsam dang // gang du kun tu gnas gyur pas /
analyzed: mngon sum rnag rig pa tsam dang // gang du kun tu gnas gyur pas /
translated: Because they exist in the world,

original: 'dod pas dag yod ces brjod pa //
analyzed: 'dod pas dag yod ces brjod pa //
translated: we say that they exist.

original: 'di la kho bos mtshar du brtsis //üîΩzhes bya ba na /
analyzed: 'di la kho bos mtshar du brtsis //üîΩzhes bya ba na /
translated: This is what we find amazing.‚Äù

original: tshul chen po'i de kho na nyid las phyin ci log pa'i sangs rgyas pas rig byed kyi grub mtha' khas blangs pa ste /
analyzed: tshul chen po'i de kho na nyid las phyin ci log pa'i sangs rgyas pas rig byed kyi grub mtha' khas blangs pa ste /
translated: The VedƒÅntins accept a tenet that is the opposite of the reality of the Great System.

original: sna tshogs tshangs par smra ba rnams kyi ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i skyon gyis ma gos pa'i bdag gi ngo bor yongs su gsal ba'i chu dang / med la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i rgyun chad pa med pa'i rtag pa'i rang rig pa tsam gyi gnyis su med pa ni tshangs shes pa ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs tshangs par smra ba rnams kyi ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i skyon gyis ma gos pa'i bdag gi ngo bor yongs su gsal ba'i chu dang / med la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i rgyun chad pa med pa'i rtag pa'i rang rig pa tsam gyi gnyis su med pa ni tshangs shes pa ste /
translated: The various Upani·π£ads say that the self is the essence that is not sullied by the faults of percepts and perceivers. It is the clear water that is the uninterrupted continuum of the aspect of nonexistence. It is the mere self-awareness that is permanent. It is nondual. That is the knowledge of BrahmƒÅ.

original: don dam pa'o zhes pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'o zhes pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The tenet is that it is the ultimate.

original: gang du sems kyi 'khor lo med pa'i gcig med pa'o //
analyzed: gang du sems kyi 'khor lo med pa'i gcig med pa'o //
translated: It is the one in which the wheel of mind does not exist.

original: bdag nyid @27b 'dis ni nam mkha' khyab bdag de lta na 'ang //
analyzed: bdag nyid @27b 'dis ni nam mkha' khyab bdag de lta na 'ang //
translated: By this self, the all-pervading lord,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de ltar thugs kyis gsal ba yi //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de ltar thugs kyis gsal ba yi //
translated: the TathƒÅgata, in that way, with his mind,

original: bsgrub par byas pa de ni shin tu de nyid min /
analyzed: bsgrub par byas pa de ni shin tu de nyid min /
translated: makes that which is to be accomplished very real.

original: zhe na / de nyid ni cung zad min cing de yang nges par dam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhe na / de nyid ni cung zad min cing de yang nges par dam pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThat is not real in the least, and that is also definitely not the highest,‚Äù

original: ma rig pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa la nam mkha' bzhin gyi yul dang dus la khyab pa po nyid kyi de kho na nyid so sor snang ba khyod kyi ltar na /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa la nam mkha' bzhin gyi yul dang dus la khyab pa po nyid kyi de kho na nyid so sor snang ba khyod kyi ltar na /
translated: According to you, the reality that pervades space and time appears to the consciousness of one who is ignorant.

original: ma rig pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi gsal ba de yang de kho na nyid min pa min /
analyzed: ma rig pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi gsal ba de yang de kho na nyid min pa min /
translated: But the clarity of the mind of the TathƒÅgata, who is not ignorant, is not reality.

original: sna thogs gsal ba tsan gyis gnyis su med pa zhes pa'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid la /
analyzed: sna thogs gsal ba tsan gyis gnyis su med pa zhes pa'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid la /
translated: The definition of reality, which is nondual, is simply clarity.

original: cung zhig de kho na nyid min zhes 'dir bcom ldan 'das 'khrul pa nyid ces smad pa brjod pa'i phyin ci log gi lam 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: cung zhig de kho na nyid min zhes 'dir bcom ldan 'das 'khrul pa nyid ces smad pa brjod pa'i phyin ci log gi lam 'dzin pa ste /
translated: But you say that it is not reality. Here you are holding a mistaken path, which is a deprecation, saying that the BhagavƒÅn is mistaken.

original: de'i phyir na 'dir khyad par med pa'i sna tshogs pa dang 'dir ni gnyis med dang gsal ba'i sgra don gyi rnam pa dang bcas pas gnyis su gsal zhes pa'i gsum go khyad par med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'dir khyad par med pa'i sna tshogs pa dang 'dir ni gnyis med dang gsal ba'i sgra don gyi rnam pa dang bcas pas gnyis su gsal zhes pa'i gsum go khyad par med do //
translated: Therefore, here there is no difference between the words ‚Äúvariety‚Äù and ‚Äúnondual‚Äù and ‚Äúclarity.‚Äù The three words ‚Äúvariety,‚Äù ‚Äúnondual,‚Äù and ‚Äúclarity‚Äù have the same meaning.

original: tha ma'i 'dod pa yang ni snga ma bzhin du mi dmigs pas rgyud gzhan med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha ma'i 'dod pa yang ni snga ma bzhin du mi dmigs pas rgyud gzhan med par 'gyur te /
translated: The latter assertion is also untenable, because, as before, the other mindstream is not observed.

original: rnam pa med pa'i shes pa ni rang gsal ba tsam mo //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i shes pa ni rang gsal ba tsam mo //
translated: A cognition without aspects is simply self-illuminating.

original: gnyis su med pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma myong ba med pa'i ngo bo'i rnam pa med par smra ba'i sangs rgyas pas gzhan gyi rgyud med ces pa khas mi len cing bdag nyid med pa'i sgra don gyi sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma myong ba med pa'i ngo bo'i rnam pa med par smra ba'i sangs rgyas pas gzhan gyi rgyud med ces pa khas mi len cing bdag nyid med pa'i sgra don gyi sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du /
translated: The Buddhist Proponents of the Absence of an Object say that the former and latter moments of cognition are not different, and that the nature of cognition is not experienced with aspects. They say that there is no other mindstream. They do not accept that there is no other mindstream. They say that, like the object of a cognition of blue, the other mindstream does not exist.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud kyi gsal ba med pas med ces nyid ni snang ba med pa'i tshang pa dang khyad par med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud kyi gsal ba med pas med ces nyid ni snang ba med pa'i tshang pa dang khyad par med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: They say that, because there is no clarity of another mindstream, there is no other mindstream. They are not different from the Proponents of No Appearance.üîΩThe ultimate is the nondual clarity of the mere appearance of the object that radiates out to the conceptual mind.

original: rnam par 'phro ba'i yul gyi rnam par ni rtog pa'i bdag nyid la gsal ba tsam po'i tshangs pa gnyis su med pa ni don dam pa ste /üîΩtshu rol byi gnas skabs su ni ma tig pas kun du bsgribs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'phro ba'i yul gyi rnam par ni rtog pa'i bdag nyid la gsal ba tsam po'i tshangs pa gnyis su med pa ni don dam pa ste /üîΩtshu rol byi gnas skabs su ni ma tig pas kun du bsgribs pa ste /
translated: The ultimate is obscured by the temporary obscurations.

original: de la rtag pa dang khyab bdag nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par la goms pas ma lus pa'i ma rig pa zad nas de'i khyad par las byung ba 'dir gsal bar 'gyur zhes pa ni rig byed kyi grub pa'i mtha' ste /üîΩgzhan gyi rgyud mi srid na thugs rje chen po sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i tshogs la sogs pa med pas gang du bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsgrub par bya bas skyes bu'i don mchog tu 'gyur /
analyzed: de la rtag pa dang khyab bdag nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par la goms pas ma lus pa'i ma rig pa zad nas de'i khyad par las byung ba 'dir gsal bar 'gyur zhes pa ni rig byed kyi grub pa'i mtha' ste / gzhan gyi rgyud mi srid na thugs rje chen po sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i tshogs la sogs pa med pas gang du bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsgrub par bya bas skyes bu'i don mchog tu 'gyur /
translated: The VedƒÅnta tenet is that by cultivating the distinctions of being permanent, the all-pervading self, and so on, all ignorance is exhausted and the distinctions that arise from that are clearly manifest.

original: ji ltar @28a * //
analyzed: ji ltar @28a * //
translated: If the other continuum is impossible, then great compassion, the accumulation of virtue such as generosity, and so on do not exist. Therefore, how could the supreme purpose of a person be accomplished by accumulating the collections of merit and wisdom?üîΩHow could the TathƒÅgatas, who possess immeasurable knowledge of the minds of others, and so on, be criticized? Therefore, just as you apprehend them as different, give up apprehending them as nondifferent.

original: na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dpag tu med pa'i gzhan gyi sems shes pa la sogs pa can la yang smod par 'gyur bas de'i phyir tha dad par 'dzin pa bzhin tha mi dad par 'dzin pa yang thong shig / de 'di ltar /
analyzed: na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dpag tu med pa'i gzhan gyi sems shes pa la sogs pa can la yang smod par 'gyur bas de'i phyir tha dad par 'dzin pa bzhin tha mi dad par 'dzin pa yang thong shig / de 'di ltar /
translated: In this way:

original: gang las tha dad mthong ba dang // ma 'dres tha mi dad par shes //
analyzed: gang las tha dad mthong ba dang // ma 'dres tha mi dad par shes //
translated: What is seen as different is known to be undifferentiated and nondifferent.

original: tha dad tha mi dad dag las //
analyzed: tha dad tha mi dad dag las //
translated: Apart from the different and the non-different,

original: gzhan pa'i dngos dang dngos 'dzin med //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i dngos dang dngos 'dzin med //
translated: there is no entity or apprehension of an entity.

original: ces te / gang du yang med do //
analyzed: ces te / gang du yang med do //
translated: There is no entity whatsoever.

original: don dam par ni dngos po gzung ba dang 'dzin pa tha dad pa'am tha mi dad rnams med de ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir na chos rnams thams cad kyi gnyi ga med pa'o //üîΩde nyid spros pa des rig pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbden pa nyid la ni gzung ba la sogs pa dang gzhan pa'i bye brag gi bden pa dang mi bden pa la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral zhing med pas de la mi srid do //
analyzed: don dam par ni dngos po gzung ba dang 'dzin pa tha dad pa'am tha mi dad rnams med de ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir na chos rnams thams cad kyi gnyi ga med pa'o // de nyid spros pa des rig pa'i phyir ro // bden pa nyid la ni gzung ba la sogs pa dang gzhan pa'i bye brag gi bden pa dang mi bden pa la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral zhing med pas de la mi srid do //
translated: In the ultimate sense, there is no entity, whether different or non-different, as subject and object, because of the absence of intrinsic reality. Therefore, all things are devoid of both.üîΩBecause of the absence of the elaboration of the duality, the ultimate is not an object of the elaboration of the duality.üîΩIn the ultimate sense, there is no elaboration of the duality, such as subject and object, or of the distinction between the real and the unreal, because of the absence of intrinsic reality. Therefore, it is not possible for the ultimate to be an object of the elaboration of the duality.

original: de nyid kyis na rang dang gzhan gsal ba'i ldog pa'i ma brtags na nyams dga' bas myong ba'i bdag nyid kyi bye brag gzhan gsal ba ni rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rang dang gzhan gsal ba'i ldog pa'i ma brtags na nyams dga' bas myong ba'i bdag nyid kyi bye brag gzhan gsal ba ni rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is quite reasonable that the ultimate is not an object of the elaboration of the distinction between the real and the unreal, because it is not an object of the elaboration of the distinction between the real and the unreal.

original: bems po las ldog pa tsam gyis kun rdzob tu rang gi rig pa'i ngo bor yang tha snyad byed de kun rdzob tu yang rnam par chad pa'i sngon po la sogs pa can gyi phyi rol nyid kyi dngos por ma brtags na nyams dga' ba de ni rnam
analyzed: bems po las ldog pa tsam gyis kun rdzob tu rang gi rig pa'i ngo bor yang tha snyad byed de kun rdzob tu yang rnam par chad pa'i sngon po la sogs pa can gyi phyi rol nyid kyi dngos por ma brtags na nyams dga' ba de ni rnam
translated: The mere opposite of matter is also conventionally called the essence of reflexive awareness.

original: par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa des nges par 'gyur la /
analyzed: par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa des nges par 'gyur la /
translated: The object of nonconceptual consciousness is the mere appearance of blue, etc., which is not imagined to be an external thing that is separate in the relative.

original: rnam par rtog pas ni bden ba la sogs pa nyid du sgro 'dogs /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas ni bden ba la sogs pa nyid du sgro 'dogs /
translated: Conceptual consciousness superimposes true existence, etc.,

original: sgro btags nas yang tha snyad rab tu 'jug pa po'i byed pa ste /
analyzed: sgro btags nas yang tha snyad rab tu 'jug pa po'i byed pa ste /
translated: and having superimposed, it engages in the use of terms.üîΩThe object of expression that is connected with the expression is not ascertained by nonconceptual consciousness.

original: rjod byed dang ldan pa'i rjod byed sbyor ba'i sbyor bya'i don gsal bar ma nges pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par 'jog la /
analyzed: rjod byed dang ldan pa'i rjod byed sbyor ba'i sbyor bya'i don gsal bar ma nges pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par 'jog la /
translated: The object of conceptual consciousness is ascertained by conceptual consciousness.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid la dmigs pa dang mngon par rlom pa la sogs pa ni rnam grangs te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid la dmigs pa dang mngon par rlom pa la sogs pa ni rnam grangs te /
translated: Conceptual consciousness is also called observation, imagination, etc.

original: de nyid kyis kho na nyid min par sgro btags nas phyin ci log pas de kho na nyid dang de kho na nyid min pa gtan la ma phebs nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyis kho na nyid min par sgro btags nas phyin ci log pas de kho na nyid dang de kho na nyid min pa gtan la ma phebs nas /
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the establishment of reality and unreality is not due to error, which superimposes upon thatness what is not thatness.

original: the tshom dang de kho na nyid mtha' gcig pa'i yul gyi phyir nges pa zhes pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom dang de kho na nyid mtha' gcig pa'i yul gyi phyir nges pa zhes pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Hence, one should understand that the establishment of doubt and certainty, etc., is due to the domain of thatness and the domain of what is not thatness.

original: de nyid la kun rdzob tu phyi rol gyi dngos pos gnas pa 'di thams cad dang gzhan gyi sems yod pa nyid ni kha na ma thob med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la kun rdzob tu phyi rol gyi dngos pos gnas pa 'di thams cad dang gzhan gyi sems yod pa nyid ni kha na ma thob med pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the existence of external things and the existence of the mind of another are unobjectionable conventionally, because of the power of the conventional predisposition that has been cultivated since beginningless time.

original: thog ma med pa'i srid pa nas goms pa'i tha snyad kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis na @28b byas pa dang bud med la sogs pa dang / yang 'jig rten pas skyes bu la sogs pa can du mngon sum nyid kyi sems pa dang sems pa med pa dang bden pa dang mi bden pa la sogs pa nyid du yongs su gcod cing /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i srid pa nas goms pa'i tha snyad kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis na @28b byas pa dang bud med la sogs pa dang / yang 'jig rten pas skyes bu la sogs pa can du mngon sum nyid kyi sems pa dang sems pa med pa dang bden pa dang mi bden pa la sogs pa nyid du yongs su gcod cing /
translated: The world determines that things such as a vase, cloth, man, woman, etc., are real, and that things such as a double moon, a reflected image, an echo, etc., are unreal.

original: myur du 'khyud pa dang brdeg pa la sogs pa'i don la nye bar 'jug la /
analyzed: myur du 'khyud pa dang brdeg pa la sogs pa'i don la nye bar 'jug la /
translated: It engages the meaning of quickly embracing, striking and so on.

original: thos pa la sogs pas the tshom mi skye ba nyid du gzhan gyi sems rjes su dpag ste /
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pas the tshom mi skye ba nyid du gzhan gyi sems rjes su dpag ste /
translated: It infers the mind of another through hearing and so on, since doubt does not arise.üîΩThus it teaches the activity of verbal expression immediately after the mind of desire. When that mind of desire exists, it teaches expression, but when it does not exist, it does not teach.üîΩSince it is concomitant with the mind of desire, it infers the mind of desire through the expression of words and so on.üîΩIt infers the mind of desire that is the cause of expression through seeing the expression of words and so on that are the effect of the mind of desire.üîΩIt infers the mind of desire that is the cause of expression through seeing the expression of words and so on that are the effect of the mind of desire.

original: de ltar yang 'dod pa'i sems kyi de ma thag tu tshig gi brjod pa'i bya ba ston la de med pa na mi ston pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid can du 'dod pa'i sems dang lhan cig pas tshig tu brjod pa la sogs pas
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dod pa'i sems kyi de ma thag tu tshig gi brjod pa'i bya ba ston la de med pa na mi ston pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid can du 'dod pa'i sems dang lhan cig pas tshig tu brjod pa la sogs pas
translated: It infers the mind of desire that is the cause of expression through seeing the expression of words and so on that are the effect of the mind of desire.üîΩIt infers the mind of desire that is the cause of expression through seeing the expression of words and so on that are the effect of the mind of desire.üîΩIt infers the mind of desire that is the cause of expression through seeing the expression of words and so on that are the effect of the mind of desire.üîΩIt infers the mind of desire that is the cause of expression through seeing the expression of words and so on that are the effect of the mind of desire.üîΩIt infers the mind of desire that is the cause of expression through seeing the expression of words and so on that are the effect of the mind of desire.üîΩIt infers the mind of desire that is the cause of expression through seeing the expression of words and so on that are the effect of the mind of desire.üîΩIt infers the mind of desire that is the cause of expression through seeing the expression of words and so on that are the effect of the mind of desire.üîΩIt infers the mind of desire that is the cause of expression through seeing the expression of words and so on that are the effect of the mind of desire.üîΩIt infers the mind of desire that is the cause of expression through seeing the expression of words and so on that are the effect of the mind of desire.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis de'i 'dod pa'i sems kyis myong ba'i dus su rnam par chad pa'i tshig gis brjod pa la sogs pa mthong nas de'i rgyur gyur pa'i 'dod pa'i rjes su dpog par byed pas /üîΩrgyud gzhan la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis de'i 'dod pa'i sems kyis myong ba'i dus su rnam par chad pa'i tshig gis brjod pa la sogs pa mthong nas de'i rgyur gyur pa'i 'dod pa'i rjes su dpog par byed pas /üîΩrgyud gzhan la gnas pa ste /
translated: It infers the mind of desire that is the cause of expression through seeing the expression of words and so on that are the effect of the mind of desire.üîΩIt infers the mind of desire that is the cause of expression through seeing the

original: tshad ma dang gzhal bya'i dngos po thams cad ni kun rdzob pas na yang dag pa'i kun rdzob la brten pa nyid du bya ste /
analyzed: tshad ma dang gzhal bya'i dngos po thams cad ni kun rdzob pas na yang dag pa'i kun rdzob la brten pa nyid du bya ste /
translated: Since all things that are valid cognitions and their objects are conventional, they are to be taken as based on the correct conventional.

original: gzhan du na ni thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, everything would be established.üîΩThus, like dreams and so on, the object of a conventional valid cognition is not ultimate, but is merely whatever is obtained in accordance with one‚Äôs wishes.

original: de ltar yang rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du ji ltar 'dod pa'i don kun tu thob pa tsam gyi don dam par ni ma yin pa can gyi dngos po'i yul nyid ni tha snyad pa'i tshad mar rnam par gzhag pa las gzhan du ni min no //
analyzed: de ltar yang rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du ji ltar 'dod pa'i don kun tu thob pa tsam gyi don dam par ni ma yin pa can gyi dngos po'i yul nyid ni tha snyad pa'i tshad mar rnam par gzhag pa las gzhan du ni min no //
translated: It is not anything else.

original: de ltar yang gshad pa /üîΩ'di ltar kun du tha snyad ni /
analyzed: de ltar yang gshad pa / 'di ltar kun du tha snyad ni /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: tshad ma yi ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: tshad ma yi ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: Thus, the definition of a conventional valid cognitionüîΩIs that it is a cognition that is nondeceptive with regard to what is to be adopted or to be discarded.

original: zhes so // 'dir kun rdzob tu yang ji srid du bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed du gnas pa de srid du tshul gsum pa'i rtags nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba yod pa'am /
analyzed: zhes so // 'dir kun rdzob tu yang ji srid du bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed du gnas pa de srid du tshul gsum pa'i rtags nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba yod pa'am /
translated: Here, as long as there is a probandum and a means of affirmation, then, by means of a reason that has the three criteria, the probandum is established.

original: dgag pa 'grub ste phyogs chos dang 'brel pas tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis kyang mngon sum gyi rtags 'dzin par byed na kun rdzob pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa gzung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dgag pa 'grub ste phyogs chos dang 'brel pas tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis kyang mngon sum gyi rtags 'dzin par byed na kun rdzob pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa gzung bar 'gyur la /
translated: The refutation is established, because those who see only the near side apprehend the sign of direct perception by the relation of property to be proven, and they apprehend the lack of reality of the superficial.

original: tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis dngos po'i ngo bo la goms pa'i mngon sum du ni mi myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis dngos po'i ngo bo la goms pa'i mngon sum du ni mi myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those who see only the near side do not experience the reality of things by direct perception, which is familiar with it.

original: 'o na 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pas sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin la gnod pa'i phyir ji ltar na de rnams la mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pas sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin la gnod pa'i phyir ji ltar na de rnams la mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhe na /
translated: Well, since the inference to be explained later contradicts the intrinsic reality of blue, etc., how can they be direct perception?

original: kun rdzob pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo rnams la des mi gnod de /üîΩcung zhig bsgrub bya kho na la de ltar sgro btags pa'am bden @29a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo rnams la des mi gnod de / cung zhig bsgrub bya kho na la de ltar sgro btags pa'am bden @29a * //
translated: It does not contradict the reality of superficial things,

original: pa'i rnam pa kho na bzlog bya'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i rnam pa kho na bzlog bya'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is merely the superimposition of the probandum, or merely the negation of the aspect of reality.

original: tha snyad pa'i mngon sum gyi spyod yul gyi don ni rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin kun rdzob tu nges par byed pa la /
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i mngon sum gyi spyod yul gyi don ni rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin kun rdzob tu nges par byed pa la /
translated: The meaning that is the domain of conventional direct perception is ascertained as conventional, like dreams and so on.

original: byis pa rnams kyis don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa sgro 'dogs pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa sgro 'dogs pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The superimposition of the ultimate nature and so on by childish beings is undermined by inference.

original: mthong ba la sogs pa'i don gyi tha snyad la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa'i don gyi tha snyad la ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the conventional meaning of seeing and so on is undermined.

original: gang ma 'khrul pa de ni mngon sum de la rjes su dpag pas mi gnod la gnod pa ni bden par sgro btags pa nyid la sogs pa la ste /
analyzed: gang ma 'khrul pa de ni mngon sum de la rjes su dpag pas mi gnod la gnod pa ni bden par sgro btags pa nyid la sogs pa la ste /
translated: That which is non mistaken is direct perception. It is not undermined by inference. Undermining is in relation to the superimposition of true existence and so on.

original: de la ma 'khrul pa de med ces pas na mngon sum la skur pa 'debs par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ma 'khrul pa de med ces pas na mngon sum la skur pa 'debs par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since non delusion does not exist in that, it follows that direct perception is not denigrated.

original: de yang chos thams cad bdag med par sgrub pa ni gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las skyes pa de don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad bdag med par sgrub pa ni gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las skyes pa de don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: Moreover, the proof that all phenomena are without a self is that whatever is produced from dependent arising is ultimately empty of intrinsic existence.

original: dper na sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like an illusion.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las skyes pa'i rtsod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i dngos po rnams kyang ngo zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las skyes pa'i rtsod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i dngos po rnams kyang ngo zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs te /
translated: This is a reason based on nature.

original: de yang ba lang rdzi la sogs pa rnams la grags pas chos can ma grub pa med la /
analyzed: de yang ba lang rdzi la sogs pa rnams la grags pas chos can ma grub pa med la /
translated: Since this is accepted by even cowherds, there is no issue of the subject not being established.

original: dmigs par rung ba ma dmigs pa las /
analyzed: dmigs par rung ba ma dmigs pa las /
translated: The nonobservation of something suitable to appearüîΩestablishes the nonexistence of that thing.

original: gang gang du de bden par dmigs pa de de'i 'bras bu zhes rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas sam /
analyzed: gang gang du de bden par dmigs pa de de'i 'bras bu zhes rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas sam /
translated: In this way, the existence of things is established by the principle of the forward mode of entailment, ‚ÄúWhatever is observed as real is the effect of that.‚ÄùüîΩOr, the existence of things is established by the principle of the reverse mode of entailment, ‚ÄúWhatever is a cause that has the power to produce something else is the cause of that which does not arise without it.‚Äù

original: gzhan rnams yod pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'i rgyu rnams gang med na gang mi 'byung bas de de'i 'bras bu'o zhes ldog pa'i sgo nas kun rdzob pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa ni kun rdzob pa'i de nyid 'thad la /
analyzed: gzhan rnams yod pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'i rgyu rnams gang med na gang mi 'byung bas de de'i 'bras bu'o zhes ldog pa'i sgo nas kun rdzob pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa ni kun rdzob pa'i de nyid 'thad la /
translated: The existence of things as causes and effects is established in terms of the relative.

original: snga nas yod pa'i chos la byed pa po nyid dang / bya ba dag gi byed pa po gcig pa nyid ni brtags te /
analyzed: snga nas yod pa'i chos la byed pa po nyid dang / bya ba dag gi byed pa po gcig pa nyid ni brtags te /
translated: The existence of a single agent and action in a phenomenon that exists from before is imagined.

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i rten cing 'brel pa las skye bar 'gyur ba la ni chos zhes brjod de /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i rten cing 'brel pa las skye bar 'gyur ba la ni chos zhes brjod de /
translated: That which arises from the dependent origination of the assembly of causes and conditions is called a phenomenon.

original: skye ba'i chos ni chos gzhan la brten nas bdag nyid thob la /
analyzed: skye ba'i chos ni chos gzhan la brten nas bdag nyid thob la /
translated: The phenomenon of arising is obtained by itself in dependence on another phenomenon.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Transcendent Lord has said this.

original: 'di yod pa las 'di 'byung ba dang 'di skyes pas 'di skye bar 'gyur zhes pas ni 'gal ba med de mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yod pa las 'di 'byung ba dang 'di skyes pas 'di skye bar 'gyur zhes pas ni 'gal ba med de mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no contradiction in saying that when this exists, that arises, and when this is born, that is born, because it exists in the compatible position.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin te don dam pa'i rang bzhin gyi skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / mi sbyor ba ni 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin te don dam pa'i rang bzhin gyi skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / mi sbyor ba ni 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it indeterminate, because arising by way of ultimate nature is untenable, and because non-application is tenable.

original: don dam par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the entity of cause and effect is not established ultimately.

original: ma grub pa ni don dam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid la 'dzin pa la sbyor bar mi 'thad pa'i @29b phyir ro //
analyzed: ma grub pa ni don dam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid la 'dzin pa la sbyor bar mi 'thad pa'i @29b phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established, it is not tenable that it is applied to the apprehension of itself by way of the nature of consciousness ultimately.

original: rang rig pa'i shes pa rnams kyang rang rig pa tsam du bya bas snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po gang du yang mi 'dzin pa'i phyir rgyud gcig nyid du btags pas dngos por med pa'i phyir dang / rgyu tha dad pa can rnams kyang phan tshun mi rig pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i shes pa rnams kyang rang rig pa tsam du bya bas snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po gang du yang mi 'dzin pa'i phyir rgyud gcig nyid du btags pas dngos por med pa'i phyir dang / rgyu tha dad pa can rnams kyang phan tshun mi rig pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Also, those that have different causes do not mutually cognize each other.

original: dmigs pa'i dus su yang rgyu dang 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa dag 'gegs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dus su yang rgyu dang 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa dag 'gegs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, at the time of the object, the assertion of cause and effect is refuted.

original: rim gyis 'byung ba'i blos snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po nyams su myong nas de'i rjes la de la sems rnam pa can gyi blos rjes su mtshams sbyor bas snga ma khyad par can du 'dus byas pa'i sgo nas snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po rtogs
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung ba'i blos snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po nyams su myong nas de'i rjes la de la sems rnam pa can gyi blos rjes su mtshams sbyor bas snga ma khyad par can du 'dus byas pa'i sgo nas snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po rtogs
translated: If it is said that the mind that arises in sequence experiences the prior and subsequent entities and that subsequently the mind that has that aspect connects them, then the prior and subsequent entities are cognized through the prior and subsequent entities being combined as a single entity.

original: pa nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs pa nyid de zhes bya zhe na //
analyzed: pa nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs pa nyid de zhes bya zhe na //
translated: Also, the entity of cause and effect is cognized.

original: de ni kun rdzob kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur te kun tu myong ba'i dus kyi rang gi ngo bo tsam rig pa ste /
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur te kun tu myong ba'i dus kyi rang gi ngo bo tsam rig pa ste /
translated: That is the nature of the conventional, which is the mere awareness of the entity of the experience itself.

original: gang du 'di nyid rnam par gzhag pa med pas de nyid la mngon sum gyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa med do //
analyzed: gang du 'di nyid rnam par gzhag pa med pas de nyid la mngon sum gyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa med do //
translated: Since it is not posited in that way, the entity of cause and effect is not established by direct perception.

original: de nyid kyis ni rjes su dpag pa yang med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni rjes su dpag pa yang med pa ste /
translated: By that same token, there is no inference either.

original: gang yang ji ltar 'bras bu skad cig la rang gi rgyu'i skad cig gi dngos po mthong la de med na de de'i rgyu'i skad cig dang dus mnyam pa'i dngos po ma lus pa sna tshogs par gyur pa'i skad cig ma'i dngos po yang mthong la de med
analyzed: gang yang ji ltar 'bras bu skad cig la rang gi rgyu'i skad cig gi dngos po mthong la de med na de de'i rgyu'i skad cig dang dus mnyam pa'i dngos po ma lus pa sna tshogs par gyur pa'i skad cig ma'i dngos po yang mthong la de med
translated: If one sees the entity of the effect in the moment of its cause, and if one does not see the entity of the cause that is simultaneous with the effect, then one would see the entity of the effect that is simultaneous with the cause.

original: na mi mthong zhes pa ni de'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: na mi mthong zhes pa ni de'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
translated: If one does not see that, then one would not see the entity of the effect.

original: rgyud gang zhig gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyud gang zhig gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that there is a relationship of cause and effect between two continua.

original: 'dir ni don dam pa pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i sgrub pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni don dam pa pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i sgrub pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, however, we are concerned with the establishment of ultimate cause and effect.

original: skad cig ma las gzhan pa yang don dam pa pa'i rgyu ni ma grub la /
analyzed: skad cig ma las gzhan pa yang don dam pa pa'i rgyu ni ma grub la /
translated: Apart from momentariness, no other ultimate cause is established.

original: rtag pa'i don ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por med pas mngon sum gyis lhan cig gzung bar mi nus pa nyid pas bdag dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i bde ba la sogs par ni rjes su 'gro ba grub pa med la /
analyzed: rtag pa'i don ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por med pas mngon sum gyis lhan cig gzung bar mi nus pa nyid pas bdag dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i bde ba la sogs par ni rjes su 'gro ba grub pa med la /
translated: And since the meaning of permanence is not a causal entity, it cannot be apprehended by direct perception as coexistent. Therefore, it is not established that the self, ƒ™≈õvara, and so on are the cause of pleasure and so on.

original: bden pa de dang ma bral bar gang du yang bde ba mi skye'o //
analyzed: bden pa de dang ma bral bar gang du yang bde ba mi skye'o //
translated: Without being related to that truth, pleasure is not produced anywhere.

original: de la ldog pa yang med de /
analyzed: de la ldog pa yang med de /
translated: And it is not the case that it is not related to that truth.

original: rtag pa nyid kyis ldog pa can min pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis ldog pa can min pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of permanence, it is not the case that it is related.

original: de'i phyir na don dam par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na don dam par rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is not the slightest valid cognition that establishes ultimate cause and effect.

original: gang yang don dam pa pa'i 'bras bu'i skyed pa po rang las sam gzhan las sam gnyi ga las sam gnyi ga ma yin pa las sam rgyu med pa las gyur te /
analyzed: gang yang don dam pa pa'i 'bras bu'i skyed pa po rang las sam gzhan las sam gnyi ga las sam gnyi ga ma yin pa las sam rgyu med pa las gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the ultimate producer of results is not from itself, not from another, not from both, not from neither, and not without a cause.

original: de la thog ma med @30a * //
analyzed: de la thog ma med @30a * //
translated: Regarding that, it is untenable that a cause exists from beginningless

original: pa nas yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid la ni rgyu nyid mi 'thad la /
analyzed: pa nas yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid la ni rgyu nyid mi 'thad la /
translated: time in the nature of existent and nonexistent things.üîΩThat which is nonexistent is like the son of a barren woman. It does not

original: med pa ni mo gsham gyi bu'i rjes su 'gro ba bzhin du med cing rang nyid ma skyes pa la rang las skye ba ni med la /
analyzed: med pa ni mo gsham gyi bu'i rjes su 'gro ba bzhin du med cing rang nyid ma skyes pa la rang las skye ba ni med la /
translated: exist. That which is not arisen from itself is not arisen from itself.üîΩSince it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise fromüîΩitself, like a thought?üîΩSince it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise fromüîΩitself, like a thought?

original: rdzogs kyang cha nas med par skyes pas na sems pa bzhin rang las ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rdzogs kyang cha nas med par skyes pas na sems pa bzhin rang las ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Since it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise fromüîΩitself, like a thought?üîΩSince it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise fromüîΩitself, like a thought?üîΩSince it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise fromüîΩitself, like a thought?üîΩSince it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise fromüîΩitself, like a thought?üîΩSince it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise fromüîΩitself, like a thought?üîΩSince it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise fromüîΩitself, like a thought?üîΩSince it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise fromüîΩitself, like a thought?üîΩSince it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise fromüîΩitself, like a thought?üîΩSince it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise fromüîΩitself, like a thought?üîΩSince it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise fromüîΩitself, like a thought?üîΩSince it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise fromüîΩitself, like a thought?üîΩSince it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise fromüîΩitself, like a thought?üîΩSince it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise fromüîΩitself, like a thought?üîΩSince it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise fromüîΩitself, like a thought?üîΩSince it is not arisen from a nonexistent part, how could it arise from

original: gang zhig rdzogs pa min pas gang zhig rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni de de'i ngo bo nyid du sbyor ba ni ches thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩthams cad du yang dngos po rnams ni grangs can gyi 'dod pas rtag tu ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'i mngon par gsal te /
analyzed: gang zhig rdzogs pa min pas gang zhig rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni de de'i ngo bo nyid du sbyor ba ni ches thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩthams cad du yang dngos po rnams ni grangs can gyi 'dod pas rtag tu ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'i mngon par gsal te /
translated: itself, like a thought?

original: mngon par gsal bar byed pa rnams kyis mngon par gsal bar rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir mngon par mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan mi rigs pas /
analyzed: mngon par gsal bar byed pa rnams kyis mngon par gsal bar rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir mngon par mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan mi rigs pas /
translated: Because the manifest things are always present as manifest, it is illogical for them to have other aspects such as being unmanifest.

original: gsal ba byed pa rnams kyis cung zad ma byas pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gsal ba byed pa rnams kyis cung zad ma byas pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because the manifest things are not made manifest in the least by the conditions,

original: rtag tu yang dngos po rnams thams cad rtag tu mngon par gsal ba la sogs par thal ba ni bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: rtag tu yang dngos po rnams thams cad rtag tu mngon par gsal ba la sogs par thal ba ni bzlog par dka'o //
translated: it is difficult to avoid the consequence that all things are always manifest and so on.

original: gzhan yang gang du gang rang las skye ba la ni yul la sogs pa nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang du gang rang las skye ba la ni yul la sogs pa nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if something were to arise from itself, the object and so on would not be ascertained.

original: gzhan la ltos pa'i 'di gzhan las skye bar gyur pa'i nye bar mkho ba med pa la ltos pa ni rigs pa mi yin zhing ltos par bya ba ni rtag tu nye ba'i phyir tu 'di nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa'i 'di gzhan las skye bar gyur pa'i nye bar mkho ba med pa la ltos pa ni rigs pa mi yin zhing ltos par bya ba ni rtag tu nye ba'i phyir tu 'di nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is illogical that this, which depends on another, would arise from another, since it does not need what it depends on. And it is illogical that it would arise from itself, since that which is to be relied on is always present.

original: de nyid kyis na tha snyad du yang rang las skye ba mi srid la /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na tha snyad du yang rang las skye ba mi srid la /
translated: Therefore arising from self is impossible even conventionally.

original: gzhan las ni dus snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus dag ngo bo gcig par mngon par 'dod pas rtag pa la skye ba'i tha snyad kyang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan las ni dus snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus dag ngo bo gcig par mngon par 'dod pas rtag pa la skye ba'i tha snyad kyang mi rigs te /
translated: But in other systems, since the earlier and later times are asserted to be of the same nature, it is not even tenable to call the permanent thing arisen.

original: rtag pa la rim dang cig car gyi bya ba byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: rtag pa la rim dang cig car gyi bya ba byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because for a permanent thing, the performance of an action in sequence or simultaneously is impossible.

original: de la tshad mas gzhan du nye bar brjod pas ci zhig btags pa 'thad de /
analyzed: de la tshad mas gzhan du nye bar brjod pas ci zhig btags pa 'thad de /
translated: What is the point of designating it as something else by means of valid knowledge?

original: de'i rtag pa ni nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo ri bong gi rva dang khyad par med de /
analyzed: de'i rtag pa ni nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo ri bong gi rva dang khyad par med de /
translated: Its permanence would be no different from the horns of a rabbit, an entity devoid of all ability.

original: dngos po thams cad dang bral ba nyid ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dang bral ba nyid ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of an absence is the mere absence of all things.

original: mi rtag pa skad cig ma'i dngos po la skye bar yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa skad cig ma'i dngos po la skye bar yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also not tenable for an impermanent thing to arise in a momentary entity.

original: mi rtag pa'i dngos po ni skad cig mas gnas pa'i chos nyid gzhan du 'thad par byas so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i dngos po ni skad cig mas gnas pa'i chos nyid gzhan du 'thad par byas so //
translated: Because an impermanent thing is posited as having a different nature that endures for an instant.

original: de 'das pa las mi skye ste /
analyzed: de 'das pa las mi skye ste /
translated: It does not arise from the past,

original: 'das pa med pa nyid kyis na rgyu med pa las skye bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'das pa med pa nyid kyis na rgyu med pa las skye bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: because it would arise without a cause, since the past does not exist.

original: ma 'ongs pa las kyang min te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa las kyang min te /
translated: Nor does it arise from the future,

original: med pa nyid kyis 'bras bu bskyed pa ni nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa @30b bzhin no //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyis 'bras bu bskyed pa ni nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa @30b bzhin no //
translated: because what is nonexistent cannot generate an effect, like the sky-flower, etc.

original: da ltar byung bas kyang min te /
analyzed: da ltar byung bas kyang min te /
translated: Nor does it arise from the present,

original: de'i yang skyed par byed pa'i 'bras bu dang dus mnyam pa'am dus tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: de'i yang skyed par byed pa'i 'bras bu dang dus mnyam pa'am dus tha dad pa ste /
translated: because the present effect is simultaneous with the cause or not simultaneous with the cause.

original: dang po ni min te /
analyzed: dang po ni min te /
translated: The first is not so,

original: 'bras bu bskyed pa'i sngon du rgyu med pa nyid kyis ri bong gi bzhin du nus pa la sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed pa'i sngon du rgyu med pa nyid kyis ri bong gi bzhin du nus pa la sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because prior to the generation of the effect, the cause would be nonexistent, and, like the horns of a rabbit, it would not be connected with the capacity to generate the effect.

original: gang yang rgyu'i bdag nyid thob pa'i dngos po des 'bras bu yang de dang dus mnyam du des rdzogs she na ni /
analyzed: gang yang rgyu'i bdag nyid thob pa'i dngos po des 'bras bu yang de dang dus mnyam du des rdzogs she na ni /
translated: If the entity that has attained the nature of the cause generates the effect simultaneously with itself,

original: gang gang gi rgyu la dus tha dad pas kyang lam mngon pa min de 'das pas ma 'ongs pa skyed pa la sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gang gi rgyu la dus tha dad pas kyang lam mngon pa min de 'das pas ma 'ongs pa skyed pa la sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the effect would be generated by the cause that is not simultaneous with it, because the past generates the future.

original: de nas rgyu yod pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la skad cig mas bar chod par 'bras bu yod pa nyid du skyed na de la yang rgyu med de skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de nas rgyu yod pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la skad cig mas bar chod par 'bras bu yod pa nyid du skyed na de la yang rgyu med de skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: If the effect exists at the time of the second moment when the cause exists, and it is generated without being obstructed by the second moment, then it would also lack a cause because it is momentary.

original: de ltar ni rgyu ni rgyu skad cig tu yod pas 'bras bu dus gzhan gyis bar ma chod par 'bras bu'i nang du phra mor gyur pa'i dus gzhan ni med pas /
analyzed: de ltar ni rgyu ni rgyu skad cig tu yod pas 'bras bu dus gzhan gyis bar ma chod par 'bras bu'i nang du phra mor gyur pa'i dus gzhan ni med pas /
translated: In that case, since the cause exists at the moment of the cause, it would not exist at another time, that is, at the time of the effect, which is subtle and not obstructed by another time.

original: dus gcig tu 'gyur ro //üîΩcha shas med pa'i snga ma dang / phyi ma'i skad cig ma dag ni thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyis kun tu reg pas de'i yang skad cig ma gcig gi nang di skad cig ma thams cad 'dus pas bskal pa yang skad cig tsam du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus gcig tu 'gyur ro // cha shas med pa'i snga ma dang / phyi ma'i skad cig ma dag ni thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyis kun tu reg pas de'i yang skad cig ma gcig gi nang di skad cig ma thams cad 'dus pas bskal pa yang skad cig tsam du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore they would be simultaneous.üîΩSince the earlier and later moments that are partless are completely covered by the nature of all, all moments would be included in a single moment. Therefore an eon would be merely a moment.

original: rdul phra rab rnams thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyis kun tu sbyor na gong bu yang rdul phran tsam du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyis kun tu sbyor na gong bu yang rdul phran tsam du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: If subtle particles were to join together by their nature, the composite would be merely a particle.

original: de'i yang ji ltar dngos po rnams kyi yul rim gyis snang ba'i kun rdzob pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir la de ltar dus kyi rim pa la yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i yang ji ltar dngos po rnams kyi yul rim gyis snang ba'i kun rdzob pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir la de ltar dus kyi rim pa la yang 'gyur te /
translated: Because the conventional valid cognition that perceives objects in sequence contradicts the existence of a single, partless consciousness, time must also be sequential.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa rnams su bskal ba la sogs pa'i snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa rnams su bskal ba la sogs pa'i snang ba bzhin no //
translated: This is just like the appearances of eons and so on in dreams and so forth.

original: yul gcig pa'i skad cig mas bar ma chod pa la cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir dus kyi mtha'i bar nyid du de'i mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul gcig pa'i skad cig mas bar ma chod pa la cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir dus kyi mtha'i bar nyid du de'i mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Since the instants of a single object are not interrupted, they are endowed with parts. Therefore, the defining characteristics of time will be impaired up to the very end of time.

original: dngos po rab tu bcom pa dngos med dang lhan cig bar ma chad kyang dus gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: dngos po rab tu bcom pa dngos med dang lhan cig bar ma chad kyang dus gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Even though the complete destruction of an entity and nonentity are not interrupted, they will not be simultaneous.

original: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rgyun ma chad kyang dus mnyam min zhes pa ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rgyun ma chad kyang dus mnyam min zhes pa ni mi 'thad de /
translated: Thus it is untenable to say, ‚ÄúAlthough there is no interruption of the continuum of cause and effect, they are not simultaneous.‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa ni gang du tha snyad du yang yod pa min te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni gang du tha snyad du yang yod pa min te /
translated: Nonentities do not exist anywhere, even conventionally.

original: ji ltar sngon po ni yul gzhan du yang sngon po min pa las log pa rang gi rgyu las skyes la /
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po ni yul gzhan du yang sngon po min pa las log pa rang gi rgyu las skyes la /
translated: For example, blue arises from its own causes as the opposite of non-blue.

original: de ltar dus gzhan la yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar dus gzhan la yang ngo //
translated: The same is true of other times.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid 'jig par 'gyur ba'i 'jig pa ni 'dir yul dang dus dag gi ngo bo ldog pa tsam 'ba' zhig la tha snyad du byed pa @31a * //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid 'jig par 'gyur ba'i 'jig pa ni 'dir yul dang dus dag gi ngo bo ldog pa tsam 'ba' zhig la tha snyad du byed pa @31a * //
translated: Here, the mere cessation of the nature of the object and time is called ‚Äúcessation‚Äù in the sense that the nature of things ceases.

original: las ci yang min no //
analyzed: las ci yang min no //
translated: It is nothing more than that.

original: 'jig pas na 'jig ces pa'i med pa'i bdag nyid ni don dam par dngos po med pa nyid kyis de nyid dang gzhan nyid spangs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'jig pas na 'jig ces pa'i med pa'i bdag nyid ni don dam par dngos po med pa nyid kyis de nyid dang gzhan nyid spangs pa kho na ste /
translated: Since it ceases, it is called ‚Äúcessation.‚Äù The nature of nonexistence is ultimately not a thing, because it is devoid of identity and difference.

original: dngos po la dngos po med do zhes pa dngos po dgag pa'i tha snyad tsam yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la dngos po med do zhes pa dngos po dgag pa'i tha snyad tsam yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúA thing is not a nonthing‚Äù is merely the conventional negation of a thing.

original: de'i phyir 'dir bar ma chod pa la sogs pa can gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir bar ma chod pa la sogs pa can gyis ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not like that which is interrupted, etc.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni dngos po nyid du khas len pas bar chad pa la sogs par sems par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni dngos po nyid du khas len pas bar chad pa la sogs par sems par bya ste /
translated: Since cause and effect are accepted as things, one should think of them as being interrupted, etc.

original: de nyid ni don dam par gzhan las skye bar yang rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de nyid ni don dam par gzhan las skye bar yang rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not reasonable that ultimately they arise from another.

original: gtso bo dang dbang phyug dang rang dang gzhan las skye ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtso bo dang dbang phyug dang rang dang gzhan las skye ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor do they arise from a primal substance, ƒ™≈õvara, or self and other,

original: so sor brjod pa'i skyon ma rungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor brjod pa'i skyon ma rungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the faults already mentioned are applicable.

original: kha cig dag tsher ma la sogs pa rnams kyi rno ba la sogs pa'i rgyu ma mthong bas med pa nyid bzhin du dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis skye bar brjod de /
analyzed: kha cig dag tsher ma la sogs pa rnams kyi rno ba la sogs pa'i rgyu ma mthong bas med pa nyid bzhin du dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis skye bar brjod de /
translated: Some say that things arise by their intrinsic reality, just as the sharpness, etc., of thorns, etc., are without a cause, since one does not see a cause.

original: de la ma mthong ba nyid du ma grub ste /
analyzed: de la ma mthong ba nyid du ma grub ste /
translated: But that is not so, because one does not see.

original: don dam par ni chos rnams thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: don dam par ni chos rnams thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir la /
translated: Ultimately, all things are non-arisen.

original: kun rdzob tu ni skye ba'i rgyu med pa can du bsgrub pa mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni skye ba'i rgyu med pa can du bsgrub pa mi 'grub bo //
translated: Conventionally, it is not established that they are without a cause of arising.

original: gang du yang sa bon la sogs pa dag las tsher ma la sogs pa dag skye bar 'gyur ba de rnams kyi rno ba la sogs pa gang du rgyu med pa can las mi skye ste /
analyzed: gang du yang sa bon la sogs pa dag las tsher ma la sogs pa dag skye bar 'gyur ba de rnams kyi rno ba la sogs pa gang du rgyu med pa can las mi skye ste /
translated: And where thorns, etc., arise from seeds, etc., their sharpness, etc., do not arise without a cause.

original: rgyu med pa can nyid la rno ba la sogs pa'i tsher ma la sogs pa nges par 'gyur na khyad par med pas de lta na ni thams cad la thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyis 'gyur na /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can nyid la rno ba la sogs pa'i tsher ma la sogs pa nges par 'gyur na khyad par med pas de lta na ni thams cad la thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyis 'gyur na /
translated: If it were causeless, then it would be definite that thorns, etc. would be sharp, etc. But since there is no difference, then everything would be the nature of everything.

original: sa bon la sogs pa rnams ni 'jig rten pa la mngon sum nyid du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa'i phyir dam bca' ba mngon sum dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa rnams ni 'jig rten pa la mngon sum nyid du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa'i phyir dam bca' ba mngon sum dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: Since the existence of seeds, etc. as cause and effect is established by direct perception for the world, the thesis is contrary to direct perception.

original: gtan tshigs ni gzhan dag la bsgrub par bya ba la nges pa bskyed par khas blangs pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba dang gzhan la rgyu'i rkyen gyi sbyor ba don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni gzhan dag la bsgrub par bya ba la nges pa bskyed par khas blangs pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba dang gzhan la rgyu'i rkyen gyi sbyor ba don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The reason is contrary to one‚Äôs own words, because one accepts that it generates certainty in others about what is to be proven, and it is pointless to apply a causal condition to others.

original: de la 'dir rgyu med par smra ba dag la tha snyad du yang mngon sum la sogs pa rnams kyis gnod la /
analyzed: de la 'dir rgyu med par smra ba dag la tha snyad du yang mngon sum la sogs pa rnams kyis gnod la /
translated: Here, for those who advocate causelessness, the thesis is undermined even conventionally by direct perception, etc.

original: gang yang yod pa la 'bras bu skye ba ni de'i cha shas med pas gzhan rnams kyis sngar med pa'i khyad par ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
