analyzed: gang yang yod pa la 'bras bu skye ba ni de'i cha shas med pas gzhan rnams kyis sngar med pa'i khyad par ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, an effect does not arise from an existent cause, because it has no parts.

original: med pa las kyang mi skye ste /
analyzed: med pa las kyang mi skye ste /
translated: Also, an effect does not arise from a nonexistent cause,

original: yod pa dang med pa dag phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive.

original: 'o na med ces pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'o na med ces pa ci zhig yod /
translated: Well then, what is it that is nonexistent?üîΩThat which is about to arise is nonexistent prior to its arising.

original: cung zhig gang skye bar 'gyur ba de snga na med ces pa de rgyu 'di las med par skye bar 'gyur zhes pa'i @31b bya ba ni khyad par gzhan gyi tha snyad lo //
analyzed: cung zhig gang skye bar 'gyur ba de snga na med ces pa de rgyu 'di las med par skye bar 'gyur zhes pa'i @31b bya ba ni khyad par gzhan gyi tha snyad lo //
translated: That is the meaning of ‚Äúnonexistent.‚Äù

original: de lta na ni de lta bu'i lta ba ni bdag cag gis dgag par mi byed do //
analyzed: de lta na ni de lta bu'i lta ba ni bdag cag gis dgag par mi byed do //
translated: We do not refute such a view.

original: sgra don gyi sgyu ma dang rmi lam la sogs pa yang mi 'byung ba 'byung la /
analyzed: sgra don gyi sgyu ma dang rmi lam la sogs pa yang mi 'byung ba 'byung la /
translated: Also, illusions, dreams, and so on, which are false objects, arise without existing.

original: byung ba yang ma byung bar mthong ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: byung ba yang ma byung bar mthong ba'i phyir na /
translated: Also, what has arisen is seen as not having arisen.

original: gang du yang kun rdzob pa'i dngos po rnams sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du skyes nas gnas pa de rnams la bdag cag gis sgro btags pa'i rnam pa dgag pa la 'gal ba las byung ba med pas sgra don nyid du thams cad kyi gzhan du ni
analyzed: gang du yang kun rdzob pa'i dngos po rnams sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du skyes nas gnas pa de rnams la bdag cag gis sgro btags pa'i rnam pa dgag pa la 'gal ba las byung ba med pas sgra don nyid du thams cad kyi gzhan du ni
translated: In any case, since there is no contradiction in the arising and endurance of conventional things like illusions, we do not contradict the refutation of the aspects superimposed by others.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, all things are not other than their own expressions.

original: yod pa dang med pa nyid ngo bo gcig pa nyid du med do //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa nyid ngo bo gcig pa nyid du med do //
translated: Existence and nonexistence do not have the same nature.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because things and nonthings are contradictory.

original: 'gag pa dang skye ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa'o zhes pa'i 'dod pa ni ci yang min te /
analyzed: 'gag pa dang skye ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa'o zhes pa'i 'dod pa ni ci yang min te /
translated: The assertion that cessation and arising are concomitant is meaningless.

original: gang yang rgyu las 'pho ba'i cha de la rgyu gzhan gyi bya ba med la /
analyzed: gang yang rgyu las 'pho ba'i cha de la rgyu gzhan gyi bya ba med la /
translated: The part of the effect that is transferred from the cause has no activity of another cause.

original: gang du yang bya ba sngon du 'gro ba dang bcas pa ni med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang du yang bya ba sngon du 'gro ba dang bcas pa ni med pa nyid de /
translated: And that which has activity does not have a prior existence.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i bye brag dang bral ba'i rnam pa gzhan la skye ba yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i bye brag dang bral ba'i rnam pa gzhan la skye ba yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no arising of another aspect that is free from the distinction of existence and nonexistence.

original: phan tshun spangs nas gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can 'di dag la ni rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs nas gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can 'di dag la ni rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because these two, which have the character of mutually excluding each other, cannot possibly have another mode.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis med pa la ni dngos po'am dngos po med par de'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir dang rnam pa gzhan te yang yod pa dang med pa 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis med pa la ni dngos po'am dngos po med par de'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir dang rnam pa gzhan te yang yod pa dang med pa 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that which does not exist by intrinsic reality, neither existence nor non-existence can be its nature, because it is a combination of existence and non-existence, which is another mode.

original: de nyid kyis na bstan bcos su de yongs su bcad cing de las gzhan pa rnam par bcad nas rnam pa de las gzhan ni med pa gsal bar byas zhes so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na bstan bcos su de yongs su bcad cing de las gzhan pa rnam par bcad nas rnam pa de las gzhan ni med pa gsal bar byas zhes so //
translated: For that very reason, the treatise declares, ‚ÄúHaving defined that, and having excluded that which is other than that, it is made clear that there is nothing other than that mode.‚Äù

original: de nyid don dam pa'i ngo bo las log pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid dngos po la ngo bo nyid kyi med pa la sogs pa des khyab pa'o zhes pas khyab pa grub la /
analyzed: de nyid don dam pa'i ngo bo las log pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid dngos po la ngo bo nyid kyi med pa la sogs pa des khyab pa'o zhes pas khyab pa grub la /
translated: That very thing, which is the dependent origination that is the opposite of the nature of the ultimate, is pervaded by the non-existence of intrinsic reality in things and so forth. Thus the pervasion is established.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there any uncertainty.

original: tha snyad du ni sngags la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis sgyu ma la sogs pa ji ltar skye bar mthong ba ni gnyi ga la grub pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad du ni sngags la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis sgyu ma la sogs pa ji ltar skye bar mthong ba ni gnyi ga la grub pa'o //
translated: Conventionally, the arising of illusions and so on through the conditions of mantras and so on is seen. This is established for both of us.

original: 'o na khyod kyi 'dod pas dngos po thams cad la dngos po nyid tsam bkag na don gyi bya ba'i nus pa'i mtshan nyid kho na'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid med pas 'on kyang gsal ba yang yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na khyod kyi 'dod pas dngos po thams cad la dngos po nyid tsam bkag na don gyi bya ba'i nus pa'i mtshan nyid kho na'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid med pas 'on kyang gsal ba yang yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Now, if you negate mere entityness in all things, then since the definition of an entity is only the capacity to perform a function, the definition of an entity does not exist. However, you say that manifestation exists.

original: de la thog ma dgag pa ni rnam par shes pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa don dam par nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: de la thog ma dgag pa ni rnam par shes pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa don dam par nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'o //
translated: The first refutation is that consciousness is empty of all capacities ultimately, but it has the capacity of the aspect of blue and so on.

original: kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni dngos po med par rang rig pa'i mngon sum @32a * //üîΩgyis 'grub pas /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni dngos po med par rang rig pa'i mngon sum @32a * // gyis 'grub pas /
translated: Conventionally, dependent arising is established by reflexive awareness, which is direct perception, since it is not nonexistent.

original: des gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can gyis sems can med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can gyis sems can med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since it has the characteristic of manifestation, it is not nonexistent.

original: de'i gsal bar byed pa yang gsal ba nyid du bden par 'gyur zhes pa'i gsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la sgrub byed dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de'i gsal bar byed pa yang gsal ba nyid du bden par 'gyur zhes pa'i gsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la sgrub byed dang bral ba ste /
translated: In order to prove that the nature of entities is emptiness, you are devoid of a proof.

original: dpe dang phyogs la mngon sum gyis gnod pas gtan tshigs ma nges par 'gyur zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: dpe dang phyogs la mngon sum gyis gnod pas gtan tshigs ma nges par 'gyur zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Since direct perception contradicts the example and the subject, the reason is uncertain.

original: de ltar min te /
analyzed: de ltar min te /
translated: That is not so.

original: don dam pa'i mngon sum ni ji ltar yang grub pa med la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i mngon sum ni ji ltar yang grub pa med la /
translated: There is no direct perception of the ultimate whatsoever.üîΩWhere is there a truly existent clarity?

original: gang du gsal ba bden par yod ces pa ni gang du bsgrub par bya ba btags pa la sogs pa can du 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang du gsal ba bden par yod ces pa ni gang du bsgrub par bya ba btags pa la sogs pa can du 'gyur la /
translated: That which is to be proven would be a mere imputation and so on.

original: rang gsal ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa la lkog tu gyur pas the tshom zhes pa ni byis pas kyang brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: rang gsal ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa la lkog tu gyur pas the tshom zhes pa ni byis pas kyang brjod par mi nus so //
translated: Since the aspect of a self-clarity such as blue is hidden, it is impossible for even a child to say, ‚ÄúI wonder what it is.‚Äù

original: skye ba nyid du shes shing mthong yang de gang du gsal ba med pas gnas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: skye ba nyid du shes shing mthong yang de gang du gsal ba med pas gnas zhes pa ni /
translated: Even though one knows and sees that it is born, since there is no clarity of that, it is called a ‚Äúplace.‚Äù

original: rnam par rig par smra ba rnams kyi grub mtha' ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig par smra ba rnams kyi grub mtha' ste /
translated: This is the tenet of the Vij√±aptika.

original: de gang du gtan tshigs la the tshom za na ldog pa'i dogs pa yang med do //
analyzed: de gang du gtan tshigs la the tshom za na ldog pa'i dogs pa yang med do //
translated: And if one doubts the reason, there is no fear of its being reversed.

original: de nas rigs pas gang gis dngos po rnams kyi dngos po skye ba la gnod par 'gyur ba de kun rdzob tu yang gnod par 'gyur bas /üîΩde'i gtan tshigs ma grub po zhe na /
analyzed: de nas rigs pas gang gis dngos po rnams kyi dngos po skye ba la gnod par 'gyur ba de kun rdzob tu yang gnod par 'gyur bas / de'i gtan tshigs ma grub po zhe na /
translated: Now, if you say that the reason is not established because whatever reason there is that undermines the arising of things undermines even the conventional,

original: min te / gang gi phyi'i rgyu la sogs pa skye ba bzhin du 'dir skye ba thams cad yul dang dus dang rgyu'i khyad par la ltos pa yang khyod kyis kun rdzob nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: min te / gang gi phyi'i rgyu la sogs pa skye ba bzhin du 'dir skye ba thams cad yul dang dus dang rgyu'i khyad par la ltos pa yang khyod kyis kun rdzob nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: then that is not so, because you should posit everything that arises here, like the arising of causes and so on, as the conventional, in dependence on the distinctions of place, time, and cause.

original: thog ma med pa nas rang rang gi rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis phan tshun rjes su bskyed la /
analyzed: thog ma med pa nas rang rang gi rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis phan tshun rjes su bskyed la /
translated: Since beginningless time, they have mutually arisen in accordance with their own concordant causes and conditions.

original: de yang ji ltar nges par rnam par gzhag par byed pa ni dus mnyam pa'i dus tha dad pa gal te rnam par gzhag pa de ltar ni 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar nges par rnam par gzhag par byed pa ni dus mnyam pa'i dus tha dad pa gal te rnam par gzhag pa de ltar ni 'gal ba med do //
translated: Moreover, how is it definitely established? If it is established as a different time that is simultaneous, then there is no contradiction.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon yang de la 'jug pa med de /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon yang de la 'jug pa med de /
translated: And the error of nonmomentariness and so on does not apply to it,

original: sgra don la 'gal ba 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra don la 'gal ba 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no contradiction in the meaning of the word.

original: sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bu'i chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni skad cig ma dang skad cig ma ma yin pa'i chos su mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bu'i chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni skad cig ma dang skad cig ma ma yin pa'i chos su mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of phenomena that are like illusions and dreams is not connected with momentary or nonmomentary phenomena.

original: gang du gzhan du 'dus byas pa rnams skad cig ma nyid du gsungs pa de ni bag med pa rnams 'dus byas dag la kun tu yid byung nas rim gyis bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid la gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du gzhan du 'dus byas pa rnams skad cig ma nyid du gsungs pa de ni bag med pa rnams 'dus byas dag la kun tu yid byung nas rim gyis bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid la gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Where conditioned phenomena are said to be momentary, that is for the heedless to become disgusted with conditioned phenomena and gradually enter into the reality of selflessness.

original: gal te don dam par ngo bo nyid med kyang dngos @32b po yul dang dus la sogs pa nges pas so sor snang na des ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang ci'i phyir nges par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par ngo bo nyid med kyang dngos @32b po yul dang dus la sogs pa nges pas so sor snang na des ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang ci'i phyir nges par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if, although ultimately there is no intrinsic reality, things are individually perceived by being ascertained in terms of place, time, and so on, why are rabbit horns and so on not ascertained in the same way?

original: khyod la yang 'di 'dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyod la yang 'di 'dri bar bya'o //
translated: This should be asked of you.

original: rab rib can la sogs pa la yul sgra don la sogs pa dang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dngos po med pa nyid mnyam yang /
analyzed: rab rib can la sogs pa la yul sgra don la sogs pa dang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dngos po med pa nyid mnyam yang /
translated: For those with eye disease and so on, objects such as sound, meaning, and so on, and nonthings such as rabbit horns and so on are equal in being nonexistent.

original: ji ltar na skra shad la sogs pa nyid sgra don du snang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar na skra shad la sogs pa nyid sgra don du snang bar 'gyur la /
translated: So why is it that only floating hairs and so on appear as the meaning of sound,

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ma yin /
translated: but not rabbit horns and so on?

original: 'dir rab rib la sogs pa ni rgyu'i nus pas de ltar nges she na /
analyzed: 'dir rab rib la sogs pa ni rgyu'i nus pas de ltar nges she na /
translated: Here you may say, ‚ÄúIt is ascertained in that way by the power of the cause of eye disease and so on.‚Äù

original: ji ltar dngos po med pa la nus pa nges pas mthong ba'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po med pa la nus pa nges pas mthong ba'i phyir zhe na /
translated: But why is it that you see nonthings by the power of the cause being ascertained?

original: gzhan du yang rgyu'i nus pa nges pas de ltar rnam par gzhag par nges par ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: gzhan du yang rgyu'i nus pa nges pas de ltar rnam par gzhag par nges par ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: Why do you not accept that it is ascertained in that way by the power of the cause in other cases as well?

original: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis na rab rib can la skra shad la sogs pa rnams la bden pa nyid du mi rigs zhes brjod pa nyid na /
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis na rab rib can la skra shad la sogs pa rnams la bden pa nyid du mi rigs zhes brjod pa nyid na /
translated: The nature of consciousness itself is such that it is not tenable for the hairs and so on seen by those with eye disease to be real.

original: shes pa dang shes bya dag las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya dag las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But they do not exist as entities that are different from consciousness and the objects of consciousness.

original: snang ba nyid kyi skra shad la sogs pa rnams ni 'jig rten du tshad mar rab tu grags pa nyid la dngos por ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: snang ba nyid kyi skra shad la sogs pa rnams ni 'jig rten du tshad mar rab tu grags pa nyid la dngos por ni med pa nyid do //
translated: The hairs and so on that appear to the world are renowned as valid cognitions, but they do not exist as real things.

original: de nyid kyis na gang zhig don dam par ma skyes pa de ni kun rdzob tu yang mi skye ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na gang zhig don dam par ma skyes pa de ni kun rdzob tu yang mi skye ste /
translated: Therefore, that which is not ultimately produced is not produced conventionally either.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa rnams bzhin la don dam par dngos po ma skyes zhes pas thal bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs la sgyu ma la sogs pa rnams gzung ba la sogs pa rnams kyis gtan tshigs ma nges par 'gyur ba la ni bzlog
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa rnams bzhin la don dam par dngos po ma skyes zhes pas thal bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs la sgyu ma la sogs pa rnams gzung ba la sogs pa rnams kyis gtan tshigs ma nges par 'gyur ba la ni bzlog
translated: For example, like the son of a barren woman and so on. The reason that ‚Äúthings are not ultimately produced‚Äù is indeterminate with respect to the example, such as an illusion, because of the reversal of the meaning.

original: pa la yang tshad ma med pas ldog pa la the tshom za la /
analyzed: pa la yang tshad ma med pas ldog pa la the tshom za la /
translated: Since there is no valid cognition in regard to that, there is doubt in regard to the negation.

original: don dam par med pas kun rdzob tu yang med na /
analyzed: don dam par med pas kun rdzob tu yang med na /
translated: If it does not exist ultimately, it does not exist even conventionally.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa nub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa nub par 'gyur la /
translated: In that case, the conventional truth would disappear.

original: gang du kun rdzob tu yang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa mi skye ba ni de la sogs pa'i tshogs pa dang bral ba la ste /
analyzed: gang du kun rdzob tu yang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa mi skye ba ni de la sogs pa'i tshogs pa dang bral ba la ste /
translated: Where even conventionally, the son of a barren woman and so on are not produced, it is because of the absence of the collection of causes and conditions of such things.

original: don dam pa'i rang bzhin dang bral bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i rang bzhin dang bral bas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not because of the absence of the ultimate nature.

original: 'o na ji ltar gtan tshigs ma grub pa la sogs par yongs su spong ba'i nus pa med de /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gtan tshigs ma grub pa la sogs par yongs su spong ba'i nus pa med de /
translated: Well, then, how is it that you are unable to avoid the charge that the reason is not established and so on?

original: dngos po rnams thams cad rtag tu yod pa min pa la dgag pa'i sbyor bas sgro 'dogs pa nyid kyi ngo bo dgag pa'i sbyor bas zhes brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dgag pa ni bsgrub par bya ba grub pa la bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i don med ces pa
analyzed: dngos po rnams thams cad rtag tu yod pa min pa la dgag pa'i sbyor bas sgro 'dogs pa nyid kyi ngo bo dgag pa'i sbyor bas zhes brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dgag pa ni bsgrub par bya ba grub pa la bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i don med ces pa
translated: It is difficult to avoid the charge that the negation of the nature of superimposition by a negation statement, ‚ÄúAll things are not ultimately existent,‚Äù is the establishment of the probandum by the proof.

original: ni spang dka'o zhes pa la min te /
analyzed: ni spang dka'o zhes pa la min te /
translated: This is not so.

original: tshad mas gnod pa ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩrang @33a * //
analyzed: tshad mas gnod pa ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la yin pa'i phyir te / rang @33a * //
translated: The refutation by valid knowledge is in regard to the imagined nature.

original: rig pa'i mngon sum ni don dam par yod pa'i yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnams la tshad mas gnod ces pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa'i mngon sum ni don dam par yod pa'i yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnams la tshad mas gnod ces pa ste /
translated: The direct perception of reflexive awareness is in regard to the entities of the nature of things that exist ultimately, the thoroughly established nature.

original: de yang brtags pa'i ngo bo la gzhan du rigs pas sgro btags pa dang ldan nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig pa min pas grub la bsgrub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang brtags pa'i ngo bo la gzhan du rigs pas sgro btags pa dang ldan nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig pa min pas grub la bsgrub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The refutation by valid knowledge is in regard to the imagined nature. It is established that the nature of things that are imputed to be objects of apprehension and apprehender is not as it is imagined by reasonings. It is not established that it is not so.

original: 'dir ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan gyis shes pa la sgyu ma'i skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i yul la de nyid la de'i ngo bo nyid med pas /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan gyis shes pa la sgyu ma'i skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i yul la de nyid la de'i ngo bo nyid med pas /
translated: Here, just as for the consciousness of a magician, the objects of the illusion, the illusory man and woman, and so on, do not have that nature in reality,

original: de'i gzugs la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba de la mngon par zhen pa med pas dben pa nyid du dmigs pa'i nges pa bskyed pa'i rgyur de'i yul du rnam gzhag byed pa de bzhin du gzhan la mngon sum la rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi mnyam
analyzed: de'i gzugs la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba de la mngon par zhen pa med pas dben pa nyid du dmigs pa'i nges pa bskyed pa'i rgyur de'i yul du rnam gzhag byed pa de bzhin du gzhan la mngon sum la rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi mnyam
translated: Since there is no attachment to the form of the object, the object is posited as the cause of generating the ascertainment that observes the mere absence of attachment.

original: du byung ba'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan skye bar byed la /
analyzed: du byung ba'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan skye bar byed la /
translated: In the same way, for those who have realization, the object of direct perception is posited as the cause of the arising of the object of error that occurs simultaneously.

original: de kho na nyid du de'i ngo bo mngon par zhen pa med par nges pa'i rgyu nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du de'i ngo bo mngon par zhen pa med par nges pa'i rgyu nyid kyis na /
translated: Since it is the cause of the ascertainment that there is no attachment to the entity of that object in reality,

original: des dben pa'i yul rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: des dben pa'i yul rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the object that is the absence of that attachment is posited.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa'i yul nang gi sgro btags pa'i dngos po thun mong gi yin yang dngos po ji lta ba bzhin la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de'i yul yang tshad mar 'dod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa'i yul nang gi sgro btags pa'i dngos po thun mong gi yin yang dngos po ji lta ba bzhin la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de'i yul yang tshad mar 'dod do //
translated: In the same way, although the object of inferential consciousness is a superimposed entity that is common to all, its object is asserted to be valid knowledge in the manner of observing things as they are.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid med kyang de nyid pas na rang gi bdag nyid la mi 'jug pa'i 'gal ba yang med de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid med kyang de nyid pas na rang gi bdag nyid la mi 'jug pa'i 'gal ba yang med de /
translated: Although it does not have that entity, since it is that, there is no contradiction that it does not engage its own nature.

original: spyi bo'i ngo bos chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyi bo'i ngo bos chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the nature of the universal is posited as the naturelessness of all phenomena,

original: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid nyid kyi blo'i ngo bo ni nang du son pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid nyid kyi blo'i ngo bo ni nang du son pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the cognition of the universal itself is internal.

original: yod pa'i gtan tshigs skad cig mas 'jig pa'i blo bzhin du /
analyzed: yod pa'i gtan tshigs skad cig mas 'jig pa'i blo bzhin du /
translated: The reason for its existence is like the cognition that is momentary and disintegrates.

original: 'o na sgro btags pas rnam pas stong pa'i gzugs la sogs pa kho na ngo bo nyid med pa'i sgras brjod la /
analyzed: 'o na sgro btags pas rnam pas stong pa'i gzugs la sogs pa kho na ngo bo nyid med pa'i sgras brjod la /
translated: Well, the mere emptiness of form and so on of the superimposition is expressed by the word naturelessness.

original: de'i yang gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum gyi phyir de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa la ngo bo nyid med pa yang mngon sum gyi bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs bzhin du dmigs pas de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i bum pas dben pas byis
analyzed: de'i yang gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum gyi phyir de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa la ngo bo nyid med pa yang mngon sum gyi bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs bzhin du dmigs pas de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i bum pas dben pas byis
translated: And since the nature of form and so on is directly perceived, the naturelessness of that which becomes the nature of form and so on is also directly perceived, like the perception of a place devoid of a pot.

original: pas der dmigs par mi byed la /
analyzed: pas der dmigs par mi byed la /
translated: The childish do not perceive it as the nature of that, as devoid of a pot that is its nature.

original: 'dir yang de ltar mngon sum gyis de ltar dmigs par rung ba'i mtshan nyid ma dmigs pa ni med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'dir yang de ltar mngon sum gyis de ltar dmigs par rung ba'i mtshan nyid ma dmigs pa ni med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'i phyir na /
translated: Here, the nonobservation of a character suitable to be observed by direct perception in that way is suitable as the term ‚Äúnonexistence.‚Äù

original: med pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med ces pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod ce na /
analyzed: med pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med ces pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod ce na /
translated: Therefore, how could the nonexistence of an entity‚Äôs entityness be undermined by inference?

original: min te / dngos po rnams @33b la sgro btags pa'i rnam pas dben pa nyid la ngo bo nyid med par brjod de /
analyzed: min te / dngos po rnams @33b la sgro btags pa'i rnam pas dben pa nyid la ngo bo nyid med par brjod de /
translated: No, because the mere absence of the superimposition of entities is called ‚Äúentityness.‚Äù

original: de la dngos po'i ngo bo skad cig ma bzhin du gzung nas 'dzin kyang 'khrul bas sgro btags pa ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid can gyi skye ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa log pa'i ngo bo'i phyir na /
analyzed: de la dngos po'i ngo bo skad cig ma bzhin du gzung nas 'dzin kyang 'khrul bas sgro btags pa ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid can gyi skye ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa log pa'i ngo bo'i phyir na /
translated: In that regard, although one apprehends the entityness of an entity, like a moment, one is mistaken and does not apprehend the superimposition. The entityness of the aspect of arising, etc., which has the nature of reality, is refuted.

original: tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis nges par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis nges par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, it is not ascertained by those who see only the near side.

original: de 'dir nges par mi 'thad pa'i mngon sum nyid med la mngon sum gyis gnod pa med la /
analyzed: de 'dir nges par mi 'thad pa'i mngon sum nyid med la mngon sum gyis gnod pa med la /
translated: Here, it is not tenable that it is ascertained by direct perception, and direct perception does not undermine it.

original: nges pa skyed pa byed pa can ni mngon sum du byas pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'i mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: nges pa skyed pa byed pa can ni mngon sum du byas pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'i mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: The path of seeing, etc., are the means of generating certainty, because they are the means of making the non-perception of the two graspings a matter of direct experience.

original: de ltar gzung ba yang tha snyad du mi rung ba'i phyir gzung ba med pas brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba yang tha snyad du mi rung ba'i phyir gzung ba med pas brtags pa ste /
translated: Since the grasped is not tenable even conventionally, the grasper is also not tenable, because of the non-existence of the grasped.üîΩSince the object of apprehension does not exist, it is imagined.

original: 'dir dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa nyid yod pas de de la rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa med do //
analyzed: 'dir dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa nyid yod pas de de la rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa med do //
translated: Here, since the object of apprehension does not exist, it is not the case that the non-existence of the object of apprehension is undermined by inference.

original: don dam par zhes pas khyad par du byas pas ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i dngos po'i nges pa ma brtags pas yid ches pa'i gnod pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: don dam par zhes pas khyad par du byas pas ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i dngos po'i nges pa ma brtags pas yid ches pa'i gnod pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Since the ultimate is specified, the non-existence of the object of apprehension is not undermined by the non-critical acceptance of things that are delightful when not investigated.

original: de nyid kyis na 'di thams cad la bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs nas gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na 'di thams cad la bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs nas gsungs pa ste /
translated: For this very reason, the Transcendent Lord intended all of this when he said:

original: gang zhig rkyen rnams kyis bskyed de la skye med de //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen rnams kyis bskyed de la skye med de //
translated: That which is produced by conditions is not produced.

original: de yi skye ba ngo bo nyid du yod pa min //
analyzed: de yi skye ba ngo bo nyid du yod pa min //
translated: Its production does not exist inherently.

original: gang zhig rkyen la rag las de ni stong par bshad //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen la rag las de ni stong par bshad //
translated: That which depends on conditions is said to be empty.

original: gang zhig stong nyid shes pa de ni bag yod yin //
analyzed: gang zhig stong nyid shes pa de ni bag yod yin //
translated: Whoever knows emptiness is heedful.

original: zhes so // de bzhin du de kho na nyid rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i rjes su dpag pa bsam pa'i rang bzhin can nam /
analyzed: zhes so // de bzhin du de kho na nyid rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i rjes su dpag pa bsam pa'i rang bzhin can nam /
translated: Similarly, the inferential cognition that is in harmony with the realization of thatness, whether it is of the nature of reflection or

original: sgom pa'i rang bzhin can gyis ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i shes pas chos rnams thams cad kyi bud shing sreg pa nyid kyi rjes su thob pa ste /
analyzed: sgom pa'i rang bzhin can gyis ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i shes pas chos rnams thams cad kyi bud shing sreg pa nyid kyi rjes su thob pa ste /
translated: meditation, obtains the state of burning the fuel of all phenomena with the fire of the knowledge that fully discerns things as they are.

original: de yang thams cad du ni 'di ltar des sgro btags pa'i chos kyi bud shing bsregs pas rab tu zhi ba rnam par 'byed pa 'bar bas brtags pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang thams cad du ni 'di ltar des sgro btags pa'i chos kyi bud shing bsregs pas rab tu zhi ba rnam par 'byed pa 'bar bas brtags pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, in all cases, since the fuel of the phenomena that are imputed by that [inferential cognition] is burned, the supreme nirvƒÅ·πáa, which is characterized by the pacification of the imputations, is attained as the state of complete pacification, which is the blazing of the discernment of complete peace.

original: de ltar yang dbu ma rtsa ba las /üîΩdngos dang dngos med mchog 'dzin pa //
analyzed: de ltar yang dbu ma rtsa ba las / dngos dang dngos med mchog 'dzin pa //
translated: Thus it is said in the Root Verses on the Middle Way:üîΩThe exhaustion of the apprehension of

original: zad pa mya ngan 'das zhes brjod //
analyzed: zad pa mya ngan 'das zhes brjod //
translated: Things and nonthings is called nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: ces te / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rgyun mur thug pa med pa ni nam mkha' ji srid du rjes su gnas pa kho na'o //üîΩchos mchog las phyin ci log gi bdag nyid kyang mos pa la sogs pas rjes su @34a * //
analyzed: ces te / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rgyun mur thug pa med pa ni nam mkha' ji srid du rjes su gnas pa kho na'o // chos mchog las phyin ci log gi bdag nyid kyang mos pa la sogs pas rjes su @34a * //
translated: Thus, the continuum of nonconceptual supramundane wisdom is uninterrupted, and it remains in its wake as long as space exists.

original: dpag pa la 'jug pas mngon sum du bya ba thob nas chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba so sor rtogs pa zhes pa'i rjes su dpag pas bkag kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes nye bar zhi ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dpag pa la 'jug pas mngon sum du bya ba thob nas chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba so sor rtogs pa zhes pa'i rjes su dpag pas bkag kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes nye bar zhi ba ni ma yin no //
translated: From the supreme mundane quality, one enters into the inference of the nature of the reversal of the four misconceptions through the power of belief and so on. Having attained the state of direct realization, one realizes the omnipresence of the dharmadhatu. Although this is refuted by the inference called the realization of the omnipresence of the dharmadhatu, the supramundane wisdom of peace is not.

original: bud shing mes zad la zad pa'i gser bzang po bzhin du ste /
analyzed: bud shing mes zad la zad pa'i gser bzang po bzhin du ste /
translated: It is like the fire that consumes the firewood and the excellent gold that is refined.

original: de nyid kyis na /üîΩdmigs pa med pas rab tu zhi //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na / dmigs pa med pas rab tu zhi //
translated: Because of that,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: it is completely pacified due to the absence of an object.

original: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo zhes pa'i don no //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúconceptual mind.‚Äù

original: brtags pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa'i khyad par las gzhan pa de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i thabs kyang yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: brtags pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa'i khyad par las gzhan pa de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i thabs kyang yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since there is no other method for realizing reality than the special kind of analysis, etc.,

original: 'dir yang bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed la sogs pa'i tha snyad thams cad kun rdzob la kun rdzob ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'dir yang bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed la sogs pa'i tha snyad thams cad kun rdzob la kun rdzob ci zhig ce na /
translated: here, all the conventions of the probandum, the probans, etc., are in the conventional. What is the conventional?

original: brjod pa ngo bo nyid med pa'i dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid can du phyin ci log pa'i rnam pas sgro btags pa can gyi 'khrul pa'i blo ste /
analyzed: brjod pa ngo bo nyid med pa'i dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid can du phyin ci log pa'i rnam pas sgro btags pa can gyi 'khrul pa'i blo ste /
translated: It is the erroneous mind that reifies things that are essenceless as if they were essentially existent.

original: kun rdzob ni 'dis 'dir de kho na nyid la kun tu sgrib par byed cing g-yogs pas so //üîΩde sgro btags pa'i dngos po la kun rdzob pa zhes brjod pa'am /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni 'dis 'dir de kho na nyid la kun tu sgrib par byed cing g-yogs pas so // de sgro btags pa'i dngos po la kun rdzob pa zhes brjod pa'am /
translated: The conventional is so called because it completely obscures and covers reality.üîΩThe things that are reifications are called conventional.

original: brtag tu med pas kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: brtag tu med pas kun rdzob ste /
translated: Or, the conventional is that which is not to be analyzed.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid la dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i rjes su dpag pa de'i stobs las byung ba can gyi bsams pa las byung ba can gyi shes rab dang bsgoms pa las byung ba can gyi mngon sum gyis de kho na nyid ni
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid la dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i rjes su dpag pa de'i stobs las byung ba can gyi bsams pa las byung ba can gyi shes rab dang bsgoms pa las byung ba can gyi mngon sum gyis de kho na nyid ni
translated: The wisdom that arises from thinking, which is born from the power of that inference that engages the object of unmistaken suchness, and the wisdom that arises from meditation, which is direct perception,

original: rjes su ma brtags pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su ma brtags pa ste /
translated: do not examine suchness.

original: de'i rgyu mthun pa ni brtags pa zhes brjod la /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun pa ni brtags pa zhes brjod la /
translated: The concordant cause of that is called ‚Äúexamination.‚Äù

original: de kho na nyid kyi don la rgyab kyis phyogs nas 'di thams cad la phyin ci log pa'i sgra don gyi rnam pas 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni ma brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi don la rgyab kyis phyogs nas 'di thams cad la phyin ci log pa'i sgra don gyi rnam pas 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni ma brtags pa ste /
translated: The consciousness that apprehends all of this through the aspect of the meaning of words that is mistaken in relation to the meaning of suchness is ‚Äúnonexamination.‚Äù

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni ma yin zhing rnam par rtags na dngos po med pa tsam yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni ma yin zhing rnam par rtags na dngos po med pa tsam yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not nonconceptual wisdom, and when conceptual, it is not even the mere absence of entities.

original: de grags pa'i phyir 'di thams cad sgra don gyi ngo bo las med pas kun rdzob pa'o //
analyzed: de grags pa'i phyir 'di thams cad sgra don gyi ngo bo las med pas kun rdzob pa'o //
translated: Because it is renowned, all of this is relative because it does not exist apart from the nature of the meaning of words.

original: yang na 'jig rten las 'das pas yid ches pas kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten las 'das pas yid ches pas kun rdzob ste /
translated: Or, because it is beyond the world, it is relative.

original: 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i don 'di thams cad kun rdzob nyid du mthar thug pa'i phyir la /üîΩcung zhig shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i rnam pa thams cad du so sor nges pa'i las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kho na las gzhan pas kyang 'di mi shes pas gang du dngos po rnams la
analyzed: 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i don 'di thams cad kun rdzob nyid du mthar thug pa'i phyir la / cung zhig shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i rnam pa thams cad du so sor nges pa'i las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kho na las gzhan pas kyang 'di mi shes pas gang du dngos po rnams la
translated: All these things that are well known in the world are ultimately conventional.üîΩThe entire system of karma and its effects, which is very hidden and completely certain, is known only through the wisdom of the Omniscient One.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du brtags pa de ni log pa'i kun rdzob tu brjod de /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du brtags pa de ni log pa'i kun rdzob tu brjod de /
translated: Since it is not known by anyone else, when things are imagined to be permanent and so on, that is called a false convention.

original: nges @34b par gzung yang de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges @34b par gzung yang de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is ascertained, but it does not exist.

original: bdag la sogs pa dang bral ba'i chos 'di rnams ni rgyu dang bcas pa can zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu yod par brjod do //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa dang bral ba'i chos 'di rnams ni rgyu dang bcas pa can zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu yod par brjod do //
translated: These phenomena, which are free from self and so on, are said to exist in the correct convention, which is endowed with a cause.

original: yang ni shes pa dang shes bya'i ngo bo'i phung po lnga can ni kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: yang ni shes pa dang shes bya'i ngo bo'i phung po lnga can ni kun rdzob ste /
translated: Moreover, the five aggregates, which are the nature of the knower and the known, are the conventional.

original: gang du 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang du 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis gsungs pa /
translated: As it was said by ƒÄrya NƒÅgƒÅrjuna:

original: rgyu dang rkyen las kun 'byung ba'i //üîΩgzhan gyi dbang ni kun rdzob pas //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las kun 'byung ba'i // gzhan gyi dbang ni kun rdzob pas //
translated: arising from causes and conditions.üîΩThe dependent is the relative,

original: gzhan gyi dbang zhes grags pa ste //üîΩdon dam nyid ni bcos ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang zhes grags pa ste // don dam nyid ni bcos ma yin //
translated: because it is fabricated.

original: zhes so // de rnams rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung ba des na gzhan gyi dbang ste gang phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid ni kun rdzob tu sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin la don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes so // de rnams rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung ba des na gzhan gyi dbang ste gang phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid ni kun rdzob tu sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin la don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since they arise in dependence, they are the dependent, that is, the five aggregates. The characteristic of the relative is the emptiness that has the characteristic of the ultimate realitylessness of the illusionlike nature of the five aggregates.

original: gal te don dam par spros pa thams cad las 'das pa na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par spros pa thams cad las 'das pa na /
translated: If the ultimate is beyond all fabrication,

original: des don ci zhig grub nas 'di dag don tu bsgribs pa mthar song ba dang bcas pa spang bar 'dod cing na ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: des don ci zhig grub nas 'di dag don tu bsgribs pa mthar song ba dang bcas pa spang bar 'dod cing na ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: what is accomplished by it, and why is it asserted that it is the ultimate, since it is nothing at all?

original: brjod pa / chos thams cad la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid can de kho na nyid kyi rigs dang ldan pa des mchog tu bsgribs pa mthar song ba dang bcas pa spang bar 'dod cing don du gnyer ba rnams kyi don du 'gyur zhes pa'i don ni don dam pa zhes
analyzed: brjod pa / chos thams cad la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid can de kho na nyid kyi rigs dang ldan pa des mchog tu bsgribs pa mthar song ba dang bcas pa spang bar 'dod cing don du gnyer ba rnams kyi don du 'gyur zhes pa'i don ni don dam pa zhes
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúultimate‚Äù is stated as follows:

original: brjod do // dam pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes kyi yul gyi don te don dam pa'o //
analyzed: brjod do // dam pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes kyi yul gyi don te don dam pa'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúultimate‚Äù is that which is the object of non-erroneous wisdom.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa nyid kyis yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bo 'di yang don dam pa'i yul zhes pas don dam pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa nyid kyis yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bo 'di yang don dam pa'i yul zhes pas don dam pa'o //
translated: Since even supramundane wisdom is not different from illusions and so on, this essence of the correct relative is also the object of the ultimate, and thus it is the ultimate.

original: gang yang rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid kyis thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni don dam pa rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pas de yang nye bar btags pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid kyis thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni don dam pa rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pas de yang nye bar btags pa ste /
translated: Also, the wisdom arisen from hearing, contemplation, and meditation, which has the nature of inference, is designated as the ultimate because it is concordant with the realization of the ultimate.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i don yul yin pa'i phyir na don dam pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i don yul yin pa'i phyir na don dam pa'o //
translated: It is the ultimate because it is the object of unerring meaning.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bye brag 'di rnams kyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ngag rnams kyi ni so so'i skye ba'o gnas skabs dang / de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i skabs la ji ltar rigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bye brag 'di rnams kyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ngag rnams kyi ni so so'i skye ba'o gnas skabs dang / de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i skabs la ji ltar rigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: By these distinctions of the conventional and the ultimate, the individual stages of the statements to be explained should be understood as appropriate in the context of the realization of the situation of ordinary beings and the realization of reality.

original: de la kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi don dam pa sgom pa rnams kyis gang du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis gong @35a * //
analyzed: de la kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi don dam pa sgom pa rnams kyis gang du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis gong @35a * //
translated: Therein, the ultimate characterized by reality is the object of meditation by yogins who have completely abandoned all remaining afflictions.

original: nas gong du shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yang rtogs par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: nas gong du shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par yang rtogs par 'gyur bas /
translated: Since they realize the distinctions of the qualities of wisdom and so on,

original: de'i don chen po'i sgrub pa po'i phyir de nyid la dam pa'i sgras rjod par byed par rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don chen po'i sgrub pa po'i phyir de nyid la dam pa'i sgras rjod par byed par rigs pa'o //
translated: it is reasonable to express that reality itself by the word ‚Äúultimate‚Äù because it is the establishment of its great meaning.

original: shes pa yang don dam pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa yang don dam pa ste /
translated: Also, consciousness is ultimate.

original: ma lus pa'i yon tan phun sum yu tshogs pa la gnas par byed pas don chen po'i bsgrub pa'o /
analyzed: ma lus pa'i yon tan phun sum yu tshogs pa la gnas par byed pas don chen po'i bsgrub pa'o /
translated: It is the accomplishment of the great purpose, since it causes one to abide in the perfection of all virtues without exception.

original: nyid ces bya ba ni don dam par cung zad byed pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni don dam par cung zad byed pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äújust‚Äù means that it is not by the slightest bit of activity.

original: 'di nyid ni yang dag pa'i shes ba'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni yang dag pa'i shes ba'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: This is the nature of right knowledge.

original: don dam pa'i dbang du byas na /üîΩdon dam par dngos po med ces pa dang / mi skye zhes bya bar brjod pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pas grub pa las /
analyzed: don dam pa'i dbang du byas na / don dam par dngos po med ces pa dang / mi skye zhes bya bar brjod pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pas grub pa las /
translated: In terms of the ultimate,üîΩit is said that ultimately there are no entities and that nothing arises.

original: 'di rnams skye ba med ces bya bar dgongs te /
analyzed: 'di rnams skye ba med ces bya bar dgongs te /
translated: This is established by right knowledge, and it is intended that these are not produced.

original: gang yang rung ba don dam par ni /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba don dam par ni /
translated: In terms of any of them,üîΩif they are designated by the mode of reality, they do not exist.

original: de kho na nyid kyi rnam pas btags par byas na yod pa min zhes bya ba dang / skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rnam pas btags par byas na yod pa min zhes bya ba dang / skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúthey do not arise.‚Äù

original: de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi don dam pa dang / 'dus byas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi kun rdzob dag lhan cig min zhes tha dad pa nyid min la gnyi ga nyid du yang mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi don dam pa dang / 'dus byas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi kun rdzob dag lhan cig min zhes tha dad pa nyid min la gnyi ga nyid du yang mi 'dod kyi /
translated: The ultimate, which has the characteristic of reality, and the conventional, which has the characteristic of the compounded, are not different, in the sense of being non-coexistent.üîΩThey are not asserted to be both.

original: cung zhig de kho na nyid dang gzhan nyid dag tu brjod du med pa nyid de /
analyzed: cung zhig de kho na nyid dang gzhan nyid dag tu brjod du med pa nyid de /
translated: They are not at all expressible as either the same or different,

original: 'dus byas pa nyid dang don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po nyid la ni de nyid dang gzhan pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa nyid dang don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po nyid la ni de nyid dang gzhan pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible to conceive of the characteristic of the compounded and the characteristic of the ultimate as the same or different.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang don dam par dngos po med pa'i phyir de nyid dang gzhan nyid du 'di gnyis su brjod du med pa nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang don dam par dngos po med pa'i phyir de nyid dang gzhan nyid du 'di gnyis su brjod du med pa nyid kho na'o //
translated: The universal characteristic is also inexpressible as either the same as or different from the two, because ultimately it is a non-entity.

original: yod pa'i dngos po la de nyid dang gzhan pa nyid du brtags kyi dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa la ni de mi srid ces pas na 'gal ba med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i dngos po la de nyid dang gzhan pa nyid du brtags kyi dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa la ni de mi srid ces pas na 'gal ba med pa kho na'o //
translated: The investigation of the same or different in regard to an existent entity is possible, but that is not possible in regard to the essencelessness of entities.üîΩTherefore there is no contradiction.

original: dmigs pa'i sgro btags pa'i tshul gyis rjod par byed pas don dam dang kun rdzob nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i sgro btags pa'i tshul gyis rjod par byed pas don dam dang kun rdzob nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Since it is expressed by the mode of superimposition of the object, it is the ultimate and the conventional.

original: de ni spros pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni spros pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not the ultimate, because it is utterly beyond all elaborations.

original: de yang ma lus pa'i rtog pa'i dra ba dang bral ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis sgro btags pa'i chos thams cad kyi snang ba med pas so sor rang gis dmigs pa med par rig par don kyang nges pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang ma lus pa'i rtog pa'i dra ba dang bral ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis sgro btags pa'i chos thams cad kyi snang ba med pas so sor rang gis dmigs pa med par rig par don kyang nges pa'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, it is the ultimate because it is the object that is ascertained by the supramundane wisdom that is free from the entire net of conceptual elaborations, since it is the nonobservation of all phenomena that are superimposed by the wisdom that is free from the entire net of conceptual elaborations.

original: tha snyad skad du lha'i bu ji srid du rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul @35b las 'das pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: tha snyad skad du lha'i bu ji srid du rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul @35b las 'das pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: In conventional terms, it is said that the son of the gods, as long as it is the object of the wisdom of omniscience endowed with all supreme aspects, it is beyond the object of the wisdom of omniscience endowed with all supreme aspects, it is the ultimate truth.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / ye shes kyi bdag nyid dang don dam par na yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bo de kho na nyid rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir dang yul de kho na nyid kyi phyir na don dam pa'i ngo bo'o zhes pa la ltos pa'i dbye bas
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / ye shes kyi bdag nyid dang don dam par na yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bo de kho na nyid rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir dang yul de kho na nyid kyi phyir na don dam pa'i ngo bo'o zhes pa la ltos pa'i dbye bas
translated: Because it is not different from illusions and so on, and because it is the nature of wisdom, and because it is the ultimate, and because it is the nature of the correct relative, and because it is the realization of thatness, and because it is the object that is thatness, it is the ultimate nature.

original: gcig gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid kyang 'gal ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gcig gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid kyang 'gal ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the division in terms of the two natures is not contradictory.

original: gang zhig sa bcu par khams gsum po 'di rnams sems tsam zhes pa dang / gang yang lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: gang zhig sa bcu par khams gsum po 'di rnams sems tsam zhes pa dang / gang yang lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: In the Ten Grounds, it is said that the three realms are mind only, and in the La·πÖkƒÅvatƒÅra S≈´tra, it is said:

original: don yod ma yin sems nyid de //
analyzed: don yod ma yin sems nyid de //
translated: There is no external reality; it is mind itself.

original: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
analyzed: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
translated: The mind disturbed by habitual tendencies

original: don du snang ba rab tu skye //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: don du snang ba rab tu skye // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Gives rise to the appearance of objects.

original: de rgya chen por bcom ldan 'das ma las dang mdo sde rnams las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan par gsungs par rigs kyi /
analyzed: de rgya chen por bcom ldan 'das ma las dang mdo sde rnams las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan par gsungs par rigs kyi /
translated: This is taught extensively in the Mother s≈´tras and in the s≈´tras that teach the absence of entityness.

original: don dam pa pa nyid la ma yin zhing kun rdzob tu phyi rol gyi don med pa nyid la yang ma yin gyi ;
analyzed: don dam pa pa nyid la ma yin zhing kun rdzob tu phyi rol gyi don med pa nyid la yang ma yin gyi ;
translated: It is not in terms of the ultimate, nor is it in terms of the nonexistence of external objects in the conventional.

original: cung zhig rim gyis don dam pa la bzhugs par byed pa'i phyir sems tsam nyid du bstan pa nyid la /
analyzed: cung zhig rim gyis don dam pa la bzhugs par byed pa'i phyir sems tsam nyid du bstan pa nyid la /
translated: It is in order to gradually lead one to the ultimate that the teaching of mind only is given.

original: kha cig gis log par bsgrubs pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig gis log par bsgrubs pa ste /
translated: Some people misinterpret this.

original: dang po sems tsam nyid la brten nas phyi rol gyi don gyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du so sor bsgrub cing /
analyzed: dang po sems tsam nyid la brten nas phyi rol gyi don gyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du so sor bsgrub cing /
translated: First, based on the teaching of mind only, one establishes the nonexistence of external objects.üîΩAfter that, one establishes that mind only is also ultimately nonexistent.

original: de'i rjes la sems tsam de yang don dam par don med pa nyid kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyis dkrugs pa'i dbang gis sems phyin ci log nas rnam par chad pa'i sngon po la sogs pa can gyi don dam par yod pa snang bar byed
analyzed: de'i rjes la sems tsam de yang don dam par don med pa nyid kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyis dkrugs pa'i dbang gis sems phyin ci log nas rnam par chad pa'i sngon po la sogs pa can gyi don dam par yod pa snang bar byed
translated: The mind appears to exist ultimately in the form of apprehended and apprehender due to the disturbance of the latent tendencies of the apprehended and apprehender.

original: cing sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed ces pa'i don du snang ba la /
analyzed: cing sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed ces pa'i don du snang ba la /
translated: This is the meaning of the statement that it produces the conception that superimposes the existence of what does not exist.

original: kun rdzob tu ni rnam par shes pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi don yang yod de /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni rnam par shes pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi don yang yod de /
translated: Conventionally, external objects exist, just like consciousness.

original: gzhan du na sa bcu pa las /
analyzed: gzhan du na sa bcu pa las /
translated: Otherwise, it would contradict the Ten Levels Sutra, which states:

original: sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa rdul phra rab kyi tshad nyid dang / dben pa nyid du shes shing 'jig rten gyi khams ji snyed pa'i sa'i khams kyi rdul phra rab kyi dkar por gyur pa shes la /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa rdul phra rab kyi tshad nyid dang / dben pa nyid du shes shing 'jig rten gyi khams ji snyed pa'i sa'i khams kyi rdul phra rab kyi dkar por gyur pa shes la /
translated: The bodhisattva on the eighth level knows the measure and the isolation of the atoms of earth, and he knows the atoms of earth that are white in the world systems.üîΩAnd likewise, he knows the atoms of water, fire, and wind.

original: de bzhin du chu'i khams dang me'i khams dang rlung gi khams su yang shes zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩyid ches pa dang 'gal te /
analyzed: de bzhin du chu'i khams dang me'i khams dang rlung gi khams su yang shes zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro // yid ches pa dang 'gal te /
translated: It would also contradict what is commonly accepted.

original: rnam par shes pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi don kyang nges pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi don kyang nges pa'i phyir te /
translated: External objects are ascertained in the same way consciousness is.

original: tha snyad du dngos po gnyis @36a * //
analyzed: tha snyad du dngos po gnyis @36a * //
translated: Conventionally, the two things

original: su bden pa ni ba lang rdzi la yang grags la /
analyzed: su bden pa ni ba lang rdzi la yang grags la /
translated: are accepted even by cowherds.

original: rigs bas dpyad par bya na gnyi ga yang dpyad mi bzod pa des na dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: rigs bas dpyad par bya na gnyi ga yang dpyad mi bzod pa des na dngos po med pa'o //
translated: When analyzed by reason, both are unable to withstand analysis, and therefore they are nonexistent.

original: de lta bas na shes rab kyis bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das ma la phung po lnga bo rnams kyang khyad par med par stong pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na shes rab kyis bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das ma la phung po lnga bo rnams kyang khyad par med par stong pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Therefore, from the point of view of the accomplishment of wisdom, the Bhagavatƒ´ teaches that the five aggregates are not different in being emptiness.

original: de nyid kyis na shes pa dang shes byas stong pa'i gnyis su med pa'i shes ba ni cung zad dngos po med de /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na shes pa dang shes byas stong pa'i gnyis su med pa'i shes ba ni cung zad dngos po med de /
translated: And therefore, the nondual cognition, which is empty of cognition and the cognized, is not even slightly a thing.

original: de nyid kyis ni 'phags pa lang kar gshegs par yang gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni 'phags pa lang kar gshegs par yang gsungs te /
translated: And that is why it is said in the La·πÖkƒÅvatƒÅra S≈´tra:

original: blo gros chen po 'di dag kyang gcig la gcig gis stong pa nyid pas thams cad kyang smad par byas pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'di dag kyang gcig la gcig gis stong pa nyid pas thams cad kyang smad par byas pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, since these are empty of one another, all are to be despised.üîΩYou should completely abandon them.‚Äù

original: de khyod kyis yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes ba dang / 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi kyang /
analyzed: de khyod kyis yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes ba dang / 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi kyang /
translated: And ƒÄrya NƒÅgƒÅrjuna also says:

original: 'di dag thams cad sems tsam zhes zhes //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad sems tsam zhes zhes //
translated: All these are mind only.

original: gang zhig thub pas bstan pa ni //
analyzed: gang zhig thub pas bstan pa ni //
translated: What was taught by the SageüîΩIs for the purpose of abandoning

original: byis ba rnams kyi skrag pa ni //
analyzed: byis ba rnams kyi skrag pa ni //
translated: The fears of the childish.

original: spong ba'i don la de nyid min //
analyzed: spong ba'i don la de nyid min //
translated: It is not reality.

original: zhes te / 'on kyang mdo dag las sems tsam du bstan pa ni gzhan byed pa po dang spyod pa po'i 'bras sur kun tu brtags pas dgag pa ste /
analyzed: zhes te / 'on kyang mdo dag las sems tsam du bstan pa ni gzhan byed pa po dang spyod pa po'i 'bras sur kun tu brtags pas dgag pa ste /
translated: Nevertheless, the teaching of mind-only in the scriptures is a refutation of the imagination of another agent and experiencer.

original: sems las ma gtogs pa gzhan byed pa po la sogs pa ni tha snyad du yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems las ma gtogs pa gzhan byed pa po la sogs pa ni tha snyad du yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, even conventionally, there is no other agent, etc., apart from the mind.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: yang phyi rol med par smra ba'i sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / 'di ltar snod kyi 'jig rten sems kho nar byed pa ni shin tu ngo mtshar te /üîΩlas las skyes pa'i 'gro bar brjod pa'i lus dang las dang sems pa las gang yod pa ni mi na zhes brjod pa ni sems la ni chos thams cad ltos pas gtso bo nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang phyi rol med par smra ba'i sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / 'di ltar snod kyi 'jig rten sems kho nar byed pa ni shin tu ngo mtshar te / las las skyes pa'i 'gro bar brjod pa'i lus dang las dang sems pa las gang yod pa ni mi na zhes brjod pa ni sems la ni chos thams cad ltos pas gtso bo nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: the assertion of the Buddhists who deny external things that the world of sentient beings and the inanimate world are only mind is most astonishing.üîΩBecause the mind is the principal thing, since all things are dependent on the mind.

original: chos rnams thams cad kyi sngon du sems 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad kyi sngon du sems 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind precedes all things.

original: de nyid la de kho na nyid can gyi dngos po khas mi len la /
analyzed: de nyid la de kho na nyid can gyi dngos po khas mi len la /
translated: It is not accepted that the nature of that is a thing.

original: gang yang dngos po med pa yang min te /
analyzed: gang yang dngos po med pa yang min te /
translated: Nor is it nonexistent,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa las log pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa las log pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi phyir ro //
translated: because it has a character that is the opposite of thing and nonthing.

original: de'i dngos po ma grub pas yul med pa la dgag pa'i sbyor ba med de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ma grub pas yul med pa la dgag pa'i sbyor ba med de /
translated: Since its nature is not established, there is no negation that is applied to a nonexistent object.

original: med pa la dgag bya dang dgag byed kyi 'jug pa med pas de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi de yang mi grub la /
analyzed: med pa la dgag bya dang dgag byed kyi 'jug pa med pas de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi de yang mi grub la /
translated: Since there is no engagement of negation and negatee in the nonexistent, that which precedes it is not established.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag gis ni rnam par rtog pa rnams thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir khyab byed med pa la khyab @36b bya mi srid pas de kho na nyid du na dngos po dang dngos po med par mchog tu
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag gis ni rnam par rtog pa rnams thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir khyab byed med pa la khyab @36b bya mi srid pas de kho na nyid du na dngos po dang dngos po med par mchog tu
translated: Since the conceptual thoughts of thing and nonthing pervade all conceptual thoughts, the pervaded is not possible without the pervader. Therefore, in reality, since one is free from the extreme grasping at thing and nonthing,

original: 'dzin pa dang bral bas /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang bral bas /
translated: one is free from the extreme of existence and nonexistence.

original: ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i dngos po 'di rnams la shes rab kyi sbyin gyis brtags na nang dang phyi rol gyi snying po dang bral bas gang du bsgoms pa'i stobs rdzogs pas skyon thams cad bkag nas bdag med pa mthong ba mngon sum du gyur nas de
analyzed: ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i dngos po 'di rnams la shes rab kyi sbyin gyis brtags na nang dang phyi rol gyi snying po dang bral bas gang du bsgoms pa'i stobs rdzogs pas skyon thams cad bkag nas bdag med pa mthong ba mngon sum du gyur nas de
translated: Therefore, when the power of meditation is perfected, all faults are stopped, and the direct perception of the vision of selflessness arises.

original: dang 'gal ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur te /üîΩ'dir 'ching ba med pas sprin dang bral ba'i nyi ma'i 'od zer bzhin du nam mkha'i mtha' klas par rten cing 'brel pa las las 'byung ba'i dngos po don dam par skye ba la sogs pa'i brtags pa dang bral ba'i rgyun mi 'chad pa rnal 'byor pa'i mngon
analyzed: dang 'gal ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur te / 'dir 'ching ba med pas sprin dang bral ba'i nyi ma'i 'od zer bzhin du nam mkha'i mtha' klas par rten cing 'brel pa las las 'byung ba'i dngos po don dam par skye ba la sogs pa'i brtags pa dang bral ba'i rgyun mi 'chad pa rnal 'byor pa'i mngon
translated: Because of that, the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience are abandoned.

original: sum gyi snying rjes dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi kun rdzob pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba yang dag par skye la /
analyzed: sum gyi snying rjes dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi kun rdzob pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba yang dag par skye la /
translated: Here, because there are no bonds, like the sun‚Äôs rays free from clouds, the yogi‚Äôs direct perception of the compassion that arises from dependent origination and the appearance of the conventional pristine consciousness that is the nature of wisdom arise perfectly in the uninterrupted continuum of things that are free from the imputations of ultimate production and so on throughout the limits of space.

original: 'di nyid de kho na nyid mthong ba ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid de kho na nyid mthong ba ste /
translated: This is the vision of reality.

original: gang du shes rab kyis brtags pa na chos thams cad mi mthong gi //
analyzed: gang du shes rab kyis brtags pa na chos thams cad mi mthong gi //
translated: When one examines with wisdom, one does not see any phenomena.

original: gang du yid la byed pa dang / gnyid log pa'am mig btsums pa bzhin gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du yid la byed pa dang / gnyid log pa'am mig btsums pa bzhin gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not like the state of being inattentive, asleep, or with eyes closed.

original: de lta bu'i bag chags ma spangs na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bag chags ma spangs na /
translated: If one does not eliminate the residual impressions in this way,

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pas langs pa nyid na /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pas langs pa nyid na /
translated: then when one rises from the attainment of nonperception, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba can gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams skye bar 'gyur bas rnal 'byor pa grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba can gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams skye bar 'gyur bas rnal 'byor pa grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: attachment, etc., which have form, etc. as their roots, will be produced, and the yogi will not be liberated.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi the tshom spangs pa med na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi the tshom spangs pa med na /
translated: If one does not eliminate doubt about objects such as form,

original: de'i yid la byed pa spong bar mi nus te /
analyzed: de'i yid la byed pa spong bar mi nus te /
translated: one will not be able to eliminate the attention to them,

original: sreg byed yongs su ma spangs par sreg pa yongs su mi spong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sreg byed yongs su ma spangs par sreg pa yongs su mi spong ba bzhin no //
translated: just as one cannot eliminate being burned if one does not eliminate the fire.

original: de'i phyir na ji skad du bshad pa'i mthong ba med pa'i sbyor ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas the tshom gyi sa bon dang bral ba nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na ji skad du bshad pa'i mthong ba med pa'i sbyor ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas the tshom gyi sa bon dang bral ba nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa bsal bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, by cultivating the perfection of wisdom of the application of nonseeing as it has been explained, one should eliminate the clinging to form and so on by being free from the seeds of doubt.

original: de ltar yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis dpyad pas the tshom dang ldan pa de dang bral nas gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang bral bas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rtogs la de nyid shes
analyzed: de ltar yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis dpyad pas the tshom dang ldan pa de dang bral nas gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang bral bas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rtogs la de nyid shes
translated: Thus, having been free from doubt by analyzing things and nonthings and so on, one should eliminate clinging to form and so on. By being free from clinging, one realizes that all phenomena are essenceless.

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes snga nas bshad do //
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes snga nas bshad do //
translated: That is the perfection of wisdom, as explained earlier.

original: 'dir chos thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid ni sgrib pa thams cad @37a * //
analyzed: 'dir chos thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid ni sgrib pa thams cad @37a * //
translated: Here, the supreme object is the emptiness of all phenomena, which is the supreme object of meditation.

original: spangs pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs par byed pa lam gyi mchog ste /
analyzed: spangs pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs par byed pa lam gyi mchog ste /
translated: The supreme path is the perfection of wisdom, which is the supreme path for eliminating all obscurations and realizing omniscience.

original: de nyid kyis na 'dis mngon par 'dod pa thams cad nye bar bsgrubs bas 'phags pa rab 'byor la 'thad pa nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na 'dis mngon par 'dod pa thams cad nye bar bsgrubs bas 'phags pa rab 'byor la 'thad pa nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: Since that is so, since all that is desired is accomplished by this, it is the proper teaching for the noble Subh≈´ti.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal zhes pa ni rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la /
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal zhes pa ni rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la /
translated: The mind is luminous by nature means that the nature is the absence of inherent nature by its very nature.

original: 'od gsal ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid la glo bur ba'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu brtags pa'i mun pa mtha' dag nub pa ste /üîΩ'dir mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang tha mi dad pa'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bo sems la don dam par ngo bo nyid med pas sems ma mchis zhes pa'i ma yin par dgag pa dang med par dgag pa ste /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid la glo bur ba'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu brtags pa'i mun pa mtha' dag nub pa ste / 'dir mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang tha mi dad pa'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bo sems la don dam par ngo bo nyid med pas sems ma mchis zhes pa'i ma yin par dgag pa dang med par dgag pa ste /
translated: Luminous means that in its nature, all the darkness of adventitious, unreal, imagined obscurations has subsided.üîΩHere, the mind, which is the nature of the relative that is not different from the aspects of nonattachment and so on, is said to be nonexistent ultimately because it lacks inherent nature. This is an implicative negation and an existential negation.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa la don dam par don yod pa min zhes pa nyid tsam la yid rjes su gnas pas phyin ci log bar mthong nas smras pa ni yod dam zhes pa ste ;
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa la don dam par don yod pa min zhes pa nyid tsam la yid rjes su gnas pas phyin ci log bar mthong nas smras pa ni yod dam zhes pa ste ;
translated: Since the mind is said to exist conventionally and not to exist ultimately, the mind is said to be nonexistent.

original: rigs pas dngos po med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rigs pas dngos po med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of the nonexistence of entities by reason.

original: ma yin par dgag pa'i sbyor ba min gyi 'on kyang med par dgag pa la ste /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa'i sbyor ba min gyi 'on kyang med par dgag pa la ste /
translated: It is not a nonaffirming negation, but rather an affirming negation.

original: de la yang yod pa dang med pa tsam du btags pa yang yod pa min zhes pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa ni ci yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la yang yod pa dang med pa tsam du btags pa yang yod pa min zhes pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa ni ci yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the mere designation of existence and nonexistence does not exist.

original: sems ni dngos po tsam la sems med pa ni de'i dngos po'i sems med pa nyid de /
analyzed: sems ni dngos po tsam la sems med pa ni de'i dngos po'i sems med pa nyid de /
translated: The mind is the mere entity of the mind. The nonexistence of the mind in that entity is the nonexistence of the mind in that entity.

original: de la brjod pa ni med ces pa ste /
analyzed: de la brjod pa ni med ces pa ste /
translated: The statement about that is ‚Äúnonexistent.‚Äù

original: 'di brjod ma thag pa'i gnyi ga'i yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du mi dmigs pa ste sgrub pa po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di brjod ma thag pa'i gnyi ga'i yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du mi dmigs pa ste sgrub pa po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the nonapprehension of the existence and nonexistence of both, which were just mentioned, because the proponent does not exist.

original: med pa ni gnod byed dam pa yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: med pa ni gnod byed dam pa yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Nonexistence is the supreme refutation because existence is refuted.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir zhes pa de la dgongs nas slar dri zhing rgol ba la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir zhes pa de la dgongs nas slar dri zhing rgol ba la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Because of the complete transcendence of both entity and nonentity, this is the intention of the statement, ‚ÄúIt is not this, not that.‚Äù

original: sems med ces pa ni sems dngos po med pa tsam nyid mngon par 'dod pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sems med ces pa ni sems dngos po med pa tsam nyid mngon par 'dod pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthere is no mind‚Äù is intended to indicate the mere non-existence of a substantial mind.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bos yod pa'i sgro btags pa ni mi rigs pa nyid la /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bos yod pa'i sgro btags pa ni mi rigs pa nyid la /
translated: It is unreasonable to superimpose existence on the nature of existence and non-existence.

original: sems chos can gyi yul med pa nyid la dgag pa'i sbyor ba med pas /
analyzed: sems chos can gyi yul med pa nyid la dgag pa'i sbyor ba med pas /
