original: ting nge 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa ni rnam pa'o //

original: de la gsungs pa ni de skad ces gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la gsungs pa ni de skad ces gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

original: byang chub ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dam par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dam par rtogs pa ste /
translated: Enlightenment is the ultimate realization of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nyid la sems pa ni 'dir de'i bdag nyid kyis so zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la sems pa ni 'dir de'i bdag nyid kyis so zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'o //

original: rang bzhin gyis ting nge 'dzin che ba de nyid 'dis sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ting nge 'dzin che ba de nyid 'dis sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ste /
translated: That very greatness of meditative concentration by nature is here a bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this is the section on the bodhisattva.

original: 'dir 'di gsum gyi ngo bo gcig pa ni dmigs pa la nus sam zhes pa la sogs pas rnam pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir 'di gsum gyi ngo bo gcig pa ni dmigs pa la nus sam zhes pa la sogs pas rnam pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, the single essence of these three is stated by ‚ÄúIs it able to apprehend an object?‚Äù and so on.

original: bstan par zhes pa ni tshig gis gsal bar zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bstan par zhes pa ni tshig gis gsal bar zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Is taught‚Äù means is clarified by words.

original: mi shes par ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pas mi snang zhing rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes par ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pas mi snang zhing rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Not known‚Äù means not appearing and not conceptualized because of ultimately lacking an essence.

analyzed: yang dag par mi shes pa ni brjod du med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Not perfectly known‚Äù means inexpressible and nonconceptual.

original: 'dir nye bar bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir nye bar bsdu ba ni /
translated: Here, the summary is:

original: de ltar nges 'byed cha mthun ni //
analyzed: de ltar nges 'byed cha mthun ni //
translated: Thus the factors conducive to penetrative insight

original: chung ngu 'bring dang chen po yin //
analyzed: chung ngu 'bring dang chen po yin //
translated: are small, middling, and great.

original: zhes pas so //
analyzed: zhes pas so //
translated: Thus it is.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs @44a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs @44a * //
translated: The afflictions of the bodhisattva are conceptualizations.üîΩThus the treatise states:

original: pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o zhes pas rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa'i dbang du bya ba ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o zhes pas rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa'i dbang du bya ba ni bstan bcos las /
translated: The two types of conceptions of apprehended objects

original: gzhi dang de yi gnyen po yis //üîΩgzung bar rtog pa rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: gzhi dang de yi gnyen po yis //üîΩgzung bar rtog pa rnam pa gnyis //
translated: are the basis and its antidote.

original: rmongs dang phung sogs bye brag gis //
analyzed: rmongs dang phung sogs bye brag gis //
translated: 9. The nine aspects are due to the distinctions of delusion, the aggregates, etc.

original: rnam pa dgu zhes te /üîΩgzung byar rnam par rtog pas na gzung pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu zhes te / gzung byar rnam par rtog pas na gzung pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The nine aspects are due to the distinctions of delusion, the aggregates, etc.üîΩThe imagination of what is unreal is twofold, as the imagination of the apprehended and the imagination of the apprehender.üîΩThe imagination of the apprehended is of six kinds: the imagination of the basis, the imagination of the two extremes, the imagination of name and form, the imagination of defilement and purification, the imagination of the non-abiding in the noble path, and the imagination of the non-abiding in the path.

original: gcig ni gzhi'i rnam par rtog pa ste ma rig pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dang / mtha' gnyis dang / ming dang gzugs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa dang /üîΩlam du nye bar dmigs pa dang / bdag tu nye bar dmigs pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i rtog pa'i bdag nyid na ni 'jig rten las grags pas yin la /
analyzed: gcig ni gzhi'i rnam par rtog pa ste ma rig pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dang / mtha' gnyis dang / ming dang gzugs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa dang /üîΩlam du nye bar dmigs pa dang / bdag tu nye bar dmigs pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i rtog pa'i bdag nyid na ni 'jig rten las grags pas yin la /
translated: The imagination of the basis is due to the non-abiding in the aggregates of form, etc. which are the objects of the nescience that is the imagination of what is unreal. The imagination of the two extremes is due to the non-abiding in the two extremes of existence and non-existence. The imagination of name and form is due to the non-abiding in name and form. The imagination of defilement and purification is due to the non-abiding in defilement and purification. The imagination of the non-abiding in the noble path is due to the non-abiding in the noble path. The imagination of the non-abiding in the path is due to the non-abiding in the path. The imagination of the self is due to the non-abiding in the self. The imagination of the pure is due to the non-abiding in the pure.üîΩThe imagination of the apprehended is due to the non-abiding in the aggregates, etc. which are the objects of the nescience that is the imagination of what is unreal. The imagination of the two extremes is due to the non-abiding in the two extremes of existence and non-existence. The imagination of name and form is due to the non-abiding in name and form. The imagination of defilement and purification is due to the non-abiding in defilement and purification. The imagination of the non-abiding in the noble path is due to the non-abiding in the noble path. The imagination of the non-abiding in the path is due to the non-abiding in the path. The imagination of the self is due to the non-abiding in the self. The imagination of the pure is due to the non-abiding in the pure.

original: gnyis pa de'i gnyen po'i phyogs ni phung po dang / sgo gang dang / rigs dang / skye ba la sogs pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyis rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa de'i gnyen po'i phyogs ni phung po dang / sgo gang dang / rigs dang / skye ba la sogs pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyis rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The second, the antidote to that, is the entity of the conceptualization of the aggregates, the sense spheres, the elements, birth, and so on, emptiness, the perfections, the path of seeing, the path of meditation, and the path of no more learning.

original: 'di rnams de nas tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni go skabs phye ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la yang sh'a ri'i bus de nyid bstan pa'i don du gsol ba la sh'a ri'i bu la gsal bar 'dod nas gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams de nas tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni go skabs phye ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la yang sh'a ri'i bus de nyid bstan pa'i don du gsol ba la sh'a ri'i bu la gsal bar 'dod nas gsungs pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúThen the venerable ≈öƒÅriputra‚Äù is the opportunity given to ≈öƒÅriputra, and the request by ≈öƒÅriputra to the BhagavƒÅn to teach the meaning of that is spoken for the sake of clarifying it to ≈öƒÅriputra.

original: chos 'di gang gi yin zhes pa ni ci rdzas dang yon tan dang / las dang gtso bo dang skyes bu la sogs pa'i 'am /
analyzed: chos 'di gang gi yin zhes pa ni ci rdzas dang yon tan dang / las dang gtso bo dang skyes bu la sogs pa'i 'am /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto whom does this dharma belong?‚Äù means ‚Äúdoes it belong to substance, quality, action, principle, puru·π£a, and so on,

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i ste /üîΩde la dmigs nas slob pa'i phyir //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i ste / de la dmigs nas slob pa'i phyir //
translated: or to the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on?‚Äù

original: zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that it is because they focus on that that they are learners.

original: gang du'ang min zhes pa ni chos thams cad la bdag med pa nyid la slob pas so zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang du'ang min zhes pa ni chos thams cad la bdag med pa nyid la slob pas so zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot in any way‚Äù is that one should train in the selflessness of all phenomena.

original: de zhes pa ni chos thams cad la mi slob ste rdzas la sogs pa dang gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de zhes pa ni chos thams cad la mi slob ste rdzas la sogs pa dang gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù means that one should not train in all phenomena, but in substances and so on and in the aggregates of form and so on.

original: de ltar ni de'i ngo bo nyid kyis te /
analyzed: de ltar ni de'i ngo bo nyid kyis te /
translated: ‚Äú In that way‚Äù means by their nature.

original: ji ltar ni gang gi ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa med par bden pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ni gang gi ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa med par bden pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú How?‚Äù means that it is true that one should not cling to their nature.

original: so so'i skye bo ni 'phags pa ma thob pa rnams so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni 'phags pa ma thob pa rnams so //
translated: ‚Äú Ordinary beings‚Äù are those who have not attained the ƒÅrya stage.

original: de yang byis par gyur pa'i gang du thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni mang du thos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang byis par gyur pa'i gang du thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni mang du thos pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú They‚Äù are the childish who have not obtained much hearing, that is, who do not have much hearing.

original: yod pa min pa ni don dam par yod pa min pa @44b ste /
analyzed: yod pa min pa ni don dam par yod pa min pa @44b ste /
translated: ‚Äú Not existent‚Äù means not ultimately existent.

original: gnod pa yod pas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnod pa yod pas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are undermined.

original: de ltar yod ces pa ni kun rdzob tu sgra don gyi ngo bos yod ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar yod ces pa ni kun rdzob tu sgra don gyi ngo bos yod ces pa'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú In that way‚Äù means that they exist by the nature of the entity of the term and its meaning conventionally.

original: mi rigs zhes pa ni yul med pa'i phyir mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: mi rigs zhes pa ni yul med pa'i phyir mi rigs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú It is not reasonable‚Äù means that it is not reasonable because there is no object.

original: de ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa de'i yul du rnam par rtog pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa de'i yul du rnam par rtog pa bstan pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ni ma rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'o //

original: chos thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll phenomena‚Äù refers to the aggregates, etc.

original: brtag ces pa ni dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: brtag ces pa ni dngos po nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúConceptualization‚Äù refers to the entities.

original: gzung bar zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung por rnam par rtog pas so //
analyzed: gzung bar zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung por rnam par rtog pas so //

original: mtha' gnyis zhes pa ni skye ba dang 'gag pa dag go //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis zhes pa ni skye ba dang 'gag pa dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThe two extremes‚Äù refers to arising and cessation.

original: mi shes zhes pa ni sbyor ba'i lam ma thob pas de kho na nyid du mi nges pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes zhes pa ni sbyor ba'i lam ma thob pas de kho na nyid du mi nges pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIgnorance‚Äù refers to the lack of certainty in reality due to not having attained the path of application.

original: ma thob pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ma rtogs pas so //üîΩde'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: ma thob pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ma rtogs pas so // de'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa nas /

original: mngon par zhen par mi byed ces pa'i bar gyis ni nye bar bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par zhen par mi byed ces pa'i bar gyis ni nye bar bsdu ba ste /

analyzed: de dag gis ni mtha' gnyis la zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: By those, there is the conceptualization of attachment to the two extremes.

original: mngon par zhen zhes pa ni gnyis dang ldan pa ste de'i nges pa dang de'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen zhes pa ni gnyis dang ldan pa ste de'i nges pa dang de'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: The phrase manifesting attachment means being endowed with duality, which is its determination and its root.

original: nye bar dmigs pa ni log pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa ni log pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase perceiving means false knowledge.

original: ming ni gzugs med pa'i phung po rnams la gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: ming ni gzugs med pa'i phung po rnams la gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po ste /
translated: Name refers to the aggregates that are formless. Form refers to the aggregate of form.

original: de gnyis ni ming dang gzugs te phung po lnga rnams so //
analyzed: de gnyis ni ming dang gzugs te phung po lnga rnams so //
translated: These two are name-and-form, which is the five aggregates.

original: 'di ni ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: This is the conceptualization of manifesting attachment to name-and-form.

original: lnga po ni gzhan rnams la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lnga po ni gzhan rnams la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: The five should be understood in the same way for the others.

original: 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is form, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la 'di ni rnam par byang ba nyid ces pa mi shes shing mi mthong nas khams gsum dang theg pa dman pa las nges par mi 'byung ba'o zhes pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mi shes pa'i rnamüîΩpar rtog pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la 'di ni rnam par byang ba nyid ces pa mi shes shing mi mthong nas khams gsum dang theg pa dman pa las nges par mi 'byung ba'o zhes pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mi shes pa'i rnamüîΩpar rtog pa'o //
translated: When one does not know and does not see that this is afflicted and that this is purified, one does not go forth from the three realms and the Lesser Vehicle. This is the conceptualization of not knowing affliction and purification.

original: de stong pa nyid la dad pa mi skyed cing pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams la gnas par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni 'phags pa'i lam la rab tu mi gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de stong pa nyid la dad pa mi skyed cing pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams la gnas par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni 'phags pa'i lam la rab tu mi gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: He does not generate faith in emptiness, and he does not abide in the perfections, etc. This is the conception of not abiding in the noble path.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dmigs par byed pas nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes pa ni lam nye bar dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dmigs par byed pas nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes pa ni lam nye bar dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: He does not become liberated by objectifying the perfections, etc. This is the conception of the objectification of the path.

original: de bdag dang chos su nye bar @45a * //
analyzed: de bdag dang chos su nye bar @45a * //
translated: He objectifies self and phenomena.

original: dmigs pa la zhes pa ni bdag la sogs pa nye bar dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la zhes pa ni bdag la sogs pa nye bar dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conception of the objectification of self, etc.

original: ma skyes pa dang ma byung ba dang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni rnam par dag pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste dgu pa'o /
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma byung ba dang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni rnam par dag pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste dgu pa'o /
translated: He objectifies non-production, non-arising, the absence of conditioning, and purification. This is the conception of purification.

original: // / rnam par rtog pa de rnams drod kyis bsrabs par byed cing rab tu spong bar ni mi byed de /
analyzed: // / rnam par rtog pa de rnams drod kyis bsrabs par byed cing rab tu spong bar ni mi byed de /
translated: These conceptions are thinned out by heat, but they are not completely abandoned.

original: de'i phyir de rnams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he possesses them.

original: de'i yang rnam par rtog pa'i mun pa bsrabs pa'i phyir na snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i yang rnam par rtog pa'i mun pa bsrabs pa'i phyir na snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Also, because the darkness of conceptuality is thinned out, it is said to be ‚Äúthe meditative stabilization of attaining light.‚Äù

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i dgu pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i dgu pa'o //
translated: This is the ninth conception of the apprehended.

original: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa ni /
translated: The explanation from the perspective of the second is:

original: de dag gi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù and so forth.

original: chos thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are the aggregates and so forth.

original: chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni /
translated: All phenomena areüîΩinvestigated in the aggregates and so forth.

original: phung po la sogs pa la brtags pa ni /üîΩphung po la sogs pa las bye brag gis zhes pa ste /üîΩphung po la sogs par brtags pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa dgu ste /üîΩde la gzugs su brtag pa byed pas mngon par zhen pa dang / 'gyur zhing ji srid du rnam par shes pa'i bar zhes pa ni phung po'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa'o//
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa la brtags pa ni / phung po la sogs pa las bye brag gis zhes pa ste / phung po la sogs par brtags pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa dgu ste / de la gzugs su brtag pa byed pas mngon par zhen pa dang / 'gyur zhing ji srid du rnam par shes pa'i bar zhes pa ni phung po'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa'o//
translated: The aggregates and so forth are differentiated.üîΩThere are nine types of conceptions of the aggregates and so forth that are investigated in the aggregates and so forth.

original: mig tu rtog par byed ces pa nas /
analyzed: mig tu rtog par byed ces pa nas /
translated: Among them, the conception of the aggregates is the conception of form and so forth, the conception of the sense spheres is the conception of the eye and so forth, the conception of the sources is the conception of the eye and so forth, the conception of dependent arising is the conception of ignorance and so forth, the conception of time is the conception of the past and so forth, the conception of truth is the conception of the truths of suffering and so forth, the conception of the four fruits is the conception of the fruit of stream enterer and so forth, the conception of the four pairs is the conception of the pair of those who have one more interval and so forth, and the conception of the nine serial absorptions is the conception of the first concentration and so forth.üîΩThe conception of the aggregates is the conception of form and so forth, the conception of the sense spheres is the conception of the eye and so forth, the conception of the sources is the conception of the eye and so forth, the conception of dependent arising is the conception of ignorance and so forth, the conception of time is the conception of the past and so forth, the conception of truth is the conception of the truths of suffering and so forth, the conception of the four fruits is the conception of the fruit of stream enterer and so forth, the conception of the four pairs is the conception of the pair of those who have one more interval and so forth, and the conception of the nine serial absorptions is the conception of the first concentration and so forth.

original: ji srid du chos zhes pa'i bar ni skye ba'i sgo'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du chos zhes pa'i bar ni skye ba'i sgo'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Up to the term ‚Äúdharmas‚Äù is the conceptualization of the meaning of the door of production.

original: mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes pa nas /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes pa nas /
translated: The elements of eye, form, and eye consciousness, up to

original: ji srid du yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang chos kyi khams zhes pa'i bar ni rigs kyi don gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang chos kyi khams zhes pa'i bar ni rigs kyi don gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: the elements of mind, mental consciousness, and dharmas is the conceptualization of the meaning of lineage.

original: ma rig pa nas ji srid du rga shi zhes pa'i bar ni skye ba'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa nas ji srid du rga shi zhes pa'i bar ni skye ba'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: From ignorance up to old age and death is the conceptualization of the meaning of production.

original: nang stong pa nyid ces pa nas /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid ces pa nas /
translated: Inner emptiness up to

original: ji srid du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces pa'i bar ni stong pa nyid kyi don gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces pa'i bar ni stong pa nyid kyi don gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities is the conceptualization of the meaning of emptiness.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug ces pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug ces pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The six perfections is the conceptualization of the meaning of the perfections.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zhes pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zhes pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment is the conceptualization of the path of seeing.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug ces pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //üîΩ@45b de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu zhes pa nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug ces pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o // @45b de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu zhes pa nas /
translated: The phrase one enters into the meditative absorptions of the formless realm is a conceptual thought that pertains to the path of meditation.

original: ji srid du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces pa'i bar ni mi slob pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces pa'i bar ni mi slob pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The phrase the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas up to the knowledge of all aspects is a conceptual thought that pertains to the path of no more learning.

original: lam zhes pa ni bdag med pa'i shes pa la /
analyzed: lam zhes pa ni bdag med pa'i shes pa la /
translated: The word path refers to the knowledge of no-self.

original: yang dag pa ni de kho na nyid la /
analyzed: yang dag pa ni de kho na nyid la /
translated: The word reality refers to reality itself.

original: de dag gi mtha' ni rtse mo dang spyi bo ste /üîΩde yang lhag pa'i de kho na nyid med de /
analyzed: de dag gi mtha' ni rtse mo dang spyi bo ste / de yang lhag pa'i de kho na nyid med de /
translated: The word end refers to the peak and the summit.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni stong pa nyid ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni stong pa nyid ces pa'i don to //
translated: Moreover, there is no higher reality than that, because the end of reality means emptiness.

original: grangs su bgrang ba'i rnam par rtog pa dgu po 'di rnams ni rtse mos bsrabs par byed cing rab tu spang bar ni mi byed do //
analyzed: grangs su bgrang ba'i rnam par rtog pa dgu po 'di rnams ni rtse mos bsrabs par byed cing rab tu spang bar ni mi byed do //
translated: These nine conceptual thoughts that are counted are thinned out by the peak but are not completely abandoned.

original: 'di rnams dang ldan pas sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa rnam pa dgu po rab tu spong ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'di rnams dang ldan pas sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa rnam pa dgu po rab tu spong ba nyid de /
translated: Endowed with these, one abandons the nine kinds of discrimination that are preliminary to the path of insight.

original: spangs la yang 'dir phyi ma'i gnyis po dang phra mor kun tu rgyu bas so //
analyzed: spangs la yang 'dir phyi ma'i gnyis po dang phra mor kun tu rgyu bas so //
translated: And although they are abandoned, they are still called discriminations because they are subtle and still occur.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni yod pa ma yin la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni yod pa ma yin la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir la /
translated: The discriminations do not exist, but they are called discriminations because they are the objects of discrimination.

original: rnam pa thams cad du spong ba ni mthong ba'i lam la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du spong ba ni mthong ba'i lam la rig par bya'o //
translated: And the complete abandonment of these discriminations should be understood as occurring on the path of insight.

original: des snang ba 'phel ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas par 'gyur zhes pa ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i rnam pa dgu pa'i bshad pa'o //üîΩrdzas dang btags pa'i rten can gyis //
analyzed: des snang ba 'phel ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas par 'gyur zhes pa ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i rnam pa dgu pa'i bshad pa'o // rdzas dang btags pa'i rten can gyis //
translated: By that, one comes to abide in the concentration of the increase of light. This is the explanation of the ninth kind of discrimination of the second object.üîΩThe second kind of discrimination of the object is held to be twofold,

original: 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //
analyzed: 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //
translated: based on the real and the nominal.

original: ces pa ni rten la dmigs pa ste /üîΩrdzas la brten pa dang btags pa la brten pa'i zhes pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ces pa ni rten la dmigs pa ste / rdzas la brten pa dang btags pa la brten pa'i zhes pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is the objective reference to the basis.üîΩThe discrimination of the object as subject is twofold, based on the real and based on the nominal.

original: 'dzin pas rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pas rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called discrimination of the object as subject because it is the object of the discrimination of the subject.

original: de yang go rims ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: de yang go rims ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Moreover, they are to be connected in the following order:

original: rang dbang bdag sogs ngo bo yis //
analyzed: rang dbang bdag sogs ngo bo yis //
translated: By way of the nature of self-mastery, etc.

original: phung sogs rten la de bzhin du //üîΩde ni so sor rnam pa dgu //
analyzed: phung sogs rten la de bzhin du // de ni so sor rnam pa dgu //
translated: In the same way, in the aggregates, etc., the bases.

original: zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes sbyar te /
translated: That is the individual nine aspects.

original: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni de dag bden pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni de dag bden pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the statement from the viewpoint of the first is: ‚ÄúThose are true, etc.

original: dam pa yang dag pa'i don bstan pa rnam par mthong bar ma gyur nas bdag nyid kyis 'di lta bu'i rnam pa dgur rtogs par byed nas mngon par zhen par byed cing bdag nyid nye bar dmigs par byed do //
analyzed: dam pa yang dag pa'i don bstan pa rnam par mthong bar ma gyur nas bdag nyid kyis 'di lta bu'i rnam pa dgur rtogs par byed nas mngon par zhen par byed cing bdag nyid nye bar dmigs par byed do //
translated: ‚Äù When one does not see the teaching of the ultimate truth, one conceives of it in these nine aspects and becomes attached to it, and one conceives of the self.

original: 'dir nye bar mi dmigs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa dgu ste /
analyzed: 'dir nye bar mi dmigs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa dgu ste /
translated: Here, the nine aspects of the counteragent are not conceived.

original: bdag dang sems can dang zhes pa nas ji srid du mthong ba por nye bar mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can dang zhes pa nas ji srid du mthong ba por nye bar mi dmigs te /
translated: From ‚Äúself and sentient being‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe seer is not conceived‚Äù

original: de shin tu med pa'i phyir zhes pa'i bar ni rang dbang gi bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de shin tu med pa'i phyir zhes pa'i bar ni rang dbang gi bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: is the conception of self-mastery.

original: gzugs zhes pa nas @46a * //
analyzed: gzugs zhes pa nas @46a * //
translated: ‚ÄúForm‚Äù and so on.üîΩ

original: ji srid du rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis dmigs su med ces pa'i bar ni gcig gi bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis dmigs su med ces pa'i bar ni gcig gi bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The passage from ‚Äúform‚Äù up to ‚Äúare not apprehended by the nature of consciousness‚Äù is the conceptualization of a single nature.

original: mig nas ji srid du yid kyi bar dang gzugs nas ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bdag nyid gcig gis dmigs su med ces pa'i bar ni rgyu'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mig nas ji srid du yid kyi bar dang gzugs nas ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bdag nyid gcig gis dmigs su med ces pa'i bar ni rgyu'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The passage from ‚Äúthe eye‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe mind‚Äù and from ‚Äúform‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe qualities of the Buddha‚Äù are not apprehended by a single nature is the conceptualization of the nature of a cause.

original: mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes pa nas ji srid du yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang gzhan pa'i bdag nyid kyis dmigs su med ces pa'i bar ni lta ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes pa nas ji srid du yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang gzhan pa'i bdag nyid kyis dmigs su med ces pa'i bar ni lta ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o
translated: The passage from ‚Äúthe eye, form, and eye consciousness‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe mind, phenomena, and mind consciousness‚Äù are not apprehended by a different nature is the conceptualization of the nature of seeing and so on.

original: // rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes pa nas ji srid du gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bdag nyid kyi rten du dmigs su med ces pa'i bar ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten gyi bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //üîΩbsam gtan dang po nas ji srid du gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi rten nyid kyis nye bar mi dmigs zhes pa'i bar ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rten gyi bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: // rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes pa nas ji srid du gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bdag nyid kyi rten du dmigs su med ces pa'i bar ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten gyi bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o // bsam gtan dang po nas ji srid du gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi rten nyid kyis nye bar mi dmigs zhes pa'i bar ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rten gyi bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The passage from ‚Äúdependent origination‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe selflessness of the realm of form‚Äù is the conceptual differentiation of the self of the basis of defilement.üîΩThe passage from ‚Äúthe first concentration‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe selflessness of the formless meditative concentrations‚Äù is the conceptual differentiation of the self of the basis of purification.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang gzhan pa'i bdag nyid kyi rten gyis nye bar mi dmigs pa zhes pa ni mthong ba la brten pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang gzhan pa'i bdag nyid kyi rten gyis nye bar mi dmigs pa zhes pa ni mthong ba la brten pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The passage from ‚Äúthe noble truths‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe selflessness of the basis of vision‚Äù is the conceptual differentiation of the self of the basis of vision.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i bdag nyid kyis nye bar mi dmigs pa zhes pa ni bsgom pa la brten pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i bdag nyid kyis nye bar mi dmigs pa zhes pa ni bsgom pa la brten pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe eight liberations and the nine serial absorptions are not apprehended‚Äù is the conception of the nature of meditation.

original: stobs bcu nas ji srid du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi rten gyis nye bar dmigs su med ces pa'i bar ni don byas pa nyid la brten pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: stobs bcu nas ji srid du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi rten gyis nye bar dmigs su med ces pa'i bar ni don byas pa nyid la brten pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe ten powers up to the nature of omniscience are not apprehended‚Äù is the conception of the nature of the benefit of others.

original: dgu po 'di rnams ni bzod pas bsrabs par byed cing spong ba ni mi byed do //
analyzed: dgu po 'di rnams ni bzod pas bsrabs par byed cing spong ba ni mi byed do //
translated: These nine conceptions are reduced by the path of patience but are not abandoned.

original: 'dir 'di rnams dang ldan pas sngon du 'gro bar rab tu spong ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'di rnams dang ldan pas sngon du 'gro bar rab tu spong ba kho na'o //
translated: Here, they are preceded by the possession of these and are only thoroughly abandoned.

original: de'i rjes la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la /
translated: After that,

original: gzung ba med par nges pa'i rtse gcig par nges pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi don gyi phyogs gcig la rab tu zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa sh'a ri'i bus ched du gnyer nas 'di snyam du bsams nas gal te thams cad shes pa nyid
analyzed: gzung ba med par nges pa'i rtse gcig par nges pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi don gyi phyogs gcig la rab tu zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa sh'a ri'i bus ched du gnyer nas 'di snyam du bsams nas gal te thams cad shes pa nyid
translated: Because of being ascertained as one-pointedness without apprehended objects, Shariputra, who abides in samadhi that has entered one aspect of the meaning of thatness, deliberately thinks this: ‚ÄúIf all phenomena are unarisen and unceasing,üîΩ

original: la slob na de rnams la ji ltar mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: la slob na de rnams la ji ltar mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Because of the certainty of the one-pointedness of the non-existence of the apprehended, abiding in the concentration of the engagement in one aspect of the meaning of thatness, Shariputra, having deliberately thought this, thought, ‚ÄúIf I train in the knowledge of all aspects, how do I not apprehend those?‚Äù

original: slob par mi byed ces pa @46b ni dmigs pa'i sbyor ba zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: slob par mi byed ces pa @46b ni dmigs pa'i sbyor ba zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI do not train‚Äù means that he does not train in the application of apprehension.

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas chos thams cad dang sa thams cad thob pa dang / yon tan rnams la nye bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa thob pa'i phyir de ltar bshad pa ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i dgu pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas chos thams cad dang sa thams cad thob pa dang / yon tan rnams la nye bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa thob pa'i phyir de ltar bshad pa ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'i dgu pa'o //
translated: Thus, by the application of non-apprehension, he obtains all phenomena and all levels, and because he obtains the supramundane level of the qualities that are conducive to merit, it is explained in that way. This is the ninth conception of apprehension.

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'dir 'dri bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'dir 'dri bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Then again, etc. means that he wishes to ask about this.

original: 'dir chos kyi mchog la byang chub sems dpas sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du de ltar byang chub la slob par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'dir chos kyi mchog la byang chub sems dpas sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du de ltar byang chub la slob par 'gyur na /
translated: Here, if a bodhisattva were to train in enlightenment in that way, like an illusory person,

original: de ltar na ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu yang slob par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu yang slob par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: then an illusory person would also train.

original: des na zhes pa ni gang gis 'dir sgyu ma'i skyes bu nyid du mi 'dod pa ste rgyu mtshan des na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes pa ni gang gis 'dir sgyu ma'i skyes bu nyid du mi 'dod pa ste rgyu mtshan des na'o //
translated: Therefore means that because of that reason, one does not assert that here an illusory person exists.

original: yang na tshig gi rgyan te /
analyzed: yang na tshig gi rgyan te /
translated: Or it is an ornament of speech.

original: ltar nyan pa ni khas blangs so //
analyzed: ltar nyan pa ni khas blangs so //
translated: Listen means to accept.

original: 'di zhes pa ni ngag nye bar dgod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni ngag nye bar dgod pa'o //
translated: This means to introduce the topic.üîΩAre the aggregates also one thing and the illusion another?üîΩThe illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.

original: de ci phung po yang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhes pa ni slar 'dri ba'i don no //
analyzed: de ci phung po yang gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan zhes pa ni slar 'dri ba'i don no //
translated: The meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.

original: sgyu ma nyid phung po la zhes pa ni rab 'byor gyi lan gyi don to //üîΩgang zhig gi don sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa bzhin med pa nyid du grags te /üîΩde ci'i 'dir sgyu ma'i sgra'i don to //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid phung po la zhes pa ni rab 'byor gyi lan gyi don to // gang zhig gi don sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa bzhin med pa nyid du grags te / de ci'i 'dir sgyu ma'i sgra'i don to //
translated: The meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.

original: de'i phyir na sgyu ma nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sgyu ma nyid du bshad do //
translated: The meaning of that is that the illusion itself is the aggregates.

original: sgyu ma'i don bshad nas skyes bu'i don gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i don bshad nas skyes bu'i don gsungs pa ni /
translated: Having explained the meaning of ‚Äúillusion,‚Äù he states the meaning of ‚Äúperson‚Äù:

original: 'di dag ces pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ces pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThese‚Äù refers to the five aggregates.

original: khyad par shes pa ni ming ste /
analyzed: khyad par shes pa ni ming ste /
translated: ‚ÄúKnowledge‚Äù is a name,

original: shes par byed ces pa shes pa ste blo'o //
analyzed: shes par byed ces pa shes pa ste blo'o //
translated: ‚Äúcognizer‚Äù is knowledge, i.e., mind.

original: byis pa thams cad dang thun mong gi blo ni kun shes pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa thams cad dang thun mong gi blo ni kun shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll-knowledge‚Äù is the mind common to all childish beings.

original: byis pa rnams kyi rab tu 'jug pa can du shes par byed cing phyin ci log pa nyid du yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir btags pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi rab tu 'jug pa can du shes par byed cing phyin ci log pa nyid du yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir btags pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDesignation‚Äù is that which causes the childish to engage, because it is not known to be erroneous.

original: 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa thams cad kyis tha snyad du byed pa 'di ni tha snyad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa thams cad kyis tha snyad du byed pa 'di ni tha snyad do //
translated: ‚ÄúConvention‚Äù is that which is used conventionally by all ƒÅryas and non-ƒÅryas.

original: de la 'phags pa rnams kyis ni btags pa log pa nyid du rtogs shing gzhan yang rtogs par byed la /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa rnams kyis ni btags pa log pa nyid du rtogs shing gzhan yang rtogs par byed la /
translated: Among them, ƒÅryas understand designation to be erroneous and cause others to understand it as well.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams ni bden pa nyid du 'dod cing bdag nyid kyang rab tu 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams ni bden pa nyid du 'dod cing bdag nyid kyang rab tu 'jug par byed do //
translated: Non-ƒÅryas assert it to be true and cause themselves to engage in it.

original: 'di la zhes pa'i bshad pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes pa'i bshad pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la zhes pa'o //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúhere‚Äù is ‚Äúin the five appropriated aggregates.‚Äù

original: ming la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes te /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes te /
translated: The explanation of the name, etc. is that a bodhisattva

original: ngo bo nyid med cing bdag med pa'i phung po lnga rnams la byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa ni btags pa la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med cing bdag med pa'i phung po lnga rnams la byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa ni btags pa la /
translated: is a designation for the five aggregates which are essenceless and selfless.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu'o zhes pa ni bsdus @47a * //üîΩpa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu'o zhes pa ni bsdus @47a * // pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, this is the summarized meaning: ‚ÄúHe is like an illusory person.‚Äù

original: 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes ni rigs kyi gnas skabs su byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes ni rigs kyi gnas skabs su byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa ni /
translated: ƒÄrya Vimuktisena explains that the bodhisattva stage is the stage of the lineage.üîΩIn the stage of generating the mind, the bodhisattva is known

original: ming nyid gcig pu la sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs su ni /üîΩshes par byed ces par shes pa ste /
analyzed: ming nyid gcig pu la sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs su ni / shes par byed ces par shes pa ste /
translated: by the mere name.üîΩIn the stage of entering the mind, the bodhisattva is knownüîΩby the sign of generating the mind.

original: gang gi kun shes pa sems la 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa ni rnam par rig pa la ste /
analyzed: gang gi kun shes pa sems la 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa ni rnam par rig pa la ste /
translated: In the stage of the path of preparation, the bodhisattva is known

original: rgyu mtshan de kun shes pa ni kun shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan de kun shes pa ni kun shes pa'o //
translated: by the sign of understanding all.üîΩIn the stage of the path of seeing, the bodhisattva is knownüîΩby the sign of understanding all.üîΩIn the seven stages of preparation, the bodhisattva is known

original: sbyor ba'i sa bdun rnams la chos thams cad btags pa tsam nyid du rtogs pa ni btags pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sa bdun rnams la chos thams cad btags pa tsam nyid du rtogs pa ni btags pa'o //
translated: by the sign of understanding all.üîΩIn the stage of the eighth, ninth, and tenth, the bodhisattva is knownüîΩby the sign of understanding all.üîΩIn the stage of the Buddha, the bodhisattva is knownüîΩby the sign of understanding all.

original: brgyad pa la sogs par mtshan ma med cing lhun gyis grub pa'i lam thob pas tha snyad tsam gyi chos thams cad brjod pas tha snyad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: brgyad pa la sogs par mtshan ma med cing lhun gyis grub pa'i lam thob pas tha snyad tsam gyi chos thams cad brjod pas tha snyad ces gsungs so //
translated: On the eighth stage and so on, because one obtains the path that is signless and effortless, all phenomena are merely conventional expressions, and so they are called ‚Äúconventional.‚Äù

original: de de bzhin no zhes pa gnyis ni yongs su mgu ba'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes pa gnyis ni yongs su mgu ba'o //
translated: The two ‚Äújust so‚Äù phrases are the complete satisfaction.

original: des na zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu sgyu ma'i rang bzhin don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa dang ro gcig pa'i skyes bu de bzhin du bdag nyid mthong zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu sgyu ma'i rang bzhin don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa dang ro gcig pa'i skyes bu de bzhin du bdag nyid mthong zhes pa'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means ‚Äújust as the illusory person is seen.‚Äù The meaning is that just as the illusory person is of the nature of illusion on the conventional level and is of the same taste as the ultimate reality that is the absence of intrinsic existence, so too is the self seen.

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sngags la sogs pa'i tshogs pas sprul pa nyid kyi sgyu ma de'i ngo bo skyes bu de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang las kyi tshogs pas sprul pas sgyu ma nyid bzhin du skyes bur nges par byas la /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sngags la sogs pa'i tshogs pas sprul pa nyid kyi sgyu ma de'i ngo bo skyes bu de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang las kyi tshogs pas sprul pas sgyu ma nyid bzhin du skyes bur nges par byas la /
translated: Just as the magician, through the combination of the mantra and so on, conjures up the illusion, and the nature of that illusion is the person, so too, through the combination of afflictions and karma, one is ascertained to be a person, who is like an illusion.

original: 'dir sgyu ma'i skyes bu nyid yin yang ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs mthong bas so //
analyzed: 'dir sgyu ma'i skyes bu nyid yin yang ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs mthong bas so //
translated: Here, although it is a magical person, it is seen in the state of defilement and purification.

original: 'di zhes pa ni ci 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni ci 'dra ba'o //
translated: Here means what kind.

original: de la zhes pa ni de 'dra ba rnams so //
analyzed: de la zhes pa ni de 'dra ba rnams so //
translated: There means those kinds.

original: de ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po sgyu ma lta bur gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po sgyu ma lta bur gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the five appropriated aggregates are said to be like illusions.

original: sngags la sogs pas sprul pa'i sgyu ma'i skyes bu ni sems med pa'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po nyid la /
analyzed: sngags la sogs pas sprul pa'i sgyu ma'i skyes bu ni sems med pa'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po nyid la /
translated: The magical person conjured up by spells and so on is the form aggregate itself, because it has no mind.

original: skye mched drug ni gang du skyes bus btags la /
analyzed: skye mched drug ni gang du skyes bus btags la /
translated: The six sense bases are where the person is designated.

original: yod ces pa ni zhar la 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: yod ces pa ni zhar la 'ongs pa ste /
translated: The existence is an aside.

original: dbang po drug gzung ngo //
analyzed: dbang po drug gzung ngo //
translated: The six sense faculties are grasped.

original: rang bzhin du ni phung po rnams la skyes bu zhes par btags pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin du ni phung po rnams la skyes bu zhes par btags pa ste /
translated: The person is designated in the aggregates by nature.

original: lhag ma la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in the rest as well.

original: de ltar na dgu po nyid ni phung po la sogs pa la skyes bur btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dgu po nyid ni phung po la sogs pa la skyes bur btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Thus, the nine are the conceptions of the person in the aggregates and so on.

original: sgyu ma nyid gzugs la zhes pa nas ji srid du rnam par shes pa zhes pa'i bar ni phung por btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid gzugs la zhes pa nas ji srid du rnam par shes pa zhes pa'i bar ni phung por btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The passage from ‚Äúillusion itself is form‚Äù up to ‚Äúillusion itself is consciousness‚Äù is the conceptualization of the aggregates.

original: sgyu ma nyid mig ces pa nas @47b ji srid du chos la zhes pa'i bar gyi skye mched du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //üîΩsgyu ma nyid mig dang gzugs rnam par shes pa zhes pa nas ji srid du sgyu ma nyid yid dang chos kyi dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes pa'i bar ni zhes pa nas ji srid du sgyu ma nyid nam mkha'i khams la sgyu ma nyid rnam
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid mig ces pa nas @47b ji srid du chos la zhes pa'i bar gyi skye mched du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o // sgyu ma nyid mig dang gzugs rnam par shes pa zhes pa nas ji srid du sgyu ma nyid yid dang chos kyi dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes pa'i bar ni zhes pa nas ji srid du sgyu ma nyid nam mkha'i khams la sgyu ma nyid rnam
translated: The passage from ‚Äúillusion itself is the eye‚Äù up to ‚Äúillusion itself is mental objects‚Äù is the conceptualization of the sense bases.üîΩThe passage from ‚Äúillusion itself is the eye, form, and visual consciousness‚Äù up to ‚Äúillusion itself is the mind, mental objects, and mental consciousness‚Äù is the conceptualization of the elements.

original: par shes pa'i khams zhes pa ni khams kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: par shes pa'i khams zhes pa ni khams kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The passage from ‚Äúillusion itself is the element of space‚Äù up to ‚Äúillusion itself is the element of consciousness‚Äù is the conceptualization of the elements.

original: sgyu ma nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sgyu ma nyid ma rig pa nas ji srid du sgyu ma nyid rga shi zhes pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sgyu ma nyid ma rig pa nas ji srid du sgyu ma nyid rga shi zhes pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The passage from ‚Äúillusion itself is dependent origination‚Äù up to ‚Äúillusion itself is ignorance‚Äù up to ‚Äúillusion itself is aging and death‚Äù is the conceptualization of dependent origination.

original: sgyu ma nyid byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zhes pa ni rnam par byang bar btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zhes pa ni rnam par byang bar btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIllusion itself is the thirty-seven factors of awakening‚Äù is the conceptualization that is imputed as purification.

original: sgyu ma nyid stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa zhes pa ni mthong ba'i lam du rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa zhes pa ni mthong ba'i lam du rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIllusion itself is emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness‚Äù is the conceptualization of the path of seeing.

original: sgyu ma nyid bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIllusion itself is the meditative concentrations and formless absorptions‚Äù is the conceptualization of the path of cultivation.

original: sgyu ma nyid thams cad stong pa zhes pa ni khyad par gyi lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid thams cad stong pa zhes pa ni khyad par gyi lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIllusion itself is the emptiness of everything‚Äù is the conceptualization that is imputed as the special path.

original: sgyu ma nyid stobs bcu zhes pa nas ji srid du byang chub ces pa'i bar ni mi slob pa'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid stobs bcu zhes pa nas ji srid du byang chub ces pa'i bar ni mi slob pa'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIllusion itself is the ten powers, and so on, up to ‚Äòawakening‚Äô‚Äù is the conceptualization that is imputed as the path of no learning.

original: dgu po 'di rnams ni chos kyi mchog gis bsrabs par byed cing spong bar ni mi byed de /
analyzed: dgu po 'di rnams ni chos kyi mchog gis bsrabs par byed cing spong bar ni mi byed de /
translated: These nine are reduced by the supreme mundane state but are not eliminated.

original: 'dir 'di rnams dang ldan pas sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa dgu po spong ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir 'di rnams dang ldan pas sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa dgu po spong ba nyid do //
translated: Here, one who possesses these, first of all, abandons the nine conceptualizations.

original: de'i rjes la bar chad med pa ting nge 'dzin la gnas par byed do //
analyzed: de'i rjes la bar chad med pa ting nge 'dzin la gnas par byed do //
translated: After that, one abides in the uninterrupted meditative stabilization.

original: bar chad kyis bar chad byed par mi nus pas bar chad med pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad kyis bar chad byed par mi nus pas bar chad med pa'o //
translated: It is uninterrupted because obstacles cannot interrupt it.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de'i rjes su mthong ba'i lam du 'thad de /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de'i rjes su mthong ba'i lam du 'thad de /
translated: After that uninterrupted meditative stabilization, it is suitable as the path of seeing.

original: 'di ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgu pa'i gnyis pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgu pa'i gnyis pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the second of the nine conceptualizations of grasping.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par gyi rnam par rtog pa rnams sngon du mdor bstan nas /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par gyi rnam par rtog pa rnams sngon du mdor bstan nas /
translated: Having previously taught the conceptualizations of the distinctions of grasping,üîΩthe treatise explains the first extensive explanation of the family:üîΩThose who have the perfect MahƒÅyƒÅna familyüîΩare established as the support for the arising of the path of seeing.

original: rigs las dang po rgyas par bshad pa ni theg pa chen po'i rigs phun sum tshogs pa rnams 'di gang zhes so sor sgrub pa la dgongs nas 'dir de'i dbang du byas pa ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: rigs las dang po rgyas par bshad pa ni theg pa chen po'i rigs phun sum tshogs pa rnams 'di gang zhes so sor sgrub pa la dgongs nas 'dir de'i dbang du byas pa ni bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise says:

original: sems mi 'gong ba nyid sogs kyis //
analyzed: sems mi 'gong ba nyid sogs kyis //
translated: Because of not being discouraged and so on,

original: ngo bo nyid med sogs ston byed //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med sogs ston byed //
translated: the teachings on the lack of entity and so on are given.

original: de yi @48a * //üîΩmi mthun phyogs bor ba //üîΩrnam pa kun tu yongs 'dzin yin //üîΩzhes te / gang gis yang dag par 'dzin pa byed cing nang du 'jog pa dang 'dren pas yang dag par yongs su 'dzin pa la rnam pa kun ni rnam pa bzhi ste /üîΩthabs la mkhas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / de dag gis so so'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bor ba'o //üîΩdge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gnas skabs su gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de yi @48a * // mi mthun phyogs bor ba // rnam pa kun tu yongs 'dzin yin // zhes te / gang gis yang dag par 'dzin pa byed cing nang du 'jog pa dang 'dren pas yang dag par yongs su 'dzin pa la rnam pa kun ni rnam pa bzhi ste / thabs la mkhas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / de dag gis so so'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bor ba'o // dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gnas skabs su gsungs pa ni /
translated: 3. The complete embracing of the latter,üîΩin all its aspects, is the avoidance of the adverseüîΩconditions.üîΩThe complete embracing of the latter, of the embracing of the true Dharma, is the avoidance of the adverse conditions in all its aspects. The embracing of the true Dharma is the embracing of the Dharma by means of the correct embracing and the correct establishment of it. The complete embracing of the latter is the embracing of the Dharma in all its aspects. The aspects are four:üîΩskill in means, the spiritual friend, and the avoidance of the adverse conditions of each of them.üîΩThe spiritual friend is mentioned in the context of the spiritual friend.üîΩ

original: skrag par mi 'gyur ram zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩ'di ltar sgyu ma'i skyes bu bstan pa la dngang ba ni skrag nas bred pa la /üîΩskrag pa ni skrag pa dang ldan pa'o //üîΩkun tu skrag pa ni kun tu skrag pa ste /üîΩde nyid kyi rgyun la kun tu skrag pa dang ldan pa'o //üîΩde'i gnyen po'i phyogs ni mi zhum pa nyid de /
analyzed: skrag par mi 'gyur ram zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩ'di ltar sgyu ma'i skyes bu bstan pa la dngang ba ni skrag nas bred pa la /üîΩskrag pa ni skrag pa dang ldan pa'o //üîΩkun tu skrag pa ni kun tu skrag pa ste /üîΩde nyid kyi rgyun la kun tu skrag pa dang ldan pa'o //üîΩde'i gnyen po'i phyogs ni mi zhum pa nyid de /

original: kun tu mi zhum pa nyid dang / sgyid mi lug pa nyid de /
analyzed: kun tu mi zhum pa nyid dang / sgyid mi lug pa nyid de /
translated: It is not being discouraged and not being lazy.

original: sems mi 'gong ba nyid sogs zhes pas gang du de bshad de ;
analyzed: sems mi 'gong ba nyid sogs zhes pas gang du de bshad de ;
translated: ‚ÄúNot being discouraged‚Äù and so on is explained in the noble S≈´tra on the Jewel at the Crown of the Head.

original: thabs la mkhas pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúSkill in means‚Äù is the meaning.

original: de la gang zhig chos rnams thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa la nges par bstan pa dag gis mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos rnams la spyod pa de rnams yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ni de'i thabs
analyzed: de la gang zhig chos rnams thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa la nges par bstan pa dag gis mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos rnams la spyod pa de rnams yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ni de'i thabs
translated: There, those who practice the wholesome actions of the spiritual life, by means of the application of nonapprehending to the teachings that show that all things are essenceless, dedicate those to complete perfect enlightenment. That is skill in means.

original: la mkhas pa la bzlog pa'i thabs la mi mkhas pa la ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: la mkhas pa la bzlog pa'i thabs la mi mkhas pa la ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa 'byung ste /
translated: But for those who are not skilled in the means of reversal, the influence of MƒÅra arises.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus la sogs pa'i bya ba'i bdud kyi skyon rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus la sogs pa'i bya ba'i bdud kyi skyon rnams so //
translated: These are the faults of MƒÅra in the activities of the body and so on of bodhisattvas.

original: 'di ltar zhes pa ni byang chub kyi spyod pa la bar chad byed pa nyid de de rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes pa ni byang chub kyi spyod pa la bar chad byed pa nyid de de rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù refers to the obstacles to the practice of enlightenment, which should be understood.

original: 'di zhes pa ni ngas khyod la kun tu bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni ngas khyod la kun tu bshad pa'o //
translated: This is what I have explained to you.

original: bdud kyi las ni bdud rang nyid kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i cha byad byas nas gang zhig gis log pa'i lam ston par byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: bdud kyi las ni bdud rang nyid kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i cha byad byas nas gang zhig gis log pa'i lam ston par byed pa rnams so //
translated: The works of Mara are those which cause one to be led astray by Mara himself, who has assumed the guise of a Buddha, etc.

original: 'di dag ces pa ni byang chub kyi spyod pa la 'byed pa po nyid rtogs par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ces pa ni byang chub kyi spyod pa la 'byed pa po nyid rtogs par bya ba ste /
translated: These, i.e., those who cause a schism in the practice of the career of the Bodhisattvas, should be understood.

original: don gyis gang pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnams dag la 'byed par byed pa dang gang 'di bdud kyi las mi ston pa de ni sdig pa'i grogs po'o zhes don gyis rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gyis gang pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnams dag la 'byed par byed pa dang gang 'di bdud kyi las mi ston pa de ni sdig pa'i grogs po'o zhes don gyis rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that one should understand that he who causes a schism in these perfections and does not reveal the works of Mara is a bad friend.

original: 'di dag ces pa ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ces pa ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: These, i.e., the perfections, are summarized.

original: go cha chen po bgos pa yi //
analyzed: go cha chen po bgos pa yi //
translated: The armor is the resolve for enlightenment.üîΩThis is the armor practice.

original: zhes pa 'dis ni 'dir ni go cha'i sgrub pa yang bsdus la de bsgrub par bya @48b ba'i rten gyi dbang du byas pa ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis ni 'dir ni go cha'i sgrub pa yang bsdus la de bsgrub par bya @48b ba'i rten gyi dbang du byas pa ni bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise mentions the basis for the practice of the armor.

original: rtogs pa yis ni chos drug dang // gnyen po dang ni spong ba dang // de dag yongs su gtugs pa dang // shes rab snying brtser bcas pa dang // slob ma thun mong min nyid dang // gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dang // ye shes rtsol ba mi mnga' ba //
analyzed: rtogs pa yis ni chos drug dang // gnyen po dang ni spong ba dang // de dag yongs su gtugs pa dang // shes rab snying brtser bcas pa dang // slob ma thun mong min nyid dang // gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dang // ye shes rtsol ba mi mnga' ba //
translated: the disciples, the unshared,üîΩthe order of the other's benefit,üîΩand the effortless wisdom.

original: 'jug pa'i rten la rigs zhes bya //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rten la rigs zhes bya //
translated: The basis of engagement is called the potential.

original: zhes te / so sor nges pa 'dir rten te sgrub pa'i rten zhes pa la sogs pas bdun pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i go cha'i sgrub pa'i rten mdor bstan cing /
analyzed: zhes te / so sor nges pa 'dir rten te sgrub pa'i rten zhes pa la sogs pas bdun pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i go cha'i sgrub pa'i rten mdor bstan cing /
translated: Here, the basis of accomplishment is the basis of the seven, beginning with realization, as indicated by the words the basis of accomplishment.

original: de'i nang du yod pa'i 'jug pa la sogs pa'i sgrub pa rnams kyi rten yang bstan nas /
analyzed: de'i nang du yod pa'i 'jug pa la sogs pa'i sgrub pa rnams kyi rten yang bstan nas /
translated: Having indicated the basis of the accomplishment of the armor of realization, it also indicates the basis of the accomplishments of engagement and so forth that are contained within it.

original: rtogs pa'i chos drug ces pa la sogs pa ste rgyas par bshad de /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i chos drug ces pa la sogs pa ste rgyas par bshad de /
translated: The six qualities of realization and so forth are explained extensively.

original: shugs kyis rtogs par bya ba ni sems dang po bskyed par bya ba nas brtsams pa'i drod dang rtse mo dang bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam drug po rnams la drod la sogs pa bzhi ba'i rtog pa ni chos nyid rtogs par byed pa 'di de kho na nyid la mos pa brtan pos gnyen po'i tshogs ye shes kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad pa
analyzed: shugs kyis rtogs par bya ba ni sems dang po bskyed par bya ba nas brtsams pa'i drod dang rtse mo dang bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam drug po rnams la drod la sogs pa bzhi ba'i rtog pa ni chos nyid rtogs par byed pa 'di de kho na nyid la mos pa brtan pos gnyen po'i tshogs ye shes kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad pa
translated: The conception of the four such as heat and so on is the realization of dharmata, and through the stable interest in thatness, the collection of antidotes, the opposing factors of wisdom are exhausted.

original: dang de dag yongs su gtugs pa ni mthar thug par 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: dang de dag yongs su gtugs pa ni mthar thug par 'gro ba ste /
translated: The thorough investigation of those is the culmination of going.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs rab tu son nas mthar thug pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad pa'i mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs rab tu son nas mthar thug pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad pa'i mthar thug pa ste /
translated: Having fully reached the side of the antidote, through culmination, the culmination of the exhaustion of the opposing factors is the realization of the culmination of the path of meditation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung pos tshul khrims 'chal pa la sogs pa spangs zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung pos tshul khrims 'chal pa la sogs pa spangs zhes pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúthe aggregates of discipline and so on of the tathagatas abandon immorality and so on‚Äù is as follows.

original: shes rab dang snying rje dag ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa ni ye shes so //
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje dag ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa ni ye shes so //
translated: Wisdom and compassion are not shared with the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi go rims ni rgyun ma chad pa dang lhun gyis grub pas ye shes 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi go rims ni rgyun ma chad pa dang lhun gyis grub pas ye shes 'jug pa'o //
translated: The order of the benefit of others is the engagement of wisdom through uninterrupted and spontaneous activity.

original: gang zhig rang bzhin rnam par dag pa glo bur gyi dri ma rnams kyi nang du chud pa de nyid ni byang chub kyi rigs so //
analyzed: gang zhig rang bzhin rnam par dag pa glo bur gyi dri ma rnams kyi nang du chud pa de nyid ni byang chub kyi rigs so //
translated: The very thing that is naturally pure but is included within the impurities is the family of enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rang bzhin gyis gnas pa zhes pa'i ming can nyid kyi ma rig pa la sogs pa'i mun pa nub pa ni rim gyis sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis po rnams kyi rten te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rang bzhin gyis gnas pa zhes pa'i ming can nyid kyi ma rig pa la sogs pa'i mun pa nub pa ni rim gyis sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis po rnams kyi rten te /
translated: The very thing that is called the ‚ÄútathƒÅgata-essence that naturally abides‚Äù is the basis of the twenty-two types of generating the mind of enlightenment in stages, which is the subsiding of the darkness of ignorance and so forth.üîΩThus, ƒÄrya Vimuktisena says:

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes sems bskyed pa nas brtsams pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi po rnams @49a * //üîΩla zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes sems bskyed pa nas brtsams pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi po rnams @49a * //üîΩla zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe four aspects of the factors conducive to penetration that begin with generating the mind of enlightenment‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: de nyid kyis na seng ge bzang po'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rten no zhes pa ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na seng ge bzang po'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rten no zhes pa ni mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not correct to say that the elements leading to penetration of the Bodhisattvas are the support of the Reality realm.

original: de yang chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyi med pa nyid mtshan nyid ni 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir na chos kyi dbyings nyid de /
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyi med pa nyid mtshan nyid ni 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir na chos kyi dbyings nyid de /
translated: The Reality realm is the cause of the noble dharmas because it is the non-existence of all dharmas by intrinsic reality.
